original: de la 'du byed gang yang med do zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams so //
analyzed: de la 'du byed gang yang med do zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams so //
translated: “There is no formation whatsoever” refers to the aggregates.

original: de ni 'dus ma byas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni 'dus ma byas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “That is unconditioned”

original: de brjod par bya ba'i phyir de thams cad gsungs so ;
analyzed: de brjod par bya ba'i phyir de thams cad gsungs so ;
translated: refers to the fact that all of that is described as unconditioned.

original: / de ni 'dus ma byas de rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: / de ni 'dus ma byas de rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: That is the presentation of the unconditioned.

original: de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs so zhes bya ba ni de la dmigs pas 'phags pa'i dngos po rnyed pa dang / des rab tu phye ba ni 'phags pa rnams so //
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs so zhes bya ba ni de la dmigs pas 'phags pa'i dngos po rnyed pa dang / des rab tu phye ba ni 'phags pa rnams so //
translated: “That is the lineage of the noble ones” means that the noble ones obtain the state of being an ārya by observing that, and they are distinguished by that.

original: rigs de yang phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas rab tu phye ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mya ngan las 'das pas rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: rigs de yang phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas rab tu phye ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mya ngan las 'das pas rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: That lineage is distinguished by the nirvāṇa that has the remainder of the aggregates and the nirvāṇa that lacks the remainder of the aggregates, and it is distinguished by the bodhisattva’s nirvāṇa.

original: de la phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus byas nas /🔽bslab pa yang med /
analyzed: de la phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus byas nas / bslab pa yang med /
translated: With regard to that, after the nirvāṇa that has the remainder of the aggregates has been attained,🔽there is no training,

original: bslab pa las 'das pa yang med ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bslab pa las 'das pa yang med ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: and there is no transgression of the training.

original: legs par bslab pa'i phyir ro //🔽rgyu ba med pa ni phung po spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par bslab pa'i phyir ro // rgyu ba med pa ni phung po spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is well-trained.🔽It is not moving, because it has abandoned the aggregates.

original: mi rgyu ba med pa ni phung po spangs pa'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rgyu ba med pa ni phung po spangs pa'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not non-moving, because it has a remainder of aggregates.

original: rab tu rgyu ba yang med pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rab tu rgyu ba yang med pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: It is not moving, because it is without afflictions.

original: de la sems med kyang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang med do zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can rnams so //
analyzed: de la sems med kyang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang med do zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can rnams so //
translated: It is not non-moving, because it is without mental factors, even though it is without mind.

original: de la las kyang med ces bya ba ni yang srid pa'i las kyi rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la las kyang med ces bya ba ni yang srid pa'i las kyi rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: It is not an action, because it is not produced from the cause of action that leads to rebirth.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa yang med ces bya ba ni phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa yang med ces bya ba ni phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is not the ripening of action, because it is taught from the perspective of nirvāṇa without remainder of the aggregates.

original: de bas na de ltar bde ba yang med /
analyzed: de bas na de ltar bde ba yang med /
translated: Therefore, in this way, it is without pleasure.🔽It is also without pain.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang med pa de ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang med pa de ni /
translated: This is the

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi @242a * //🔽rigs so zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi @242a * //🔽rigs so zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: lineage of the noble ones.

original: rigs de la ni las kyang med /
analyzed: rigs de la ni las kyang med /
translated: In that spiritual gene there is no karma,

original: las mngon par 'du byed pa yang med do //
analyzed: las mngon par 'du byed pa yang med do //
translated: nor is there any formation of karma.

original: rigs de las lus kyi las byed pa med do //
analyzed: rigs de las lus kyi las byed pa med do //
translated: In that spiritual gene there is no physical karma,

original: ngag gi las ma yin /
analyzed: ngag gi las ma yin /
translated: nor is there any verbal karma,🔽nor is there any mental karma.

original: yid kyi ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo'i tshig gsum po dag gis ni las dbye ba rab tu dgag par byed do //
analyzed: yid kyi ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo'i tshig gsum po dag gis ni las dbye ba rab tu dgag par byed do //
translated: By these three scriptural statements he refutes the classification of karma.

original: bya ba dang bslab pa dang de'i sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bya ba dang bslab pa dang de'i sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to activity, training, and application,🔽he refutes the classification of sentient beings, saying,

original: rigs de la tha ma dang 'bring dang mchog tu rnam par gzhag pa yang med de zhes bya bas sems can gyi dbye ba rab tu dgag par byed de /
analyzed: rigs de la tha ma dang 'bring dang mchog tu rnam par gzhag pa yang med de zhes bya bas sems can gyi dbye ba rab tu dgag par byed de /
translated: In that spiritual gene there is no inferior, middling, or superior.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to the bodhisattva’s nirvana,

original: rigs de ni snyoms pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rigs de ni snyoms pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, That spiritual gene is even.

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan par 'jug pa snyoms pas de'i khyad par ston to //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan par 'jug pa snyoms pas de'i khyad par ston to //
translated: It is even in its engagement for the benefit of self and other. This shows its superiority.

original: rigs de ni khyad par med pa'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad chad pa med pas byang chub sems dpa' rnam par dag pa rnams dang / de khyad par med par ston te ;🔽rigs de ni dben pa'o //
analyzed: rigs de ni khyad par med pa'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad chad pa med pas byang chub sems dpa' rnam par dag pa rnams dang / de khyad par med par ston te ; rigs de ni dben pa'o //
translated: That spiritual lineage is undifferentiated is the teaching that the bodhisattvas who are purified are undifferentiated from all the factors of enlightenment, because they are not interrupted.

original: zhes bya ba ni de dag gi rgyud tha dad pa med par ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dag gi rgyud tha dad pa med par ston to //
translated: That spiritual lineage is isolated is the teaching that there is no difference in their mental continuum.

original: rigs de ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang mthun pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud la las de'i khyad par ston to //
analyzed: rigs de ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang mthun pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud la las de'i khyad par ston to //
translated: That spiritual lineage is conducive to nirvana is the teaching that it is the cause of nirvana in the mental continuum of another.

original: rigs de ni dri ma med pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba thun mong yin du zin kyang bag chags spong ba'i khyad par ston to ;
analyzed: rigs de ni dri ma med pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba thun mong yin du zin kyang bag chags spong ba'i khyad par ston to ;
translated: That spiritual lineage is immaculate is the teaching that, although liberation is common to all, there is a difference in the elimination of the propensities.

original: / rigs de ni nga'i ba med do zhes bya ba ni zhing rnam par dag pa rnams la so sor nges pa med pa ston to //
analyzed: / rigs de ni nga'i ba med do zhes bya ba ni zhing rnam par dag pa rnams la so sor nges pa med pa ston to //
translated: That spiritual lineage is unattached is the teaching that there is no determination in regard to the purified fields.

original: rigs de ni mnyam pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni las de mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'khor ba'i yon tan dang / nyes pa la rnam par mi rtog pas mnyam pa nyid ston to //
analyzed: rigs de ni mnyam pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni las de mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'khor ba'i yon tan dang / nyes pa la rnam par mi rtog pas mnyam pa nyid ston to //
translated: That lineage is unequaled means that it is equal because of the non-discrimination of the virtues and faults of nirvana and samsara, respectively.

original: yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i mnyam pa las 'byung ba zhes bya ba la bden pa'i don gyis yang dag pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i mnyam pa las 'byung ba zhes bya ba la bden pa'i don gyis yang dag pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: It arises from the equality of the real and the unreal means that nirvana is the real in the sense of being the truth.

original: brdzun pa'i don gyis yang dag pa ma yin pa ni 'khor bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: brdzun pa'i don gyis yang dag pa ma yin pa ni 'khor bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Samsara should be known as the unreal in the sense of being false.

original: rigs de ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin pas bden pa'o zhes bya ba gdams ngag de slu ba ma yin pas gzhan mu stegs can rnams dang thun mong ba ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: rigs de ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin pas bden pa'o zhes bya ba gdams ngag de slu ba ma yin pas gzhan mu stegs can rnams dang thun mong ba ma yin par ston to //
translated: That lineage is the truth because it is the ultimate truth means that the instruction is not deceptive, and it is not common to the heterodox.

original: rigs de ni mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma ma lus par mya ngan las 'das kyang sems can gyi don bya ba rgyun mi gcod par ston to //
analyzed: rigs de ni mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma ma lus par mya ngan las 'das kyang sems can gyi don bya ba rgyun mi gcod par ston to //
translated: That lineage is inexhaustible means that even in nirvana without remainder, the activity for the sake of sentient beings is uninterrupted.

original: de ni rab tu ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis mi skye'i 'byor ba 'thob pa'i dbang gis de ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rab tu ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis mi skye'i 'byor ba 'thob pa'i dbang gis de ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is called “utterly unborn” because it is not born through the power of karma and the afflictions, but is shown to be born through the power of attaining mastery.

original: @242b de rigs de ni rtag pa'o zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'khor ba'i dus na yang gzhan ma yin par ston te /
analyzed: @242b de rigs de ni rtag pa'o zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'khor ba'i dus na yang gzhan ma yin par ston te /
translated: That lineage is permanent, because it is shown to be not different at the time of nirvana and at the time of samsara.

original: de'i phyir bde ba dang / dge ba dang / bdag med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba dang / dge ba dang / bdag med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “bliss,” “virtue,” and “selflessness.”

original: rigs de ni rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes bya rnam par dag par ston te /
analyzed: rigs de ni rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes bya rnam par dag par ston te /
translated: That lineage is pure, because it is shown to be the purity of the knowable.

original: rnam par sbyang bar bya zhing bsam pa rnam par dag pa yang de tsam du yongs su ston pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par sbyang bar bya zhing bsam pa rnam par dag pa yang de tsam du yongs su ston pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is also shown to be the purity of intention, which is to be purified.

original: 'di nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bar gyi gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa don chen por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bar gyi gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa don chen por rig par bya'o //
translated: From here on, the establishment of the antidote up to the supramundane should be understood as having great meaning.

original: 'di ni mtshams sbyar ba dang / go rims bzhin yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshams sbyar ba dang / go rims bzhin yin no //
translated: This is the connection and the sequence.

original: 'od srungs byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don la brtson par bya ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don la brtson par bya ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, a bodhisattva should strive for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: des dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par bsdus par bya'o //
analyzed: des dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par bsdus par bya'o //
translated: Through that, he should gather all the roots of virtue.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par bsdus nas sems can thams cad la btang ngo //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par bsdus nas sems can thams cad la btang ngo //
translated: Having gathered all the roots of virtue, he should give them to all sentient beings.

original: ye shes kyi sman gang sdud pa des zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis gzhan gyi don byed par ston to ;
analyzed: ye shes kyi sman gang sdud pa des zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis gzhan gyi don byed par ston to ;
translated: The “medicine of wisdom” that he gathers is the benefit for others through mundane and supramundane wisdom.

original: / phyogs bzhir song ste zhes bya ba la phyogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: / phyogs bzhir song ste zhes bya ba la phyogs gang zhe na /
translated: “He goes to the four directions” — what are the directions?

original: sems can 'dul ba'i phyir khams nas 'pho ba ste /
analyzed: sems can 'dul ba'i phyir khams nas 'pho ba ste /
translated: They are the realms that are the objects of training for sentient beings.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du 'gro ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams de nyid nas yul gzhan du 'pho ba dang / skye bas 'pho ba ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du 'gro ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams de nyid nas yul gzhan du 'pho ba dang / skye bas 'pho ba ste /
translated: He goes from one world-realm to another through the power of his magical abilities, he goes to other places within that very world-realm, and he goes through rebirth.

original: de gnyi gar skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gzhan las tshol ba ste /
analyzed: de gnyi gar skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gzhan las tshol ba ste /
translated: He is the one who takes up both of these, and who seeks from others.

original: sems can gang byang chub sems dpa' gang gis 'dul bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir tshol ba'o //
analyzed: sems can gang byang chub sems dpa' gang gis 'dul bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir tshol ba'o //
translated: He seeks for the sake of those sentient beings who are to be disciplined by a certain bodhisattva.

original: sems can rnams la yang dag par gso bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la yang dag par gso bar bya'o //
translated: He should heal sentient beings.

original: yang dag par gso bas sems can rnams gso'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i 'byung bo la gso ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag par gso bas sems can rnams gso'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i 'byung bo la gso ba ste /
translated: By healing, he heals sentient beings. This is the healing of the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'byung po'i gdon gyis zin pa'i sems can rnams gso ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni bslab pa rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par dag pa'i lam ston pas sman pa bla na med pa yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'byung po'i gdon gyis zin pa'i sems can rnams gso ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni bslab pa rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par dag pa'i lam ston pas sman pa bla na med pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who heals sentient beings who are seized by the demons of the afflictions is the unsurpassed physician, because he teaches the path of purification by means of the three trainings.

original: sman pa'i rgyal po 'tsho byed la sogs pas ni lta ba la gnas pa dang 'gyod pa la gnas pa gso bar mi nus so //
analyzed: sman pa'i rgyal po 'tsho byed la sogs pas ni lta ba la gnas pa dang 'gyod pa la gnas pa gso bar mi nus so //
translated: The physicians such as Jivaka are not able to heal those who are seized by the demons of wrong views and remorse.

original: yang na yang dag pa'i gso ba zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid kyis gso ba ni yang dag pa'i gso ba ste /
analyzed: yang na yang dag pa'i gso ba zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid kyis gso ba ni yang dag pa'i gso ba ste /
translated: Alternatively, the healing of reality is the correct healing.

original: yang dag pa dang de kho na nyid ni don tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa dang de kho na nyid ni don tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Reality and the real are not different things.

original: de kho na'i gso pa de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi bag la nyal kun du 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na'i gso pa de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi bag la nyal kun du 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that healing of reality is also the complete destruction of the latent proclivities of the supramundane path.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i ye shes ni rnam pa @243a * //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i ye shes ni rnam pa @243a * //
translated: Therein, mundane knowledge is twofold:

original: gnyis te / che long dang / 'bring ngo //
analyzed: gnyis te / che long dang / 'bring ngo //
translated: gross and subtle.

original: de la che long ni rab tu sel ba'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de la che long ni rab tu sel ba'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Therein, the gross is the antidote of complete elimination.

original: 'bring ni rnam par gnon pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: 'bring ni rnam par gnon pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: The subtle is the antidote of complete penetration.

original: de la yang dag pa'i gso ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i gso ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the correct healing?

original: gang 'di 'dod chags la mi sdug pas gso ba nas phyin ci log thams cad spang ba'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa bzhi zhes bya ba'i bar dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa che long rab tu sel ba'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: gang 'di 'dod chags la mi sdug pas gso ba nas phyin ci log thams cad spang ba'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa bzhi zhes bya ba'i bar dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa che long rab tu sel ba'i gnyen po'o //
translated: That which is the healing of desire by means of the impurity meditation, up to the healing of all the errors by means of the four right efforts for the abandonment of all errors. These are the antidotes of the complete elimination of the gross defilements.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'bring rnam par gnon pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'bring rnam par gnon pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness up to the eightfold noble path are the antidote for the middling afflictions.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa che long mngon du gyur na ni yul la 'dod chags la sogs pa kun du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa che long mngon du gyur na ni yul la 'dod chags la sogs pa kun du 'byung ngo //
translated: When the gross afflictions are manifest, desire, etc. arise in regard to the object.

original: bzlog pa ni 'bring du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni 'bring du rig par bya'o //
translated: The middling should be understood in the opposite sense.

original: de la rnal 'byor spyod pa'i 'jig rten pa'i ye shes rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rab tu bsal rnam par mnan nas spyod pa rnam par sbyong ngo //
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor spyod pa'i 'jig rten pa'i ye shes rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rab tu bsal rnam par mnan nas spyod pa rnam par sbyong ngo //
translated: In this regard, the mundane knowledge of the spiritual practitioner, which has the nature of the object, eliminates and suppresses the afflictions, and purifies the conduct.

original: de la spyod pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni khyim pa rnams ni phal cher 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la spyod do //
analyzed: de la spyod pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni khyim pa rnams ni phal cher 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la spyod do //
translated: In this regard, the classification of conduct is as follows: householders generally engage in desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: rab tu 'byung ba rnams ni phal cher lta ba la gnas te /
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba rnams ni phal cher lta ba la gnas te /
translated: Those who have gone forth generally engage in views.

original: de la gnas pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la gnas pas ngo bo nyid la rnam par rtog pa dang / yang srid pa la smon par rnam par rtog pa dang / phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi po 'dus pa dang ;
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la gnas pas ngo bo nyid la rnam par rtog pa dang / yang srid pa la smon par rnam par rtog pa dang / phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi po 'dus pa dang ;
translated: Abiding in that, one abides in the conception of an intrinsic nature due to abiding in incorrect mental activity, the conception of aspiring for renewed existence, and the four errors, both combined and uncombined.

original: ma 'dus pa dag gis thar pa ma yin pa la thar par mngon par zhen cing gnas so //
analyzed: ma 'dus pa dag gis thar pa ma yin pa la thar par mngon par zhen cing gnas so //
translated: One abides in the manifest clinging to what is not liberation as liberation.

original: de la spyod pa rnam par sbyong ba'i gnyen po ni 'dod chags la mi sdug pa dang / zhe sdang la byams pa dang / gti mug la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / lta bar song ba thams cad la stong pa nyid dang /🔽tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pas /
analyzed: de la spyod pa rnam par sbyong ba'i gnyen po ni 'dod chags la mi sdug pa dang / zhe sdang la byams pa dang / gti mug la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / lta bar song ba thams cad la stong pa nyid dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pas /
translated: The antidote that purifies that conduct is the repulsiveness of desire, love for hatred, dependent origination for delusion, and emptiness for all views.

original: bsdus pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par la rtog pa mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par la rtog pa mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: The antidote that purifies the conception of an intrinsic nature is the signlessness that is the conception of the distinction of the nature that is included in incorrect mental activity.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / dmigs pa yid la byed pa thams cad la mtshan ma med pas gso ba'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang srid pa la smon pa la ni smon pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / dmigs pa yid la byed pa thams cad la mtshan ma med pas gso ba'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // yang srid pa la smon pa la ni smon pa med pa ste /
translated: It is the cure for all conceptual thoughts and all objective mental orientations, since they are signless.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams thams cad la gnas pa la smon pa med pas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams thams cad la gnas pa la smon pa med pas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cure for the wish for renewed existence, since it is the absence of wishes for all abodes in the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: thar pa ma yin pa la thar par mngon par zhen pa ni phyin ci log ste /
analyzed: thar pa ma yin pa la thar par mngon par zhen pa ni phyin ci log ste /
translated: The cure for the misapprehension of what is not liberation as liberation is the four undistorted states.

original: dper na tshangs pa'i gnas te de ni rtag go zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na tshangs pa'i gnas te de ni rtag go zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, the Brahma abodes are said to be permanent.

original: phyin ci log thams cad la phyin ci ma log pa bzhis @243b gso ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log thams cad la phyin ci ma log pa bzhis @243b gso ste /
translated: The four undistorted states cure all distorted states.

original: mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes pa la 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal la bde bar 'du shes pa la 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa la chos thams cad la bdag med pa dang /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes pa la 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal la bde bar 'du shes pa la 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa la chos thams cad la bdag med pa dang /
translated: The impermanent is perceived as permanent, and all compounded phenomena are impermanent.🔽Suffering is perceived as happiness, and all compounded phenomena are suffering.🔽The selfless is perceived as a self, and all phenomena are selfless.

original: mi sdug pa la sdug par 'du shes pa la mya ngan las 'das pa zhi bas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi sdug pa la sdug par 'du shes pa la mya ngan las 'das pa zhi bas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The antidote to the first is the impermanence of the impermanent, the antidote to the second is the suffering of the suffering, the antidote to the third is the selflessness of the selfless, and the antidote to the fourth is the peace of nirvana.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'bring gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'bring gang zhe na /
translated: What is middling affliction?

original: rang rang gi gnyen po la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs pa che long rab tu bsal ba'i yul la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rang rang gi gnyen po la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs pa che long rab tu bsal ba'i yul la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba gnas pa ste /
translated: It is the state of being afflicted by attachment, hostility, and ignorance with regard to the object of eliminating the gross afflictions by means of their individual antidotes.

original: mngon du gyur pa'i yul rnams la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa kun du mi 'byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon du gyur pa'i yul rnams la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa kun du mi 'byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that the faults of attachment and so on do not arise with regard to manifest objects.

original: de spang ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams bsgom mo //
analyzed: de spang ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams bsgom mo //
translated: In order to abandon that, the bodhisattva cultivates the dharmas such as the applications of mindfulness.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas ni yang dag pa'i dmigs pa la 'dod chags pa sems mnyam par ma bzhag par sbyor yang sgom pa des bdag dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas ni yang dag pa'i dmigs pa la 'dod chags pa sems mnyam par ma bzhag par sbyor yang sgom pa des bdag dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom mo //
translated: By cultivating the applications of mindfulness, he does not grasp at self in the cultivation of the applications of mindfulness, although he is not yet equipoised in the correct object of observation due to desire.

original: zhes bdag tu mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: zhes bdag tu mi 'dzin to //
translated: He does not grasp at self.

original: lus dang / sems dang / chos la gnas pa la dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi po dag gis gso ste /
analyzed: lus dang / sems dang / chos la gnas pa la dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi po dag gis gso ste /
translated: He is cured of the four applications of mindfulness that are based on the body, mind, and dharmas.

original: de lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba la gnas kyang /
analyzed: de lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba la gnas kyang /
translated: Although he abides in the observation of the body as body,

original: lus kyi lta bas bdag tu lta bar mi ltung /
analyzed: lus kyi lta bas bdag tu lta bar mi ltung /
translated: he does not fall into the view of self due to the view of the body.

original: tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba la gnas kyang /
analyzed: tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba la gnas kyang /
translated: Although he abides in the observation of feelings as feelings,

original: tshor ba'i rjes su lta bas bdag tu lta bar mi ltung /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rjes su lta bas bdag tu lta bar mi ltung /
translated: he does not fall into the view of self due to the observation of feelings.

original: sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba la gnas kyang sems kyi rjes su lta bas bdag tu lta bar mi ltung /
analyzed: sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba la gnas kyang sems kyi rjes su lta bas bdag tu lta bar mi ltung /
translated: Although he abides in the observation of mind as mind, he does not fall into the view of self due to the observation of mind.

original: chos rnams kyang chos kyi rjes su lta ba la gnas kyang chos kyi rjes su lta bas bdag tu lta bar mi ltung zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyang chos kyi rjes su lta ba la gnas kyang chos kyi rjes su lta bas bdag tu lta bar mi ltung zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: and also with regard to phenomena, he abides in the contemplation of the phenomena, but does not fall into the view of self with regard to the contemplation of the phenomena.

original: de ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi dmigs pa la sems btags pas yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams kyis yang dag par sbyor te /
analyzed: de ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi dmigs pa la sems btags pas yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams kyis yang dag par sbyor te /
translated: Thus, by fixing the mind on the object of the applications of mindfulness, he applies himself with the right efforts.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhis ni mi dge ba'i chos rnams spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhis ni mi dge ba'i chos rnams spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: For it is said, “By means of the four right efforts, he abandons the unwholesome and perfects all the wholesome.

original: de nas rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyis gnas pa yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: de nas rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyis gnas pa yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: ” Then, by means of the bases of spiritual success, he attains stability.

original: gnas pa yongs su bzung nas lus dang sems la skyes pa dang bud med kyi 'du shes su ril por 'dzin pa la rtog pas rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni @244a * //
analyzed: gnas pa yongs su bzung nas lus dang sems la skyes pa dang bud med kyi 'du shes su ril por 'dzin pa la rtog pas rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni @244a * //
translated: Having attained stability, he thoroughly investigates the body and mind, which are grasped as a unity by the notion of a woman or a man,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'bring rnam par mnan pa yin te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'bring rnam par mnan pa yin te /
translated: and thus he suppresses the middling defilements.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis ni lus dang sems la ril por 'dzin pa 'dor bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis ni lus dang sems la ril por 'dzin pa 'dor bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The four bases of supernatural powers cause one to abandon the grasping of body and mind as a whole.

original: de bas zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis sbyor ba'i lam na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma dad pa la sogs pa spangs nas gnyen po dad pa la gnas so //
analyzed: de bas zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis sbyor ba'i lam na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma dad pa la sogs pa spangs nas gnyen po dad pa la gnas so //
translated: Therefore, on the path of preparation, through uncontaminated wisdom, one abandons non-faith and so on, which are the factors incompatible with supramundane qualities, and one abides in faith, which is their antidote.

original: dbang po de dag nyid stobs rnams kyis brtan par byed do //
analyzed: dbang po de dag nyid stobs rnams kyis brtan par byed do //
translated: Those very faculties are made firm by the powers.

original: dbang po lnga dang / stobs lngas ni ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes bzhin med pa rnams gso ba'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang / stobs lngas ni ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes bzhin med pa rnams gso ba'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The five faculties and five powers cure non-faith, laziness, forgetfulness, distraction, and lack of meta-awareness.

original: de nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la kun du rmongs pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa la kun du rmongs pa dang / chos la bdag med pa la kun du rmongs pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyis rnam par gnon te /🔽byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyis ni chos thams cad la shin tu gti mug cing /
analyzed: de nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la kun du rmongs pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa la kun du rmongs pa dang / chos la bdag med pa la kun du rmongs pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyis rnam par gnon te / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyis ni chos thams cad la shin tu gti mug cing /
translated: Then, the branches of enlightenment conquer the confusion about dependent origination, the confusion about the selflessness of the person, and the confusion about the selflessness of phenomena.

original: mi shes pa gso ba'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa gso ba'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: As the sutra says, “The seven branches of enlightenment cure the extreme confusion and ignorance about all phenomena.🔽”

original: de ni lam ngan pa dang lam ni lam gyis nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni lam ngan pa dang lam ni lam gyis nges par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, the right path conquers the wrong path.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas ni 'chal ba'i shes rab dang / pha rol rgol ba thams cad dang / lam ngan par zhugs pa rnams gso ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas ni 'chal ba'i shes rab dang / pha rol rgol ba thams cad dang / lam ngan par zhugs pa rnams gso ba'o //
translated: As the sutra says, “The noble eightfold path cures all bad views, all opponents, and all who have entered the wrong path.

original: zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: rnam pa de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa che long dang 'bring gi gnyen por gyur pa rab tu sel ba dang / rnam par gnon pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni 'dzin rten pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa che long dang 'bring gi gnyen por gyur pa rab tu sel ba dang / rnam par gnon pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni 'dzin rten pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that is the antidote to the gross and middling afflictions by means of those aspects is called the wisdom of the bodhisattva who is a beginner.

original: de yang 'od srungs 'di ni yang dag pa'i gso ba'o //
analyzed: de yang 'od srungs 'di ni yang dag pa'i gso ba'o //
translated: And that is the correct treatment, Kāśyapa.

original: 'od srungs byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i gso ba 'di la brtson par bya'o zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: 'od srungs byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i gso ba 'di la brtson par bya'o zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: Kāśyapa, the bodhisattva should strive in this correct treatment.

original: 'od srungs 'dzam bu'i gling na sman pa dang sman pa'i slob ma ji snyed pa de dag gi nang na 'tsho byed ni mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs 'dzam bu'i gling na sman pa dang sman pa'i slob ma ji snyed pa de dag gi nang na 'tsho byed ni mchog ces bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, among all the physicians and physician apprentices in the Rose Apple Land, Jīvaka is said to be the best.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed pa de dag thams cad sman pa'i rgyal po 'tsho byed dang 'dra bar gyur kyang de dag thams cad lta ba dang / 'gyod pa la gnas pa gso pa'i sman gang yin zhes ris nas de dag gis shes pa 'am bstan pa 'am /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed pa de dag thams cad sman pa'i rgyal po 'tsho byed dang 'dra bar gyur kyang de dag thams cad lta ba dang / 'gyod pa la gnas pa gso pa'i sman gang yin zhes ris nas de dag gis shes pa 'am bstan pa 'am /
translated: Even if all the sentient beings of the great trichiliocosm were like the king of physicians, Jivaka, they would not be able to cure the views and regrets of those who are established in the Dharma of the śrāvakas.

original: bsgom par mi nus so //
analyzed: bsgom par mi nus so //
translated: They would not be able to know, teach, or cultivate the medicine that cures those who are established in views and regrets.

original: de la byang chub sems dpas 'di ltar bdag ni 'jig rten gyi sman tsam gyis chog par mi bya'i /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpas 'di ltar bdag ni 'jig rten gyi sman tsam gyis chog par mi bya'i /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva should think, “I will not be satisfied with merely worldly medicine.

original: bdag gis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye @244b shes kyi sman yongs su btsal bar bya /
analyzed: bdag gis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye @244b shes kyi sman yongs su btsal bar bya /
translated: I will seek the medicine of supramundane wisdom.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyang yang dag par bsdu bar bya'o snyam du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyang yang dag par bsdu bar bya'o snyam du brtag par bya'o //
translated: I will gather all roots of virtue.”

original: de ltar brtags nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi sman gang yin tshol ba des phyogs bzhir song ba sems can rnams la yang dag pa'i gso ba bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar brtags nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi sman gang yin tshol ba des phyogs bzhir song ba sems can rnams la yang dag pa'i gso ba bya ste /
translated: Having examined in this way, the one who seeks the medicine of supramundane wisdom should go to the four directions and treat sentient beings with the correct treatment.🔽With the correct treatment, he should treat sentient beings.

original: yang dag pa'i gso bas sems can rnams gso'o zhes bya ba la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi sman gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i gso bas sems can rnams gso'o zhes bya ba la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi sman gang zhe na /
translated: What is the medicine of supramundane wisdom?

original: de ltar 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis kun nas bskor ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par dmad nas gang kun nas nyon mongs pa phra mo bag la nyal gyi gnyen por gyur ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis kun nas bskor ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par dmad nas gang kun nas nyon mongs pa phra mo bag la nyal gyi gnyen por gyur ba'i ye shes so //
translated: Having thus condemned the afflictions that are surrounded by desire, hatred, and ignorance, it is the wisdom that becomes the antidote to the subtle afflictions that lie in wait.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rnam par gnon pa gnyen por gyur ba de yod na gnas gsum la mkhas te /
analyzed: rnam par gnon pa gnyen por gyur ba de yod na gnas gsum la mkhas te /
translated: When there is the overcoming that becomes the antidote, there is skill in three topics.

original: gang 'di rkyen gyi ye shes zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di rkyen gyi ye shes zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa'o //
translated: What is called the wisdom of conditions is skill in dependent origination.

original: bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / gso ba med pa dang / gang zag med pa'i chos rnams la mos pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med par mos pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / gso ba med pa dang / gang zag med pa'i chos rnams la mos pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med par mos pa'o //
translated: The wisdom called “aspiration to the teachings of selflessness, the absence of sentient beings, the absence of living beings, and the absence of persons” is the aspiration to the selflessness of persons.

original: stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i chos rnams la mi lta ba zhes bya ba ni chos la bdag med pa'o //🔽sems yongs su tshol ba'i brtson 'grus zhes bya ba ni gang kun nas nyon mongs pa ma lus pa las bzla ba'i phyir man ngag la mi ltos par mi shes pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i chos rnams la mi lta ba zhes bya ba ni chos la bdag med pa'o // sems yongs su tshol ba'i brtson 'grus zhes bya ba ni gang kun nas nyon mongs pa ma lus pa las bzla ba'i phyir man ngag la mi ltos par mi shes pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The teachings called “non-apprehension of emptiness” are the selflessness of dharmas.🔽The effort called “seeking the mind” is the effort to examine one’s own mind with the antidotes to the four kinds of ignorance, in order to transcend all the afflictions without exception, without relying on the instructions of others.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid mi shes pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid mi shes pa'i gnyen pos nang du rang gi sems la brtags pa'i phyir rab tu 'bad pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid mi shes pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid mi shes pa'i gnyen pos nang du rang gi sems la brtags pa'i phyir rab tu 'bad pa'o //
translated: The four kinds of ignorance are ignorance of the general characteristics, ignorance of the specific characteristics, ignorance of the characteristics of affliction, and ignorance of the characteristics of purification.

original: de la sems kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la sems kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: The general characteristics of mind should be understood as threefold.

original: de 'di ltar sems yongs su tshol lo //🔽'dod chags par 'gyur ba 'am /🔽zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: de 'di ltar sems yongs su tshol lo // 'dod chags par 'gyur ba 'am / zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: Thus he investigates mind:🔽“Is it a mind that becomes desirous,🔽or a mind that becomes hateful,

original: gti mug par 'gyur ba'i sems gang yin /
analyzed: gti mug par 'gyur ba'i sems gang yin /
translated: or a mind that becomes ignorant?

original: ci 'das pa 'am /
analyzed: ci 'das pa 'am /
translated: Is it a past mind,

original: ma 'ongs pa 'am /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa 'am /
translated: or a future mind,

original: da ltar byung ba 'am /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba 'am /
translated: or a present mind?

original: de la sems 'das pa gang yin pa de ni zad pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems 'das pa gang yin pa de ni zad pa'o //
translated: The past mind has ceased.

original: ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa de ni ma phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa de ni ma phyin pa'o //
translated: The future mind has not yet come.🔽The present mind does not remain.

original: da ltar byung ba ni gnas pa med do snyam mo zhes bya ba la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sems rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la bkol te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni gnas pa med do snyam mo zhes bya ba la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sems rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la bkol te /
translated: ” Thus he applies the principle of dependent origination to past and future minds,🔽and he understands that they are inactive.

original: byed pa med par rtog pa dang / da ltar gyi la skad cig pa ste /
analyzed: byed pa med par rtog pa dang / da ltar gyi la skad cig pa ste /
translated: He applies it to the present mind, and he understands that it is momentary.

original: byed pa med par rtog pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa la rang gi rkyen @245a * //🔽las byung gi /
analyzed: byed pa med par rtog pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa la rang gi rkyen @245a * // las byung gi /
translated: He understands that desire and so forth arise from their own conditions,

original: sems kyis byas pa ma yin par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyis byas pa ma yin par rtog pa'o //
translated: and that they are not created by the mind.

original: sems kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
translated: The intrinsic identity of mind is also to be understood in three ways.

original: 'od srungs sems ni nang na yang med phyi rol na yang med /
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni nang na yang med phyi rol na yang med /
translated: Kāśyapa, mind is not internal, not external, and not both,🔽and it is not apprehended as nonapprehensible.

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du tha snyad kyi rang bzhin gyis mi dmigs pa dang 'od srungs sems ni dpag tu med /
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du tha snyad kyi rang bzhin gyis mi dmigs pa dang 'od srungs sems ni dpag tu med /
translated: Kāśyapa, mind is immeasurable,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: indemonstrable,

original: rten ma yin pa /🔽snang ba med pa /
analyzed: rten ma yin pa / snang ba med pa /
translated: not a basis,🔽nonapparent,

original: rnam par rig pa med pa /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa med pa /
translated: noncognizant,🔽and not a location.🔽And yet, in six ways, suchness is apprehended:

original: gnas pa med pa zhes bya ba yang ma yin bzhin du rnam pa drug gis de bzhin nyid dmigs pa dang / 'od srungs sems ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang ma gzigs mi gzigs gzigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas pa med pa zhes bya ba yang ma yin bzhin du rnam pa drug gis de bzhin nyid dmigs pa dang / 'od srungs sems ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang ma gzigs mi gzigs gzigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Kāśyapa, mind is not seen, is not seen, and will not be seen by all the buddhas.

original: log par ltung ba'i 'du shes las chos rnams 'byung ba ma gtogs par sangs rgyas thams cad kyang ma gzigs mi gzigs gzigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: log par ltung ba'i 'du shes las chos rnams 'byung ba ma gtogs par sangs rgyas thams cad kyang ma gzigs mi gzigs gzigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Except for the notion of falling into error, all phenomena are not seen, are not seen, and will not be seen by all the buddhas.

original: nga yin pa de'i rgyu ba ji ltar lta zhen zhes bya ba 'phags pa thams cad kyi ye shes khyad par med par dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: nga yin pa de'i rgyu ba ji ltar lta zhen zhes bya ba 'phags pa thams cad kyi ye shes khyad par med par dmigs pa'o //
translated: The way to view the cause of “I am” is the non-differentiation of the intuition of all the Saints.

original: sems kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
translated: The characteristic of the mind’s defilement should be understood in three ways:

original: 'grub pa dang / 'byung ba dang / rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: 'grub pa dang / 'byung ba dang / rgyu ba'o //
translated: in its establishment, in its occurrence, and in its movement.

original: 'od srungs sems ni sgyu ma dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni sgyu ma dang mtshungs te /
translated: Kāśyapa, mind is like a magician,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du brtags pas skye ba rnam pa mang bo yongs su 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams su lus sna tshogs 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du brtags pas skye ba rnam pa mang bo yongs su 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams su lus sna tshogs 'grub pa ste /
translated: for it grasps many kinds of unreal, imagined births. This is the establishment of various bodies in the destinies,

original: 'grub pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'grub pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: the defilement of establishment.

original: 'od srungs sems ni 'bab chu'i rgyun dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni 'bab chu'i rgyun dang mtshungs te /
translated: Kāśyapa, mind is like a waterfall,

original: mi gnas pa skyes nas 'jig cing 'ju ba'o zhes bya ba ni grub pa de nyid skad cig pa'i rgyun gyis 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa skyes nas 'jig cing 'ju ba'o zhes bya ba ni grub pa de nyid skad cig pa'i rgyun gyis 'byung ba'o //
translated: for it does not stand still, but arises and passes away. This is the occurrence of that establishment by a stream of instants.

original: 'od srungs sems rlung dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'od srungs sems rlung dang mtshungs te /
translated: Kāśyapa, mind is like the wind,

original: ring du 'gro zhing gzung du med par rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni thams cad la dmigs pa dang gzung dka' bar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ring du 'gro zhing gzung du med par rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni thams cad la dmigs pa dang gzung dka' bar 'byung ba'o //
translated: It goes far, and moves without being grasped. This is the occurrence of the objective domain and the difficulty of grasping it.

original: 'od srungs sems ni mar me'i 'od 'phro ba dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni mar me'i 'od 'phro ba dang mtshungs te /
translated: Kāśyapa, mind is like the flame of a lamp.

original: rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i snum gyi dbang gis 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i snum gyi dbang gis 'byung ba ste /
translated: It arises from causes and conditions. This is the occurrence of the oil of existence.

original: 'byung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: This is the defilement of occurrence.

original: gang du rgyu ba dang ji ltar rgyu ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: gang du rgyu ba dang ji ltar rgyu ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: The defilement of movement is the movement of mind in the five places.

original: gang du rgyu zhe na /
analyzed: gang du rgyu zhe na /
translated: Where does it move?

original: 'od srungs sems ni glog dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni glog dang mtshungs te /
translated: Kāśyapa, mind is like lightning,

original: skad cig tu 'jig cing mi gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni glog par 'ga' 'byung ba ltar dge ba'i sems 'byung ba'i phyir res 'ga' dge ba la rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig tu 'jig cing mi gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni glog par 'ga' 'byung ba ltar dge ba'i sems 'byung ba'i phyir res 'ga' dge ba la rgyu ba'o //
translated: momentary, perishable, and unstable. This is the movement of mind in virtue, because a virtuous mind arises like lightning.

original: 'od srungs sems ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs te /
translated: Kāśyapa, mind is like space,

original: nyon @245b mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa glo bur rnams kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa glo bur res 'ga' mi dge ba la'o //
analyzed: nyon @245b mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa glo bur rnams kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa glo bur res 'ga' mi dge ba la'o //
translated: It is defiled by the adventitious defilements and secondary defilements.

original: 'od srungs sems ni spre'u dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni spre'u dang mtshungs te /
translated: Kāśyapa, the mind is like a monkey,

original: yul thams cad la 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba ni res 'ga' yul la'o //
analyzed: yul thams cad la 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba ni res 'ga' yul la'o //
translated: because it desires all objects.🔽Kāśyapa, the mind is like a painter,

original: 'od srungs sems ni las rnams sna tshogs mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ri mo mkhan dang mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni res 'ga' las mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni las rnams sna tshogs mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ri mo mkhan dang mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni res 'ga' las mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
translated: because it creates various actions.🔽Kāśyapa, the mind is unstable,

original: 'od srungs sems ni nyon mongs pa tha dad pa 'byung ba'i phyir mi gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni res 'ga' yul rnams la rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni nyon mongs pa tha dad pa 'byung ba'i phyir mi gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni res 'ga' yul rnams la rgyu ste /
translated: because it arises with different defilements.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa ni mi gnas par rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa ni mi gnas par rgyu ba'o //
translated: Desire, hatred, and so on are unstable and move around.

original: 'od srungs sems gnyis pa mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir sems ni gcig pu rgyu ba ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs sems gnyis pa mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir sems ni gcig pu rgyu ba ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, because a second mind does not connect with it, the mind moves alone.🔽It is not dual.

original: gnyis su med pa'o zhes bya ba ni de nyid 'dod chags dang bcas par 'gyur la /🔽'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'o zhes bya ba ni de nyid 'dod chags dang bcas par 'gyur la / 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin la /
translated: This is because it is not the case that it becomes associated with attachment and then becomes free from attachment.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas bar yang 'gyur ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas bar yang 'gyur ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is not the case that it becomes associated with attachment and then becomes free from attachment.🔽Kāśyapa, because the mind controls all phenomena, it is like a king.

original: 'od srungs sems ni chos thams cad la dbang byed pa'i phyir rgyal po dang mtshungs zhes bya ba ni bde bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la dbang thob ste rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni chos thams cad la dbang byed pa'i phyir rgyal po dang mtshungs zhes bya ba ni bde bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la dbang thob ste rgyu ba'o //
translated: It moves having obtained control over the phenomena that lead to happiness.🔽Kāśyapa, because the mind generates all suffering, it is like an enemy.

original: 'od srungs sems ni sdug bsngal thams cad bskyed pa'i phyir mi mdza' ba dang mtshungs zhes bya ba ni bde ba spangs nas bdag la sdug bsngal kun du bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni sdug bsngal thams cad bskyed pa'i phyir mi mdza' ba dang mtshungs zhes bya ba ni bde ba spangs nas bdag la sdug bsngal kun du bskyed pa'o //
translated: Having abandoned happiness, it generates suffering for the self.

original: 'od srungs sems ni mi rtag pa la rtag ba la rtag bar 'du shes ba'i phyir bye ma'i khyim dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni mi rtag pa la rtag ba la rtag bar 'du shes ba'i phyir bye ma'i khyim dang mtshungs so //
translated: Kāśyapa, the mind is like a house of sand, because impermanent things are perceived as permanent.

original: 'od srungs sems ni sdug bsngal la bde bar 'du shes pa'i phyir nya'i mchil ba dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni sdug bsngal la bde bar 'du shes pa'i phyir nya'i mchil ba dang mtshungs so //
translated: Kāśyapa, the mind is like a fish-hook, because suffering is perceived as happiness.

original: 'od srungs sems ni bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa'i phyir rmi lam dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa'i phyir rmi lam dang mtshungs so //
translated: Kāśyapa, the mind is like a dream, because a self is perceived where there is no self.🔽Kāśyapa, the mind is like a blue-bottle fly, because the impure is perceived as pure.

original: 'od srungs sems ni mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar 'du shes pa'i phyir sbrang ma sngon po dang mtshungs so zhes bya ba de yang bdag tu mngon par chags pas bdag la sdug bsngal bskyed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar 'du shes pa'i phyir sbrang ma sngon po dang mtshungs so zhes bya ba de yang bdag tu mngon par chags pas bdag la sdug bsngal bskyed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: But it is not attachment to a self that produces suffering for the self through error.

original: phyin ci log gis so //
analyzed: phyin ci log gis so //
translated: It is error itself.🔽Kāśyapa, the mind is like an enemy, because it does much harm.

original: 'od srungs sems ni gnod pa mang po byed pas phyir rgol ba dang mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni bdag la sdug bsngal bskyed pas ngoms mi myong ba'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni gnod pa mang po byed pas phyir rgol ba dang mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni bdag la sdug bsngal bskyed pas ngoms mi myong ba'o //
translated: It is never satisfied in producing suffering for the self.

original: 'od srungs sems ni rtag tu klan ka tshol ba'i phyir gnod sbyin mdangs 'phrogs pa dang mtshungs so zhes pa ni dge ba la sbyor ba de dor bar bya ba'i skabs tshol ba'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni rtag tu klan ka tshol ba'i phyir gnod sbyin mdangs 'phrogs pa dang mtshungs so zhes pa ni dge ba la sbyor ba de dor bar bya ba'i skabs tshol ba'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, mind is like a demon that steals vitality, because it is always looking for an opportunity to harm.

original: 'od srungs sems ni rtag tu glags lta @246a * //🔽bas dgra dang mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba kun du spyad par bya ba'i glags lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni rtag tu glags lta @246a * // bas dgra dang mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba kun du spyad par bya ba'i glags lta ba'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, mind is like an enemy, because it is always looking for an opportunity to harm.

original: 'od srungs sems ni rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang ldan pas rtag tu mtho dman can no zhes bya ba ni 'byor ba dang / rgud pa dang / rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba gnyis kyis gnod pa'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang ldan pas rtag tu mtho dman can no zhes bya ba ni 'byor ba dang / rgud pa dang / rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba gnyis kyis gnod pa'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, mind is like a high and low place, because it is associated with attachment and aversion.

original: 'od srungs sems ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad rku bas rkun po dang mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni bag med pa'i dbang du song bas dge ba'i rtsa ba byas shing byas pa thams cad zad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad rku bas rkun po dang mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni bag med pa'i dbang du song bas dge ba'i rtsa ba byas shing byas pa thams cad zad par byed pa'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, mind is like a thief, because it steals all wholesome actions.

original: 'od srungs sems ni gzugs la dga' ba'i phyir phyi byi zho la'i mig dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni gzugs la dga' ba'i phyir phyi byi zho la'i mig dang mtshungs so //
translated: Kāśyapa, the mind is like the eyes of a cat, which delight in form.

original: 'od srungs sems ni dgra la dga' bas g-yul gyi rnga dang mtshungs so //🔽'od srungs sems ni phag mi gtsang ba'i dri la dga' ba bzhin du dri la dga'o //🔽'od srungs sems ni ro la dga' bas zas kyi lhag ma za ba'i bran mo dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni dgra la dga' bas g-yul gyi rnga dang mtshungs so // 'od srungs sems ni phag mi gtsang ba'i dri la dga' ba bzhin du dri la dga'o // 'od srungs sems ni ro la dga' bas zas kyi lhag ma za ba'i bran mo dang mtshungs so //
translated: Kāśyapa, the mind is like a battle drum, which delights in enemies.🔽Kāśyapa, the mind delights in smells, like a pig delights in filth.🔽Kāśyapa, the mind delights in tastes, like a servant delights in the leftovers of a meal.

original: 'od srungs sems ni reg pa la dga' bas sbrang ma 'bru mar gyi snod la chags pa dang mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni /🔽gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i yul la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir yang shin tu phan par bdud rtsi'i khams la so sor brtags te /
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni reg pa la dga' bas sbrang ma 'bru mar gyi snod la chags pa dang mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i yul la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir yang shin tu phan par bdud rtsi'i khams la so sor brtags te /
translated: Kāśyapa, the mind delights in touch, like a bee trapped in a jar delights in a jar of sesame oil.

original: so sor brtags nas rnam par bzhag dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: so sor brtags nas rnam par bzhag dka' ba yin no //
translated: Because it delights in objects of form, sound, smell, taste, and touch, it is difficult to establish the mind, which is like nectar, after examining it.

original: sems kyi rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid byang gsum gyis reg par bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid byang gsum gyis reg par bya ste /
translated: The characteristic of the purification of mind is to be touched by the three pure states.

original: thob pa dang mi thob pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'dus byas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rigs kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: thob pa dang mi thob pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'dus byas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rigs kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of attainment and nonattainment, the characteristic of the conditioned, and the characteristic of the spiritual lineage.

original: 'od srungs sems ni kun du brtsal na mi rnyed do //
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni kun du brtsal na mi rnyed do //
translated: Kāśyapa, when mind is sought it is not found.🔽What is not found is not apprehended.

original: gang mi rnyed pa de ni mi dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni tha snyad can gyi rang bzhin kun du btsal na mi rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: gang mi rnyed pa de ni mi dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni tha snyad can gyi rang bzhin kun du btsal na mi rnyed pa'o //
translated: This is the nature of conventional reality. When it is sought, it is not found.🔽What is not found is not apprehended.

original: gang mi rnyed pa de ni mi dmigs pa'i zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i rnam pas sems la rab tu rtog na sems de rnam par dag pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gang mi rnyed pa de ni mi dmigs pa'i zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i rnam pas sems la rab tu rtog na sems de rnam par dag pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: This is the thorough investigation of mind in that way. That mind is the cause of purification.

original: de las gzhan du na ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa dang rab tu ldan pas sems rnam par 'dod kyang thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan du na ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa dang rab tu ldan pas sems rnam par 'dod kyang thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it is not attained, even though the mind is thoroughly investigated, because it is associated with what is improper.

original: de ltar tshul bzhin rab tu sbyor na thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar tshul bzhin rab tu sbyor na thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is not attained when it is properly applied.

original: 'di ni thob pa dang mi thob pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni thob pa dang mi thob pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of attainment and nonattainment.

original: de ltar chos la bdag med pa la sbyor bar sbyor ba ni shes rab kyi sems de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid du mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar chos la bdag med pa la sbyor bar sbyor ba ni shes rab kyi sems de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid du mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, the application to the selflessness of phenomena is the seeing of the mind as the reality-characteristic of wisdom.

original: sems de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid de yang rnam pa dgus 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang mi 'dra bas na 'dus byas su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid de yang rnam pa dgus 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang mi 'dra bas na 'dus byas su rig par bya ste /
translated: And that reality-characteristic of the mind is to be known as uncompounded, since it is not similar to the characteristic of the compounded, in nine ways.

original: gang mi dmigs pa de ni @246b 'das pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gang mi dmigs pa de ni @246b 'das pa yang ma yin /
translated: That which is not perceived is not past,

original: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin /
translated: is not future,

original: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: and is not present.

original: gang 'das pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gang 'das pa yang ma yin /
translated: That which is not past,

original: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin /
translated: is not future,🔽and is not present is beyond the three times.

original: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin pa de ni dus gsum las shin tu 'das pa'o zhes bya ba ni dus gsum gyi lam du mi rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin pa de ni dus gsum las shin tu 'das pa'o zhes bya ba ni dus gsum gyi lam du mi rgyu ba'o //
translated: This is the non-wandering in the path of the three times.

original: ji ltar 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa las langs nas de yang skye ba ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa las langs nas de yang skye ba ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not like the arising of that which has arisen from the attainment of cessation.

original: gang dus gsum las shin tu 'das pa de ni yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gang dus gsum las shin tu 'das pa de ni yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: That which is beyond the three times is not existent,🔽is not non-existent,🔽and is not existent and non-existent.

original: med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni tha snyad can gyi rang bzhin du mi dmigs pa dang / de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid du mi dmigs pas gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid do //🔽gang yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni tha snyad can gyi rang bzhin du mi dmigs pa dang / de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid du mi dmigs pas gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid do // gang yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: The phrase nor is it nonexistent refers to the characteristic of nonduality, because it is not perceived as the intrinsic nature of the conventional and it is not perceived as the intrinsic nature of reality.

original: med pa yang ma yin pa de ni ma skyes pa'o zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin pa de ni ma skyes pa'o zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The phrase it is not existent refers to the characteristic of non-arising, because it is not perceived as the intrinsic nature of the conventional.🔽The phrase it is not nonexistent refers to the characteristic of nonduality, because it is not perceived as the intrinsic nature of reality. The phrase that which is neither existent nor nonexistent does not arise refers to the characteristic of non-arising.

original: gang ma skyes pa de la che long nyid med do zhes bya ba de ni skye ba'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid las shin tu 'das pa'i mtshan nyid do //🔽gang ngo bo nyid med pa de la 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa na skye ba las shin tu 'da'o //
analyzed: gang ma skyes pa de la che long nyid med do zhes bya ba de ni skye ba'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid las shin tu 'das pa'i mtshan nyid do // gang ngo bo nyid med pa de la 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa na skye ba las shin tu 'da'o //
translated: The phrase that which does not arise has no grossness refers to the characteristic of transcendence, because it transcends the characteristic of the cause of arising.

original: gang 'byung ba med pa de la 'gag pa med do zhes bya ba de ni 'chi ba'i 'chi 'pho ba las shin tu 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: gang 'byung ba med pa de la 'gag pa med do zhes bya ba de ni 'chi ba'i 'chi 'pho ba las shin tu 'da' ba'o //
translated: The phrase that which has no intrinsic nature has no origination refers to the transcendence of future arising. The phrase that which has no origination has no cessation refers to the transcendence of death and transmigration.

original: gang la 'gag pa med pa de la 'bral ba med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni skad cig gcig nas gcig tu 'byung ba'i 'bral ba las shin tu 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: gang la 'gag pa med pa de la 'bral ba med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni skad cig gcig nas gcig tu 'byung ba'i 'bral ba las shin tu 'da' ba'o //
translated: That which is not stopped is not separated. This is beyond the separation of one moment from another.

original: gang 'bral ba med pa de la 'ong ba yang med /
analyzed: gang 'bral ba med pa de la 'ong ba yang med /
translated: That which is not separated does not come.

original: 'gro ba yang med /
analyzed: 'gro ba yang med /
translated: It does not go.

original: 'chi 'pho ba yang med /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba yang med /
translated: It does not die and transmigrate.

original: skye ba yang med ces bya ba ni 'gro ba na 'gyur ba ldog pa las shin tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba yang med ces bya ba ni 'gro ba na 'gyur ba ldog pa las shin tu 'das pa'o //
translated: It is not born. This is beyond the change of going.

original: gang la 'gro ba yang med /
analyzed: gang la 'gro ba yang med /
translated: That which does not go,

original: 'ong ba yang med /
analyzed: 'ong ba yang med /
translated: does not come,

original: 'chi 'pho yang med /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho yang med /
translated: does not die and transmigrate,

original: skye ba yang med pa de la 'du byed gang yang med do //
analyzed: skye ba yang med pa de la 'du byed gang yang med do //
translated: and is not born does not have any conditioning.

original: gang la 'du byed gang yang med pa de ni 'dus ma byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa las shin tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gang la 'du byed gang yang med pa de ni 'dus ma byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa las shin tu 'das pa'o //
translated: That which does not have any conditioning is unconditioned. This is beyond karma and afflictions.

original: gang 'dus ma byas pa de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs so zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gang 'dus ma byas pa de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs so zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: That which is unconditioned is the family of the noble ones. This is the characteristic of the family.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid du blta'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid du blta'o //
translated: It should be seen as the characteristic of the unconditioned realm.

original: de la mthong bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir 'phags pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la mthong bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir 'phags pa nyid de /
translated: It is the noble ones themselves because they are distinguished by their insight.

original: de'i tshe 'di la dngos po lnga las shin tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di la dngos po lnga las shin tu 'das pa'o //
translated: At that time, they transcend five things.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs gang yin pa de la bslab pa yang med ces bya ba de ni shin tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs gang yin pa de la bslab pa yang med ces bya ba de ni shin tu 'das pa'o //
translated: The noble ones’ lineage is said to be “without training,” which is to say, it is beyond training.

original: bslab pa las 'das pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni mi byed pa las shin tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa las 'das pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni mi byed pa las shin tu 'das pa'o //
translated: “ There is no transcendence of training” means that it is beyond the absence of action.

original: rgyu ba yang med ces bya ba ni bya bar sbyor @247a * //🔽ba las shin tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ba yang med ces bya ba ni bya bar sbyor @247a * // ba las shin tu 'das pa'o //
translated: “ There is no movement” means that it is beyond the engagement in action.

original: mi rgyu ba yang med ces bya ba ni mi sbyor ba las shin tu 'das pa'o //🔽rab tu rgyu ba yang med ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi rgyu ba yang med ces bya ba ni mi sbyor ba las shin tu 'das pa'o // rab tu rgyu ba yang med ces bya ba ni /
translated: “ There is no absence of movement” means that it is beyond the absence of engagement.

original: mi bya ba la sbyor ba las shin tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mi bya ba la sbyor ba las shin tu 'das pa'o //
translated: “ There is no movement” means that it is beyond the engagement in the absence of action.

original: tshe rabs gzhan na dngos po drug pa las shin tu 'das te /🔽gang la rgyu ba yang med /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan na dngos po drug pa las shin tu 'das te / gang la rgyu ba yang med /
translated: In other lives, they transcend six things.🔽“ There is no movement” means that it is beyond the engagement in action.

original: mi rgyu ba yang med /
analyzed: mi rgyu ba yang med /
translated: “ There is no absence of movement” means that it is beyond the absence of engagement.🔽“ There is no movement” means that it is beyond the engagement in the absence of action.

original: rab tu rgyu ba yang med pa de la sems kyang med sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang med do zhes bya ba ni yang srid par 'gyur ba'i 'du byed 'byung bar byed pa las shin tu 'das pa'o //🔽gang sems kyang med /🔽sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang med pa de la las kyang med do zhes bya ba de ni 'du byed las shin tu 'das pa'o //🔽las kyi rnam par smin pa yang med do zhes bya ba de ni de'i 'bras bu grub pa las shin tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu rgyu ba yang med pa de la sems kyang med sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang med do zhes bya ba ni yang srid par 'gyur ba'i 'du byed 'byung bar byed pa las shin tu 'das pa'o // gang sems kyang med / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang med pa de la las kyang med do zhes bya ba de ni 'du byed las shin tu 'das pa'o // las kyi rnam par smin pa yang med do zhes bya ba de ni de'i 'bras bu grub pa las shin tu 'das pa'o //
translated: In that which is not produced and does not cease, which is not defiled and not purified, which does not diminish and does not increase, which does not come and does not go, which is not appropriated and not abandoned, which is not the support and not what is supported, which is not a basis and not what is based, which is not a foundation and not what is founded, which is not a cause and not an effect, which is not an object and not an object-possessor, which is not a knower and not what is known, which is not a perceiver and not what is perceived, which is not a cognizer and not what is cognized, which is not a mind and not mental factors, that is beyond the arising of the formations that lead to renewed existence.🔽In that which is not a mind🔽and not mental factors, that is beyond the formations.🔽In that which is not an action🔽and not the ripening of an action, that is beyond the establishment of its result.🔽

original: gang la las kyang med /🔽las kyi rnam par smin pa yang med pa de la bde ba yang med /🔽sdug bsngal ba yang med do zhes bya ba de ni de la brten pa'i 'byor pa dang rgud ba las shin tu 'das pa'o //🔽gang la bde ba yang med /
analyzed: gang la las kyang med /🔽las kyi rnam par smin pa yang med pa de la bde ba yang med /🔽sdug bsngal ba yang med do zhes bya ba de ni de la brten pa'i 'byor pa dang rgud ba las shin tu 'das pa'o //🔽gang la bde ba yang med /
