original: sdug bsngal yang med pa de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang med pa de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs te /
translated: That is the family of the noble ones, in which there is no suffering.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs gang yin pa de la ni las kyang med /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs gang yin pa de la ni las kyang med /
translated: In that family of the noble ones, there is no karma,

original: las mngon par 'du byed pa yang med pa'o //
analyzed: las mngon par 'du byed pa yang med pa'o //
translated: and there is no formation of karma.

original: rigs de la ni lus kyi las byed pa med de /
analyzed: rigs de la ni lus kyi las byed pa med de /
translated: In that family, there is no bodily action,

original: ngag gi ma yin /
analyzed: ngag gi ma yin /
translated: no verbal action,🔽and no mental action.

original: yid kyi ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas dang / lung du ma bstan pa thams cad kyi kun du g-yo ba rnams la ste /
analyzed: yid kyi ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas dang / lung du ma bstan pa thams cad kyi kun du g-yo ba rnams la ste /
translated: This is with regard to all the movements of pleasure, suffering, and the neutral, as well as the indeterminate.

original: de la las kyang med ces bya ba ni bslab pa las shin tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de la las kyang med ces bya ba ni bslab pa las shin tu 'das pa'o //
translated: There is no karma means that one has gone beyond training.

original: las mngon par 'du byed pa yang med ces bya ba ni smon pa las shin tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: las mngon par 'du byed pa yang med ces bya ba ni smon pa las shin tu 'das pa'o //
translated: There is no formation of karma means that one has gone beyond aspiration.

original: rigs de la lus la sogs pa las rnams byed pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni rjes su sbyor ba las shin tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rigs de la lus la sogs pa las rnams byed pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni rjes su sbyor ba las shin tu 'das pa'o //
translated: In that family, there is no action of body, speech, or mind means that one has gone beyond engagement.

original: rigs de la tha ma dang 'bring dang / mchog rnam par gzhag pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni de'i gnas lus sna tshogs las shin tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rigs de la tha ma dang 'bring dang / mchog rnam par gzhag pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni de'i gnas lus sna tshogs las shin tu 'das pa'o //
translated: There is no question of a lesser, middling or greater family. This is the nature of the family, which transcends all the varieties of physical states.

original: rigs de yang dus rnam pa bzhi dang mtshan nyid rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rigs de yang dus rnam pa bzhi dang mtshan nyid rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
translated: This family should be understood in terms of four periods and nine characteristics.

original: rnam par ma dag pa'i dus dang / rnam par dag pa'i dus dang / rab tu rtogs pa'i dus dang / yongs su mthar phyin pa'i dus so //
analyzed: rnam par ma dag pa'i dus dang / rnam par dag pa'i dus dang / rab tu rtogs pa'i dus dang / yongs su mthar phyin pa'i dus so //
translated: The four periods are: the period of impurity, the period of purity, the period of clear understanding, and the period of complete fulfilment.🔽The family is even, like space, because in the period of impurity it is the same in all characteristics.

original: rigs de ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i phyir snyoms pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnams @247b par ma dag pa'i dus na mtshan ma thams cad la mtshungs par rjes su song bas nam mkha' lta bu ste ji ltar nam mkha' gzugs thams cad la mtshungs bar rjes su
analyzed: rigs de ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i phyir snyoms pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnams @247b par ma dag pa'i dus na mtshan ma thams cad la mtshungs par rjes su song bas nam mkha' lta bu ste ji ltar nam mkha' gzugs thams cad la mtshungs bar rjes su
translated: It is like space, because it is the same in all characteristics in the period of impurity. Just as space is the same in all forms, so this family is the same in all characteristics of the period of impurity.

original: song ba de bzhin du rnam bar ma dag pa'i dus na rnal 'byor pas de bzhin nyid mtshan ma thams cad mnyam par rjes su song bar mthong ba ste /
analyzed: song ba de bzhin du rnam bar ma dag pa'i dus na rnal 'byor pas de bzhin nyid mtshan ma thams cad mnyam par rjes su song bar mthong ba ste /
translated: Just as it is in the future, so it is in the present.

original: de ni rnam par dag pa'i dus kyi rnam pa ste gcig go //
analyzed: de ni rnam par dag pa'i dus kyi rnam pa ste gcig go //
translated: This is the first aspect of the time of purification.

original: rigs de ni chos thams cad ro gcig pa'i phyir khyad par med pa'o //
analyzed: rigs de ni chos thams cad ro gcig pa'i phyir khyad par med pa'o //
translated: That potential is undifferentiated, because all phenomena are of one taste.

original: rigs de ni lus dang sems dben pa'i phyir dben pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i dus te /
analyzed: rigs de ni lus dang sems dben pa'i phyir dben pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i dus te /
translated: That potential is isolated, because body and mind are isolated.

original: ro gcig pa'i dang / lus dang / sems dben ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i dus gnyis su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ro gcig pa'i dang / lus dang / sems dben ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i dus gnyis su rig par bya'o //
translated: These two aspects of the time of purification should be understood as being of one taste and as the isolation of body and mind.

original: rigs de ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: rigs de ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang mthun pa'o //
translated: That potential is conducive to nirvana.🔽That potential is immaculate, because it is free of the stains of all the afflictions.

original: rigs de ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir dri ma med pa'o zhes bya ba ni rab tu rtogs pa'i dus te /
analyzed: rigs de ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir dri ma med pa'o zhes bya ba ni rab tu rtogs pa'i dus te /
translated: This is the time of realization.

original: 'di ltar mthu dang 'di ltar dri ma med pa de'i phyir mthar thug pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i rab tu rtogs pa'i dus kyi rnam pa dang / rigs de ni ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med pa'i nga'i bar med pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba las shin tu 'das pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthu dang 'di ltar dri ma med pa de'i phyir mthar thug pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i rab tu rtogs pa'i dus kyi rnam pa dang / rigs de ni ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med pa'i nga'i bar med pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba las shin tu 'das pa ste /
translated: That lineage is without the “I” that is the absence of the grasping of “I” and the grasping of “mine.” This is the complete transcendence of the view of the transitory collection.

original: de gnyis kyi rnam pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi rnam pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second aspect of the two.

original: rigs de ni yang dag pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa mnyam pa las 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: rigs de ni yang dag pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa mnyam pa las 'byung ba ste /
translated: That lineage arises from the equality of the real and the unreal.

original: mi mnyam pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni de'i rtsa ba las byung ba mi mnyam par lta ba las shin tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni de'i rtsa ba las byung ba mi mnyam par lta ba las shin tu 'das pa'o //
translated: It is without inequality. This is the complete transcendence of the view of inequality that arises from its root.

original: de gnyis kyi rnam pa gsum ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi rnam pa gsum ba'o //
translated: This is the third aspect of the two.

original: rigs de ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin pas bden pa'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su mthar phyin pa'i dus te /
analyzed: rigs de ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin pas bden pa'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su mthar phyin pa'i dus te /
translated: That lineage is the truth because it is the ultimate truth. This is the time of complete perfection.

original: dus de na rtogs pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i bde ba ste /
analyzed: dus de na rtogs pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i bde ba ste /
translated: At that time, it is the complete truth because it is realized.

original: 'gyur ba rnam pa gsum las shin tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba rnam pa gsum las shin tu 'das pa'o //
translated: It is utterly beyond the three kinds of change.

original: de la 'gyur ba ni gsum po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: de la 'gyur ba ni gsum po 'di dag ste /
translated: There are three kinds of change:

original: rga shi la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba dang / phyin ci log gi gnas 'gyur ba dang / rnam par dag pa las yongs su nyams pa'i 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rga shi la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba dang / phyin ci log gi gnas 'gyur ba dang / rnam par dag pa las yongs su nyams pa'i 'gyur pa'o //
translated: the change of aging and death, etc., the change of the reversal of error, and the change of falling away from purity.

original: rigs de ni rab tu ma skyes pa'i phyir mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba ni rga shi la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba las shin tu 'das pa ste /
analyzed: rigs de ni rab tu ma skyes pa'i phyir mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba ni rga shi la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba las shin tu 'das pa ste /
translated: That gene is imperishable because it is not produced, and so it is utterly beyond the change of aging and death, etc.

original: yongs su grub pa'i dus kyi rnam pa dang po'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i dus kyi rnam pa dang po'o //
translated: This is the first aspect of the perfected age.

original: rigs de ni rtag tu chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi phyir rtag pa'o //
analyzed: rigs de ni rtag tu chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi phyir rtag pa'o //
translated: That gene is permanent because it is the suchness of all things.

original: rigs de ni mya ngan las 'das pa mchog gi phyir bde ba'o //
analyzed: rigs de ni mya ngan las 'das pa mchog gi phyir bde ba'o //
translated: That gene is happiness because it is the supreme nirvana.

original: rigs de ni rnam pa thams cad dri ma med pa'i phyir dge ba'o //
analyzed: rigs de ni rnam pa thams cad dri ma med pa'i phyir dge ba'o //
translated: That gene is virtue because it is stainless in every way.

original: rigs de ni bdag yongs su btsal te ma rnyed @248a * //
analyzed: rigs de ni bdag yongs su btsal te ma rnyed @248a * //
translated: That gene is self because it is not found as a self when one searches for a self.

original: pa'i phyir bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log gi gnas kyi 'gyur ba'i las shin tu 'das pa ste /
analyzed: pa'i phyir bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log gi gnas kyi 'gyur ba'i las shin tu 'das pa ste /
translated: Since it is not a self, it is selfless.🔽🔽This is the karma of change that is utterly beyond the basis of error.

original: de nyid kyi rnam pa gnyis pa'o //🔽rigs de ni rab tu rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i las yongs su nyams pa'i 'gyur ba las shin tu 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rnam pa gnyis pa'o // rigs de ni rab tu rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i las yongs su nyams pa'i 'gyur ba las shin tu 'das pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is selfless. This is the second aspect of that, transcending the transformation of the basis of error.

original: de nyid kyi rnam pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rnam pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: That spiritual lineage is very pure. This is the third aspect of that, transcending the transformation of the degeneration of the function of purification.

original: de bas na 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis gzhan gyi don byed par bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis gzhan gyi don byed par bstan to //
translated: Thus, it is shown that one acts for the benefit of others by means of the mundane and supramundane paths.

original: 'od srungs nang du yongs su tshol ba zhes bya ba mtshams sbyor ce na /🔽ji ltar rigs des rab tu phye ba ni rnam par dag pa'i 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs nang du yongs su tshol ba zhes bya ba mtshams sbyor ce na / ji ltar rigs des rab tu phye ba ni rnam par dag pa'i 'phags pa ste /
translated: Kāsyapa, to seek internally is a connecting statement.🔽The noble ones are distinguished by that spiritual lineage.

original: de ni ji ltar de las 'phags pa rnams skye ba de dang gdams ngag don chen por ston to //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar de las 'phags pa rnams skye ba de dang gdams ngag don chen por ston to //
translated: That is taught as the great import of the instruction on how the noble ones are born from that.

original: byang chub sems dba' dag ni ci nas kyang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa gnyen po rnam pa gnyis rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dba' dag ni ci nas kyang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa gnyen po rnam pa gnyis rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas establish the two kinds of antidotes, mundane and supramundane, in order to eliminate the two kinds of defilements, respectively.

original: de las gzhan pa'i theg pa la 'phags pa la sbyor ba las brtsams nas 'dams te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i theg pa la 'phags pa la sbyor ba las brtsams nas 'dams te /
translated: The bodhisattvas, in every way, instruct and teach those who are engaged in the other vehicles, beginning with the noble truths, in order to establish the two kinds of antidotes, mundane and supramundane.

original: sems yongs su btsal ba de nyid kun du ston to //
analyzed: sems yongs su btsal ba de nyid kun du ston to //
translated: They reveal the very same investigation of mind.🔽Kāśyapa, in the future there will be monks who are like dogs chasing stones.

original: 'od srungs ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge slong khyi rngo la bsnyegs pa dang mtshungs pa dag 'byung ngo zhes bya ba de ni khyi lta bu ni phyi rol tu rgyug pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'od srungs ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge slong khyi rngo la bsnyegs pa dang mtshungs pa dag 'byung ngo zhes bya ba de ni khyi lta bu ni phyi rol tu rgyug pa rnams so //
translated: The dogs are those who run outside.

original: rdo lta bu ni gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga po dag go //
analyzed: rdo lta bu ni gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga po dag go //
translated: The stones are the five objects, form, etc.

original: 'phel ba lta bu ni sems so //
analyzed: 'phel ba lta bu ni sems so //
translated: The increase is the mind.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg byas 'jigs shing skrag ces bya ba ni yul gyis 'jigs skrag par ston to //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg byas 'jigs shing skrag ces bya ba ni yul gyis 'jigs skrag par ston to //
translated: The phrase frightened and terrified by form, sound, smell, taste, and touch shows that they are frightened and terrified by objects.

original: yul gyis 'jigs skrag pa de dag ni 'jigs pa'i rgyu yongs su mi shes pas rnam pa bzhis yul la rgyug par ston to //
analyzed: yul gyis 'jigs skrag pa de dag ni 'jigs pa'i rgyu yongs su mi shes pas rnam pa bzhis yul la rgyug par ston to //
translated: Those who are frightened by objects are shown to run to objects in four ways, because they do not understand the cause of fear.

original: yul mchog tu khyad par du 'phags pa 'dod pa dang yul dran pa'i kun du rtog pa dang du len pa dang / yang slar ldog pa dang / mtho ris su skyes pa'i mtha' ltung ba ste /
analyzed: yul mchog tu khyad par du 'phags pa 'dod pa dang yul dran pa'i kun du rtog pa dang du len pa dang / yang slar ldog pa dang / mtho ris su skyes pa'i mtha' ltung ba ste /
translated: They are: the desire for the most excellent object, the discursive thought of remembering the object, the acceptance of the object, and the falling from the end of rebirth in the heavens.

original: dgon pa'i gnas rnams na gnas zhes bya ba ni yul mchog tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir dgon pa na gnas par khas len to //

analyzed: de dag na gcig pu gnyis su med par lus rab tu dben par 'dug ste /
translated: They dwell alone, without a companion, in complete seclusion.

original: chags par 'gyur ba'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams snang bar gyur na de dag de la btang snyoms su 'jog cing nyams rangs su sbyor ba dang ldan par gnas kyi nang du so sor rtog pa las mi brtson te zhes bya ba ni yul dran pa'i kun du rtog pa dang du len to

translated: When forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches that arouse passion appear, he remains indifferent to them, and he remains engaged in indulgence. He does not strive to discern them internally.

original: ma shes khong du ma chud pas /

translated: he goes to towns, villages, countries, and royal palaces, and again is overwhelmed by forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches.

analyzed: der yang de dag lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag gis g-yen spyo bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: lta ba la spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas dkar po'i phyogs su bstan par rig bar bya ste /

analyzed: de bas na rta'i 'dul sbyong la mkhas pa'i dpes ni sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa sems mnyam par bzhag pa'i thabs te zhig gnas rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi nye bar nyon mongs ba rnams kyis zhi gnas la sogs pa'i mtshan ma la 'khrug pa'i sems tshar bcad pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the example of the skilled horse trainer shows the method for placing the mind in equipoise that is, the retention of stability and the method for overcoming the mind that is disturbed by the signs of calm abiding, etc. , by the secondary afflictions of equanimity.

analyzed: lkog ma na ba'i nad dang / skyes bu bcings pa'i dpe gnyis kyis ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa rnam par grol bar bya ba'i thabs ston te ;

original: 'od srungs ji ltar dge slong khyi rdo la bsnyegs pa dang 'dra ba ma yin zhe na /🔽gang gshe yang slar mi gshe /🔽khros kyang slar mi khro /
analyzed: 'od srungs ji ltar dge slong khyi rdo la bsnyegs pa dang 'dra ba ma yin zhe na / gang gshe yang slar mi gshe / khros kyang slar mi khro /
translated: He should think to himself, Who is angry with me? Who is striking me? Who is reviling me? Who is abusing me? Who is beating me? Who is cutting me?

original: rdeg kyang slar mi rdeg /🔽mtshang brus kyang slar yang mtshang mi 'bru ste /🔽'di la gshe ba'am /🔽khros pa 'am /🔽brdegs pa 'am /
analyzed: rdeg kyang slar mi rdeg / mtshang brus kyang slar yang mtshang mi 'bru ste / 'di la gshe ba'am / khros pa 'am / brdegs pa 'am /
translated: He should think to himself, Who is angry with me? Who is striking me? Who is reviling me? Who is abusing me? Who is beating me? Who is cutting me?

original: mtshang brus pa gang yin snyam du nang du sems la nges par rtog cing /🔽so sor rtog ces bya ba ni 'di ltar dgon par song nas chags par 'gyur ba'i gzugs @250a * //
analyzed: mtshang brus pa gang yin snyam du nang du sems la nges par rtog cing /🔽so sor rtog ces bya ba ni 'di ltar dgon par song nas chags par 'gyur ba'i gzugs @250a * //
translated: He should think to himself, Who is angry with me? Who is striking me? Who is reviling me? Who is abusing me? Who is beating me? Who is cutting me?

original: la sogs par snang bar gyur na de dag la btang snyoms su mi 'jog cing nang du so sor rtog pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams las cis 'byung ba shes te /
analyzed: la sogs par snang bar gyur na de dag la btang snyoms su mi 'jog cing nang du so sor rtog pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams las cis 'byung ba shes te /
translated: If they appear in this way, he does not remain indifferent to them. He is endowed with the yoga of inner discernment. He knows what arises from forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangibles.

original: de de dag gis g-yen spyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de dag gis g-yen spyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He is not overwhelmed by them.

original: de dag las grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag las grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He is liberated from them.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan pas gnyen po'i don kyang bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan pas gnyen po'i don kyang bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of the antidotes is also taught by teaching their resistances.

original: de ltar na khyi rdo la bsnyegs pa dang 'dra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na khyi rdo la bsnyegs pa dang 'dra ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, he is not like a dog chasing a stone.

original: de ltar chags sems dang mi bde ba 'dul ba'i phyir lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar chags sems dang mi bde ba 'dul ba'i phyir lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: Thus, in order to subdue attachment and unhappiness, he applies himself to the training in superior morality.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na rta'i 'dul sbyong la mkhas pas rta de gang dang gang du g-yo byed cing /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na rta'i 'dul sbyong la mkhas pas rta de gang dang gang du g-yo byed cing /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this: a skilled horse trainer first tames a wild horse.

original: ma byang ba de dang der rab tu sbyor ba de bzhin du 'od srungs dge slong rnal 'byor spyod pa yang gang dang gang du sems 'gyur ba mthong ba de dang der rab tu 'chos pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: ma byang ba de dang der rab tu sbyor ba de bzhin du 'od srungs dge slong rnal 'byor spyod pa yang gang dang gang du sems 'gyur ba mthong ba de dang der rab tu 'chos pa la 'jug ste /
translated: Just as one who is not skilled in training a horse applies the bit in whatever way the horse’s mind moves, in the same way, KaSyapa, a monk yogacarin should apply himself to correcting whatever the mind moves to.🔽He should correct the mind so that it will not move again.

original: de ci nas phyis 'khrug par mi 'gyur ba de ltar sems rab tu 'chos so zhes bya ba de'i 'dul sbyong la mkhas pa'i dpe des ni skyo ba yid la byed pas lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de ci nas phyis 'khrug par mi 'gyur ba de ltar sems rab tu 'chos so zhes bya ba de'i 'dul sbyong la mkhas pa'i dpe des ni skyo ba yid la byed pas lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: This example of skill in training shows the application to the higher training of mind through attention to disenchantment.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
translated: KaSyapa, it is like this:🔽Just as a throat disease impairs the life faculty, so does grasping at self among all views impair the life of the Dharma.

original: dper na lkog ma'i nad kyis srog gi dbang po nyams par 'gyur ba de bzhin du lta bar song ba thams cad kyi nang na bdag tu 'dzin pa ni chos kyi srog gi dbang po nyams par byed do zhes bya ba lkog ma'i nad kyi dpe dang /
analyzed: dper na lkog ma'i nad kyis srog gi dbang po nyams par 'gyur ba de bzhin du lta bar song ba thams cad kyi nang na bdag tu 'dzin pa ni chos kyi srog gi dbang po nyams par byed do zhes bya ba lkog ma'i nad kyi dpe dang /
translated: This is the example of a throat disease.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu gang dang gang du bcings pa de dang de las dgrol bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu gang dang gang du bcings pa de dang de las dgrol bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this: for example, a person is bound by whatever he is bound with.🔽Kāśyapa, in the same way, the mind is liberated from whatever it is attached to.

original: 'od srungs de bzhin du gang dang gang la sems chags par gyur pa de dang de las grol bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba skyes bu bcings pa'i dpe des ni gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pas lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs de bzhin du gang dang gang la sems chags par gyur pa de dang de las grol bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba skyes bu bcings pa'i dpe des ni gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pas lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: This example of a bound person shows that one should apply oneself to the training in higher wisdom through the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: gang gi tshe chags sems dang yid bde ba 'dul ba lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa la sbyor bar gsungs na ci'i phyir mdo 'di las lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la sbyor bar brjod pa smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chags sems dang yid bde ba 'dul ba lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa la sbyor bar gsungs na ci'i phyir mdo 'di las lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la sbyor bar brjod pa smras pa /
translated: When it is said that one should apply oneself to the training in higher mind in order to subdue attachment and mental pleasure, why is it said in this sūtra that one should apply oneself to the training in higher ethics?

original: chags sems dang yid mi bde ba ni nyes pa 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chags sems dang yid mi bde ba ni nyes pa 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because attachment and mental unhappiness cause faults to arise.

original: nyes pa ni phal cher 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyes pa ni phal cher 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang las 'byung ngo //
translated: Faults mostly arise from attachment and aversion.

original: de bas na chags pa dang yid mi bde ba 'dul ba /
analyzed: de bas na chags pa dang yid mi bde ba 'dul ba /
translated: Therefore, it is the taming of attachment and mental dissatisfaction.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la bslab pa la sbyor bar bshad do //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la bslab pa la sbyor bar bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one should apply oneself to the training in superior morality in order to subdue attachment and mental dissatisfaction.

original: ji ltar na chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba las nyes pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba las nyes pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit an offense due to attachment and mental dissatisfaction?

original: rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /
translated: For two reasons:

original: ji ltar mi sel ba dang / ji ltar bstsal ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mi sel ba dang / ji ltar bstsal ba yin no //
translated: because one does not eliminate them and because one eliminates them.

original: ji ltar mi @250b sel ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi @250b sel ce na /
translated: How does one not eliminate them?

original: dper na 'di la dge sbyong dang / bram ze kha cig kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yongs su mi shes pas gzugs la sogs pa yul gyis 'jigs nas dgon pa'i gnas rnams su gnas te /
analyzed: dper na 'di la dge sbyong dang / bram ze kha cig kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yongs su mi shes pas gzugs la sogs pa yul gyis 'jigs nas dgon pa'i gnas rnams su gnas te /
translated: For example, some ascetics and brahmins, not knowing the cause of the afflictions, live in isolated hermitages, fearing the objects of the senses such as forms.

original: rang gi sems tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las byung ba'i chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba ni yul dang gzhan la yang nga rgyal gyis rlom sems su byed pas chags sems la sogs pa dang rjes su 'brel ba yin te /
analyzed: rang gi sems tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las byung ba'i chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba ni yul dang gzhan la yang nga rgyal gyis rlom sems su byed pas chags sems la sogs pa dang rjes su 'brel ba yin te /
translated: But their attachment and mental dissatisfaction arise from improper attention to their own minds, and they are connected with attachment and so on because they are conceited about their superiority over others and the objects of the senses.

original: khyi rdo 'phangs nas rdo la bsnyegs pa de bzhin du chags pa sems la sogs pa mi sel bas /
analyzed: khyi rdo 'phangs nas rdo la bsnyegs pa de bzhin du chags pa sems la sogs pa mi sel bas /
translated: Just as a dog, when struck with a stone, pursues the stone and not the thrower, so too, if one is not free of attachment to the mind, etc.,

original: gal te grong la sogs pa dang 'dre ba na mngon sum du byed de /
analyzed: gal te grong la sogs pa dang 'dre ba na mngon sum du byed de /
translated: one will not be free of attachment to the village, etc.

original: de ltar na ma bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ma bsal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, one is not free of attachment.

original: de las bzlog pa ni sel ba dang bstsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni sel ba dang bstsal ba yin no //
translated: The opposite of that is being free of attachment and having been free of attachment.

original: ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: nag po'i phyogs la chags sems bstsal ba bstan gyi /
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs la chags sems bstsal ba bstan gyi /
translated: It is taught that one is free of attachment to the dark side,

original: gnod sems ni ma yin dkar po'i phyogs la yang gnod sems bstsal ba bstan gyi /
analyzed: gnod sems ni ma yin dkar po'i phyogs la yang gnod sems bstsal ba bstan gyi /
translated: but not free of malice. It is taught that one is free of malice toward the bright side,

original: chags sems ni ma yin /
analyzed: chags sems ni ma yin /
translated: but not free of attachment.

original: smras pa / gnyi ga yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi yin pas ;
analyzed: smras pa / gnyi ga yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi yin pas ;
translated: It is said that both are in the desire realm.

original: gzhan ma bsal bas gzhan yang ma bstsal ba ltar gzhan bstsal pas gzhan yang bstsal bar blta'o //
analyzed: gzhan ma bsal bas gzhan yang ma bstsal ba ltar gzhan bstsal pas gzhan yang bstsal bar blta'o //
translated: Just as one is not free of the other when one is not free of the other, so too, one is free of the other when one is free of the other.

original: gal te dgon par son pa las 'chi ba'i dus byas bar gyur na zhes bya ba ni de ltar mi sel bas sdom pa la gnas kyang lhag pa'i tshul khrims las log par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te dgon par son pa las 'chi ba'i dus byas bar gyur na zhes bya ba ni de ltar mi sel bas sdom pa la gnas kyang lhag pa'i tshul khrims las log par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: If he should die while in the monastery, he would be one who, though abiding in the vow, has turned away from the higher morality.

original: sdom pa la mi gnas pa lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: sdom pa la mi gnas pa lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: How much more so for one who does not abide in the vow!

original: 'di lta ste dper na rta lam log par rgyu ba ni sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na rta lam log par rgyu ba ni sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: For example, a horse that goes astray on the road is said to be misbehaving.

original: de bzhin lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa la sbyor ba'i rnal 'byor spyod pa yang /
analyzed: de bzhin lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa la sbyor ba'i rnal 'byor spyod pa yang /
translated: In the same way, a practitioner who is engaged in the training of higher thought

original: dmigs pa la rnam par g-yengs pa ni rnam par 'khrugs pa zhes bya'o //🔽dper na lkog man ba'i nad kyis srog gi dbang po nyams par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba yang gang zag la bdag med pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: dmigs pa la rnam par g-yengs pa ni rnam par 'khrugs pa zhes bya'o // dper na lkog man ba'i nad kyis srog gi dbang po nyams par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba yang gang zag la bdag med pa las brtsams te /
translated: is said to be disturbed if he is distracted from his object.🔽For example, a disease of the throat can impair the faculty of speech.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab la sbyor ba'i srog gi dbang po nyams par byed do //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab la sbyor ba'i srog gi dbang po nyams par byed do //
translated: In the same way, the afflicted view of the self impairs the faculty of life for one who is engaged in the training of higher wisdom, beginning with the selflessness of persons.

original: dper na skyes bu gang dang gang du bcings pa de dang de las grol bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu gang dang gang du bcings pa de dang de las grol bar bya ba yin te /
translated: For example, a person is to be liberated from whatever he is bound to.

original: de bzhin du chos la bdag med pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos la bdag med pa las brtsams te /
translated: In the same way, beginning with the selflessness of dharmas,

original: lhag pa'i shes rab la sbyor bas so //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab la sbyor bas so //
translated: one is to be liberated from the bondage of conceptualization.

original: gang dang gang du zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang bye brag la yongs su rtog pa rnams las sems dgrol bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang dang gang du zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang bye brag la yongs su rtog pa rnams las sems dgrol bar bya ba yin no //
translated: “ Whatever” means that the mind is to be liberated from all conceptualizations of entities and attributes.

original: bslab pa 'di gsum bsgom pa bslab pa dang mi mthun pa'i chos brgyad de /
analyzed: bslab pa 'di gsum bsgom pa bslab pa dang mi mthun pa'i chos brgyad de /
translated: There are eight dharmas incompatible with the three trainings.

original: de la slob pa dang mi mthun pa'i don byed pa la chags pa ni /🔽'od srungs 'di @251a * //
analyzed: de la slob pa dang mi mthun pa'i don byed pa la chags pa ni / 'od srungs 'di @251a * //
translated: Among them, attachment to activities incompatible with the training is as follows:

original: gnyis ni rab tu byung ba'i nam mkha' la yongs su chags pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis ni rab tu byung ba'i nam mkha' la yongs su chags pa ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, these two are strongly attached to the sky of the renunciant.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i brjod pa tshol ba dang / lhung bzed dang / gos lhag pa 'chang ngo zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de mi dgos pas nam mkha' la yongs su chags pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i brjod pa tshol ba dang / lhung bzed dang / gos lhag pa 'chang ngo zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de mi dgos pas nam mkha' la yongs su chags pa bzhin no //
translated: and “to seek the treatises of the Lokāyatas, and to keep extra begging bowls and robes.”

original: yongs su chags pa yang 'og nas 'ching ba gnyis 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: yongs su chags pa yang 'og nas 'ching ba gnyis 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Attachment is the cause for the arising of the two bonds that will be mentioned below.

original: 'jig rten rgyang ban pa'i brjod pa yongs su chol bas ni lta bar gyur ba'i 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang ban pa'i brjod pa yongs su chol bas ni lta bar gyur ba'i 'ching ba'o //
translated: The bond of views is due to seeking the treatises of the Lokāyatas.

original: lhung bzed dang / gos lhag pa 'chang bas ni thob pa dang bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i 'ching ba ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang / gos lhag pa 'chang bas ni thob pa dang bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i 'ching ba ste /
translated: The bond of gain, honor, and flattery is due to keeping extra begging bowls and robes.

original: 'od srungs 'di gnyis ni rab tu byung ba'i bcing ba dam pa'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di gnyis ni rab tu byung ba'i bcing ba dam pa'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, these two are the tight bonds of those gone forth.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: lta bar gyur ba'i 'ching ba dang / 'thob pa dang / bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa'i 'ching ba'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lta bar gyur ba'i 'ching ba dang / 'thob pa dang / bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa'i 'ching ba'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The bond of views and the bond of gain, honor, and flattery.”

original: 'ching ba yang bar du gcod pa 'og nas 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'ching ba yang bar du gcod pa 'og nas 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Also, the fetters are the cause of the obstacles that will be mentioned below.

original: lta bar gyur pa'i 'ching ba ni 'phags pa'i phyogs la gnod par sems pa 'thob pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i bcing ba ni khyim pa'i phyogs la bstan te /
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa'i 'ching ba ni 'phags pa'i phyogs la gnod par sems pa 'thob pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i bcing ba ni khyim pa'i phyogs la bstan te /
translated: The fetter of views is the intention to harm the side of the āryas, and the fetter of gain and honor and verses is the intention to harm the side of householders.

original: 'od srungs 'di gnyis ni rab tu byung ba'i bar du gcod pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di gnyis ni rab tu byung ba'i bar du gcod pa'i chos so //
translated: Kāśyapa, these two are dharmas that obstruct going forth.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: 'phags pa'i phyogs la gnod par sems pa dang / khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i phyogs la gnod par sems pa dang / khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The intention to harm the side of the āryas and the intention to harm the side of householders.

original: bar du gcod pa yang 'og nas 'byung ba dri ma'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: bar du gcod pa yang 'og nas 'byung ba dri ma'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Also, the obstacles are the cause of the stains that will be mentioned below.

original: 'phags pa'i phyogs la gnod par sems pas ni nyon mongs pa la mjed /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i phyogs la gnod par sems pas ni nyon mongs pa la mjed /
translated: By the intention to harm the side of the āryas, one is harmed by afflictions.

original: khyim pa'i phyogs dang / bsten pas ni mdza' ba'i khyim dang / zas sbyin pa'i khyim yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs dang / bsten pas ni mdza' ba'i khyim dang / zas sbyin pa'i khyim yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: By the intention to harm the side of householders, one takes up the householders who are friends and the householders who give food.

original: 'od srungs 'di gnyis ni rab tu byung ba'i dri ma'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di gnyis ni rab tu byung ba'i dri ma'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, these two are stains for those gone forth.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: dam pa'i chos spong ba dang / tshul khrims las nyams kyang dad pas byin pa yongs su spyod pa'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos spong ba dang / tshul khrims las nyams kyang dad pas byin pa yongs su spyod pa'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Abandoning the holy Dharma and enjoying what is given in faith even though one’s ethical discipline has declined.

original: dri ma yang 'og nas 'byung ba sol ba 'bab pa'i rgyu yin te /🔽nyon mongs pa la mi mjed pa ni dam pa'i chos spong ba'i mdza' bo'i khyim dang / zas sbyin pa'i khyim yongs su 'dzin pa ni ngang tshul ngan pa'i rkyen la bsten cing /
analyzed: dri ma yang 'og nas 'byung ba sol ba 'bab pa'i rgyu yin te / nyon mongs pa la mi mjed pa ni dam pa'i chos spong ba'i mdza' bo'i khyim dang / zas sbyin pa'i khyim yongs su 'dzin pa ni ngang tshul ngan pa'i rkyen la bsten cing /
translated: Stains are also causes of the rain of soot that will occur later.🔽Not being patient with afflictions is the friend who abandons the holy Dharma.

original: tshul khrims las nyams kyang dad pas byin pa yongs su spyod pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims las nyams kyang dad pas byin pa yongs su spyod pa ste /
translated: Enjoying what is given in faith even though one’s ethical discipline has declined is the condition of relying on bad character.

original: 'od srungs 'di gnyis ni rab tu byung ba'i ser ba 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di gnyis ni rab tu byung ba'i ser ba 'bab pa'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, these two are the rain of soot for those gone forth.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: dam pa'i chos spong ba dang / tshul khrims las nyams kyang dad pas byin pa yongs su spyod pa'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos spong ba dang / tshul khrims las nyams kyang dad pas byin pa yongs su spyod pa'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Abandoning the holy Dharma and enjoying what is given in faith even though one’s ethical discipline has declined.

original: @251b ser ba yang 'og nas 'byung ba rma'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: @251b ser ba yang 'og nas 'byung ba rma'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Also, hail is a cause of wounds, as will be explained below.

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su spong bas ni pha rol gyi nyes pa las so sor rtog /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su spong bas ni pha rol gyi nyes pa las so sor rtog /
translated: Abandoning the true Dharma is the cause of discerning the faults of others.

original: tshul khrims las nyams kyang dad pas byin pa yongs su spyod pas ni rang gi nyes pa 'chab ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims las nyams kyang dad pas byin pa yongs su spyod pas ni rang gi nyes pa 'chab ste /
translated: Even though one’s morality has declined, one may enjoy the offerings of the faithful by concealing one’s faults.

original: 'od srungs 'di gnyis ni rab tu byung ba'i rma'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di gnyis ni rab tu byung ba'i rma'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, these two are wounds for those who have gone forth.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: pha rol gyi nyes pa la so sor rtog pa dang / bdag gi nyes pa 'chab pa'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi nyes pa la so sor rtog pa dang / bdag gi nyes pa 'chab pa'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Discerning the faults of others and concealing one’s own faults.

original: rma yang 'og nas 'byung ba yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: rma yang 'og nas 'byung ba yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Wounds are also causes of torment, as will be explained below.

original: pha rol gyi nyes pa la so sor rtog pas ni rnyog pa dang bcas pas dur smrig 'chang /
analyzed: pha rol gyi nyes pa la so sor rtog pas ni rnyog pa dang bcas pas dur smrig 'chang /
translated: Discerning the faults of others is the cause of wearing the saffron robes while being defiled.

original: bdag nyid nyes pa 'chab bas ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa yon tan dang ldan pa las bsnyen bkur bya ba bdag gir byed de /
analyzed: bdag nyid nyes pa 'chab bas ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa yon tan dang ldan pa las bsnyen bkur bya ba bdag gir byed de /
translated: Concealing one’s own faults is the cause of receiving service from those who have morality and good qualities.

original: 'od srungs 'di gnyis ni rab tu byung ba'i yongs su gdung ba'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di gnyis ni rab tu byung ba'i yongs su gdung ba'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, these two are the torments of one who has gone forth.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: rnyog pa dang bcas pas dur smrig 'chang ba dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa yon tan dang ldan pa las bsnyen bkur bya ba bdag gir byed pa'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnyog pa dang bcas pas dur smrig 'chang ba dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa yon tan dang ldan pa las bsnyen bkur bya ba bdag gir byed pa'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Wearing the ochre robes while full of impurities, and taking on the service of those who have moral discipline and good qualities.

original: yongs su gdung ba yang 'og nas 'byung ba na ba gsor mi rung ba gnyis kyi nad kyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba yang 'og nas 'byung ba na ba gsor mi rung ba gnyis kyi nad kyi rgyu yin te /
translated: The torments that will occur later are the causes of the two incurable sicknesses.

original: rnyog pa dang bcas pas dur smrig 'chang bas mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi sems la nges par rtog / bsnyen bkur bya ba bdag gir byed pas ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyi mos pa bzlog ste /
analyzed: rnyog pa dang bcas pas dur smrig 'chang bas mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi sems la nges par rtog / bsnyen bkur bya ba bdag gir byed pas ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyi mos pa bzlog ste /
translated: Wearing the ochre robes while full of impurities is the conception of pride. Taking on the service of those who have moral discipline and good qualities is the reversal of the interest of sentient beings who have set out in the Great Vehicle.

original: 'od srungs 'di gnyis ni rab tu byung ba'i na ba gsor mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di gnyis ni rab tu byung ba'i na ba gsor mi rung ba'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, these two are the incurable sicknesses of one who has gone forth.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis sems la nges par rtog pa dang / theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyi mos pa bzlog pa'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis sems la nges par rtog pa dang / theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyi mos pa bzlog pa'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: and to conceive of the mind with the pride of self-conceit.

original: de las bzlog pa ni dkar po'i phyogs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni dkar po'i phyogs su rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of these should be understood as the bright side.

original: gang zag de gnyis la dang po ni lta ba la spyod pa /
analyzed: gang zag de gnyis la dang po ni lta ba la spyod pa /
translated: Of these two kinds of persons, the first is one who practices with views,

original: gnyis pa ni sred par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sred par rig par bya'o //
translated: and the second is one who practices with craving.

original: 'od srungs dge sbyong dge sbyong zhes bya ba 'od srungs ci tsam gyis na dge sbyong dge sbyong zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'od srungs dge sbyong dge sbyong zhes bya ba 'od srungs ci tsam gyis na dge sbyong dge sbyong zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Kaśyapa, one who is called a monk is called a monk because of what?🔽Kaśyapa, these four are called monks.

original: 'od srungs bzhi po 'di dag ni dge sbyong zhes bya ba mtshams ji ltar sbyar zhe na /
analyzed: 'od srungs bzhi po 'di dag ni dge sbyong zhes bya ba mtshams ji ltar sbyar zhe na /
translated: How are they connected?

original: ji ltar bslab pa dang mi mthun pa'i chos nyid de dag la brten pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar bslab pa dang mi mthun pa'i chos nyid de dag la brten pa'am /
translated: They are connected to the nature of the Dharma that is not in accord with training,

original: spangs pa las gang zag gi nyes pa 'am /
analyzed: spangs pa las gang zag gi nyes pa 'am /
translated: or to the faults of persons who rely on that or who have abandoned it.

original: gang zag gi yon tan bsgrubs nas rnal 'byor yid la byed pa'i bgegs su 'gyur ba dang / mi 'gyur ba kun du bstan no //
analyzed: gang zag gi yon tan bsgrubs nas rnal 'byor yid la byed pa'i bgegs su 'gyur ba dang / mi 'gyur ba kun du bstan no //
translated: The faults of persons are taught in order to show which are obstacles to the yogas that should be practiced and which are not.

original: de la gang zag gi nyes pa ni gang @252a * //
analyzed: de la gang zag gi nyes pa ni gang @252a * //
translated: What are the faults of persons?

original: zag rnam pa gsum las brtsams te rig par bya ste /🔽kha dog dang rtags kyi dbyibs kyi dge sbyong ni sbyor ba dang bsam pa log par zhugs pa'i sdig pa 'dod pa las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: zag rnam pa gsum las brtsams te rig par bya ste / kha dog dang rtags kyi dbyibs kyi dge sbyong ni sbyor ba dang bsam pa log par zhugs pa'i sdig pa 'dod pa las brtsams pa'o //
translated: They should be understood in terms of three kinds of persons.🔽The ascetic who is a fraud in color and shape, and the ascetic who is a fraud in ritual and hypocrisy, are both motivated by the desire for evil, because they have entered upon a wrong practice and a wrong aspiration.

original: cho ga bsrung zhing tshul 'chos pa'i dge sbyong dang brjod pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa'i dge sbyong ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs kyang bsam pa log par zhugs pa dang / 'dod pa che zhing 'dod pa rnam gnyis las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: cho ga bsrung zhing tshul 'chos pa'i dge sbyong dang brjod pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa'i dge sbyong ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs kyang bsam pa log par zhugs pa dang / 'dod pa che zhing 'dod pa rnam gnyis las brtsams pa'o //
translated: The ascetic who is a fraud in speech and verse is motivated by the desire for the two kinds of gain, because he has entered upon a wrong aspiration, although his practice is perfect.

original: de la sdig pa 'dod pa ni gang dge sbyong du khas 'che ba yang dge sbyong yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sdig pa 'dod pa ni gang dge sbyong du khas 'che ba yang dge sbyong yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: Among these, the one who desires evil is the one who claims to be an ascetic, but is not.

original: 'dod chags gang yon tan bdog pas lhag par bdag la yid ches par 'dod pa'o //🔽'dod pa can ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags gang yon tan bdog pas lhag par bdag la yid ches par 'dod pa'o // 'dod pa can ni /
translated: Attachment is the desire to believe in the self as superior because of the possession of good qualities.

original: gang mtshungs par yid ches par 'dod pa'o //🔽dang po sbyor ba log par zhugs pa ma lags pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gang mtshungs par yid ches par 'dod pa'o // dang po sbyor ba log par zhugs pa ma lags pa gnyis te /
translated: Desire is the desire to believe in the self as equal.🔽The first two are not engaged in wrong practice.

original: lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma ma lus pa'o //
translated: The other two are engaged in wrong practice.

original: lhag ma dang bcas pa ni bzhi las brtsams nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma dang bcas pa ni bzhi las brtsams nas rig par bya'o //
translated: The one with remainder is to be understood in terms of the four.

original: yang dag par blangs ba nyams pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: yang dag par blangs ba nyams pa las brtsams te /
translated: The one without remainder is to be understood in terms of the degeneration of the vow.

original: de la lus kyi las yongs su ma dag pa spyod pa dang / ngag gi las yongs su ma dag pa spyod pa dang / yid kyi las yongs su ma dag pa spyod pa'o zhes gang gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la lus kyi las yongs su ma dag pa spyod pa dang / ngag gi las yongs su ma dag pa spyod pa dang / yid kyi las yongs su ma dag pa spyod pa'o zhes gang gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The one with remainder is the one who, in the above passage, is said to be “one who practices impure bodily action, one who practices impure verbal action, and one who practices impure mental action.🔽”

original: de gsum las ma dul ba dang / ma spags pa dang / ma byung ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de gsum las ma dul ba dang / ma spags pa dang / ma byung ba 'byung ste /
translated: From these three, the undisciplined, the undisciplined-undisciplined, and the undisciplined-disciplined arise, respectively.

original: go rims bzhin du ston te /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du ston te /
translated: This is taught in order.

original: zas kyi phyir rgyu ba las brtsams te 'tsho ba yongs su ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: zas kyi phyir rgyu ba las brtsams te 'tsho ba yongs su ma dag pa'o //
translated: The impure livelihood is taught in terms of wandering about for the sake of food.

original: 'dod chen can zhes bya ba ni yongs su spyad pa las brtsams pa ste /🔽'dod chen can ni 'jog cing yongs su spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chen can zhes bya ba ni yongs su spyad pa las brtsams pa ste / 'dod chen can ni 'jog cing yongs su spyod pa'o //
translated: The one who is greedy is one who is greedy for enjoyment.

original: le lo can zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i phyogs las brtsams nas le lo can no //
analyzed: le lo can zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i phyogs las brtsams nas le lo can no //
translated: The one who is lazy is one who is lazy with regard to the side of virtue.

original: ngang tshul ngan pa can zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims ma lus par zhig ste /
analyzed: ngang tshul ngan pa can zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims ma lus par zhig ste /
translated: The one who is immoral is one who has completely destroyed morality,

original: rtsa ba la thug pa'i nyes pa byung ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba la thug pa'i nyes pa byung ba'o //
translated: having incurred a root downfall.

original: sdig pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni bsam pa log par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni bsam pa log par 'jug pa ste /
translated: The one who has evil qualities is one who is engaged in evil thoughts,

original: sdig pa'i chos kyi nyes pa la 'chab pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos kyi nyes pa la 'chab pa'o //
translated: concealing the evil qualities of his faults.

original: gnyis pa ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The second is the perfection of application,

original: cho ga dang / 'tsho ba dang / tshul khrims dang yongs su spyod pa dang / dge ba'i phyogs rnams nas brtsams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: cho ga dang / 'tsho ba dang / tshul khrims dang yongs su spyod pa dang / dge ba'i phyogs rnams nas brtsams par rig par bya'o //
translated: which should be understood as beginning with ritual, livelihood, morality, enjoyment, and the side of virtue.

original: de la cho ga phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni cho ga las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: de la cho ga phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni cho ga las brtsams pa'o //
translated: Among them, the perfection of ritual is one who is engaged in ritual.

original: spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba las brtsams pa'o //
translated: The phrase he is endowed with the perfection of the sphere of action refers to his livelihood.

original: spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa yin zhing spyod lam bzhir shes bzhin du spyod ces bya ba ni tshul khrims las brtsams pa'o //🔽@252b zas dang skom ngan pa za zhing 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi po dag gis chog par 'dzin ces bya ba ni yongs su spyod pa las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa yin zhing spyod lam bzhir shes bzhin du spyod ces bya ba ni tshul khrims las brtsams pa'o // @252b zas dang skom ngan pa za zhing 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi po dag gis chog par 'dzin ces bya ba ni yongs su spyod pa las brtsams pa'o //
translated: The phrase he is endowed with the perfection of conduct refers to his morality.🔽The phrase he is satisfied with whatever is obtained refers to his contentment.

original: khyim na gnas pa dang rab tu byung ba rnams dang mi 'dre zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i phyogs las brtsams so //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa dang rab tu byung ba rnams dang mi 'dre zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i phyogs las brtsams so //
translated: The phrase he does not associate with householders and monks refers to his virtuous side.

original: tshig nyung zhing smra ba nyung zhes bya ba ni tshig bden pa dang yang dag pa'i gtam gyis dga' bar byed ba las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig nyung zhing smra ba nyung zhes bya ba ni tshig bden pa dang yang dag pa'i gtam gyis dga' bar byed ba las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase he speaks little and slowly refers to his delight in speaking the truth and in speaking correctly.

original: de'i spyod lam de dag kyang tshul 'chos pa dang / gcam gyis brtags pa yin zhes bya ba ni bsam pa log par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i spyod lam de dag kyang tshul 'chos pa dang / gcam gyis brtags pa yin zhes bya ba ni bsam pa log par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The phrase his conduct is not artificial or pretentious refers to his not engaging in wrong thoughts.

original: de yang cho ga la sogs pa'i sbyor ba las brtsams nas /
analyzed: de yang cho ga la sogs pa'i sbyor ba las brtsams nas /
translated: Moreover, beginning with the application of the rite, etc.,

original: tshul 'chos dang / gcam du rig par bya'o //🔽dmigs par lta ba yin te /
analyzed: tshul 'chos dang / gcam du rig par bya'o // dmigs par lta ba yin te /
translated: one should know hypocrisy and deceit.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa la gnas zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med pa las brtsams pa ste /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa la gnas zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med pa las brtsams pa ste /
translated: The view of an objective referent is as follows: One dwells in the grasping of 'I' and 'mine'., beginning with the selflessness of the person.

original: bdag tu lta ba kun tu 'byung ba'i bag la nyal ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba kun tu 'byung ba'i bag la nyal ma spangs pa'o //
translated: It is the non-abandonment of the latent proclivity for the arising of the view of self.

original: stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i chos rnams la g-yang sar 'du shes zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos la bdag med pa las brtsams pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i chos rnams la g-yang sar 'du shes zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos la bdag med pa las brtsams pa ste /
translated: The view of an objective referent is as follows: One perceives the non-apprehension of emptiness and the dharmas as a precipice, etc., beginning with the selflessness of dharmas.

original: stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa dang / de la smra ba rnams la g-yang sa dgrar 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa dang / de la smra ba rnams la g-yang sa dgrar 'du shes pa'o //
translated: It is the perception of the non-apprehension of emptiness and the dharmas as a precipice.

original: gsum pa ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The third is the perfection of application,

original: rnal 'byor gyi gzhi dang / dmigs pa dang / gnas dang / rnal 'byor gyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos rnams las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi gzhi dang / dmigs pa dang / gnas dang / rnal 'byor gyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos rnams las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
translated: which should be understood as beginning with the basis of yoga, the objective referent, the abode, and the dharmas that are in conformity with yoga.

original: de la gzhi ni tshul khrims te /
analyzed: de la gzhi ni tshul khrims te /
translated: The basis is morality,

original: de las brtsams nas so sor brtags pas tshul khrims bsrung zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las brtsams nas so sor brtags pas tshul khrims bsrung zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, “One should guard morality through analysis, having undertaken it.”

original: dmigs pa 'thob pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa 'thob pa ste /
translated: The object is the acquisition of learning,🔽because one accomplishes yoga through learning as an object,

original: thos pa la dmigs nas rnal 'byor 'grub pa'i phyir te so sor brtags nas thos pa 'dzin ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa la dmigs nas rnal 'byor 'grub pa'i phyir te so sor brtags nas thos pa 'dzin ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, “One should retain learning through analysis.”

original: gnas ni dgon pa na gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gnas ni dgon pa na gnas pa ste /
translated: The place is living in the forest,

original: rnal 'byor dang mthun pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor dang mthun pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is suitable for yoga,

original: so sor brtags nas dgon pa la gnas zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor brtags nas dgon pa la gnas zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, “One should live in the forest through analysis.”

original: rnal 'byor rjes su mthun pa'i chos rnams ni 'dod pa chung zhing cho ga shes pa dang / rab tu dben par 'gyur te zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rjes su mthun pa'i chos rnams ni 'dod pa chung zhing cho ga shes pa dang / rab tu dben par 'gyur te zhes bya'o //
translated: The dharmas that are suitable for yoga are few desires, knowing the rules, and being secluded.

original: bsam pa log par zhugs pa ni ye shes kyi 'dod par rig par bya ste //
analyzed: bsam pa log par zhugs pa ni ye shes kyi 'dod par rig par bya ste //
translated: The perversion of attitude should be understood as the desire for knowledge,

original: ji tsam du gzhan la nye bar bstan pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: ji tsam du gzhan la nye bar bstan pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: because it is said, “One should teach the Dharma through analysis for the sake of others,

original: skyo bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: skyo bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of weariness.”

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of freedom from attachment,

original: 'gog par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: 'gog par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of cessation,

original: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of complete peace,

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /🔽dge sbyong gi @253a * //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub par bya ba'i phyir ma yin / dge sbyong gi @253a * //
translated: not for the sake of perfect enlightenment,

original: phyir ma yin /
analyzed: phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of the religious life,

original: tshangs pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of heaven,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: not for the sake of nirvana.

original: de la nye bar zhi bas ni skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar ston to //
analyzed: de la nye bar zhi bas ni skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar ston to //
translated: Here, complete peace shows disenchantment and freedom from attachment.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs dga' ba can gyi 'dod chags nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs dga' ba can gyi 'dod chags nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro /
translated: Therefore, it is for the sake of the complete peace of attachment to pleasure, which is the opposite of that.

original: rdzogs par byang chub pas ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par byang chub pas ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: Perfect enlightenment shows cessation.

original: rdzogs par byang chub pas ni dge slong dang tshangs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pas bsdus pa la lam dang de'i 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: rdzogs par byang chub pas ni dge slong dang tshangs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pas bsdus pa la lam dang de'i 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: Perfect enlightenment shows the path and its result, which are included in the religious life, heaven, and nirvana.

original: gang zag bzhi pa ni gnyi ga phun sum tshogs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag bzhi pa ni gnyi ga phun sum tshogs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
translated: The fourth person is endowed with both perfections, and his perfections are to be known as ninefold.

original: rtag tu sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / nyan pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'dod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / yang dag par lta ba phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: rtag tu sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / nyan pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'dod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / yang dag par lta ba phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: He is always endowed with the perfection of practice, the perfection of listening, the perfection of aspiration, the perfection of proper mental attention, the perfection of right view,

original: yongs su shes pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / spong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / sgom pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mngon sum du byed pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / spong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / sgom pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mngon sum du byed pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfection of full awareness, the perfection of abandonment, the perfection of meditation, and the perfection of realization.

original: lus dang srog la yang mi lta ba yin zhes bya ba ni lus dang srog la mi lta bas rtag tu sbyor ba phun sum tshogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lus dang srog la yang mi lta ba yin zhes bya ba ni lus dang srog la mi lta bas rtag tu sbyor ba phun sum tshogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: He is not concerned with his body or life. He is endowed with the perfection of practice because he is not concerned with his body or life.

original: dang po stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos rnams thos na dga' zhing de bzhin du zhugs pa yin zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa thos na dga' bas thos pa phun sum tshogs pa ste gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: dang po stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos rnams thos na dga' zhing de bzhin du zhugs pa yin zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa thos na dga' bas thos pa phun sum tshogs pa ste gnyis pa'o //
translated: The first is the excellence of hearing, which is to delight in hearing about emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and to practice accordingly.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang 'dod pa med par chags pa spyad pa spyod na khams gsum pa la mngon par dga' pa lta smos kyang ci dgos pa dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba yang mi 'dod pa yin na zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyang spang bar bya ba ni zhes bya ba'i phyir de'i 'bras bu dang de'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang 'dod pa med par chags pa spyad pa spyod na khams gsum pa la mngon par dga' pa lta smos kyang ci dgos pa dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba yang mi 'dod pa yin na zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyang spang bar bya ba ni zhes bya ba'i phyir de'i 'bras bu dang de'i yan lag ste /
translated: The second is the excellence of practice, which is to have no desire for nirvana, let alone delight in the three realms, and to not even desire the view of emptiness, because one should abandon all phenomena.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang 'dod pa med pa dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba yang mi 'dod pas 'dod pa phun sum tshogs pa ste gsum pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang 'dod pa med pa dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba yang mi 'dod pas 'dod pa phun sum tshogs pa ste gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the excellence of result, which is to have no desire for nirvana and to not even desire the view of emptiness.🔽The fourth is the excellence of cause, which is to have the cause of the three kinds of excellence.

original: don gyi phyir 'brang gi / yi ge'i phyir 'brang ba ma yin /
analyzed: don gyi phyir 'brang gi / yi ge'i phyir 'brang ba ma yin /
translated: He follows the meaning, not the letter.🔽He seeks liberation from the afflictions within, not running outside.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams las rnam par thar pa nad du tshol gyi phyi rol du rgyug pa ma yin zhes bya ba la don gyi phyir 'brang ba ni 'jig rten pa'i sems dang / bsgom pa las rnam par thar pa nang du tshol bas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams las rnam par thar pa nad du tshol gyi phyi rol du rgyug pa ma yin zhes bya ba la don gyi phyir 'brang ba ni 'jig rten pa'i sems dang / bsgom pa las rnam par thar pa nang du tshol bas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ste /
translated: Following the meaning is proper mental attention, seeking liberation from the afflictions within, not the external world.

original: phun sum tshogs pa ste bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa ste bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth excellence.🔽He is an island unto himself, not another island.

original: chos thams cad shin tu yongs su dag pa rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med par mthong bas bdag @253b nyid gling yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad shin tu yongs su dag pa rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med par mthong bas bdag @253b nyid gling yin te /
translated: He sees all phenomena as extremely pure, naturally free of afflictions.

original: gzhan gling ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gling ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the fifth excellence.🔽He is endowed with right view, seeing the supramundane Dharma as naturally free of afflictions.

original: so so rang gi rig pas mi slob pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par mthong bas yang dag par lta ba phun sum tshogs pa ste lnga pa'o //
analyzed: so so rang gi rig pas mi slob pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par mthong bas yang dag par lta ba phun sum tshogs pa ste lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth excellence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la chos nyid du yang mi lta na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /🔽mang du 'dus pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i bar dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis don dam pa'i dkon mchog gsum la rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la chos nyid du yang mi lta na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te / mang du 'dus pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i bar dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis don dam pa'i dkon mchog gsum la rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: The passage beginning with One should not even view the Tathagata as reality🔽and ending with what need is there to mention a large gathering?

original: dkon mchog mi mthong bas yongs su shes pa phun sum tshogs pa ste drug pa'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog mi mthong bas yongs su shes pa phun sum tshogs pa ste drug pa'o //
translated: refers to the perfection of knowledge, the sixth perfection, which is the non-conceptualization of the ultimate Three Jewels by supramundane wisdom.🔽The line One does not undertake anything in order to abandon anything

original: chos gang spang bar bya ba'i phyir rtsom pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba spangs pa'i spong ba phun sum tshogs pa ste bdun pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang spang bar bya ba'i phyir rtsom pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba spangs pa'i spong ba phun sum tshogs pa ste bdun pa'o //
translated: refers to the perfection of abandonment, the seventh perfection, which is the abandonment of that which is to be abandoned.🔽The line One does not undertake anything in order to cultivate anything

original: bsgom par bya ba'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba ni bsgom par bya ba bsgoms pa'i phyir sgom pa phun sum tshogs pa ste brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba ni bsgom par bya ba bsgoms pa'i phyir sgom pa phun sum tshogs pa ste brgyad pa'o //
translated: refers to the perfection of cultivation, the eighth perfection, which is the cultivation of that which is to be cultivated.

original: 'khor bar yang mi skye /🔽mya ngan las 'das pa la yang mngon par dga' ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'khor bar yang mi skye / mya ngan las 'das pa la yang mngon par dga' ba ma yin /
translated: One is not born in cyclic existence.🔽One does not delight in nirvana.

original: thar ba yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: thar ba yang mi dmigs /
translated: One does not apprehend liberation.

original: bcings pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bcings pa yang ma yin la /
translated: He is not bound,

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das par rig nas /🔽kun du mi 'khor zhing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba zhes bya ba la 'khor ba'i rgyu ni spangs /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das par rig nas / kun du mi 'khor zhing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba zhes bya ba la 'khor ba'i rgyu ni spangs /
translated: and he knows that all phenomena are naturally liberated.🔽He does not cycle and he does not attain complete nirvāṇa.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni thob pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni thob pa'o //
translated: He has abandoned the causes of cycling and he has attained nirvāṇa.

original: 'khor bar yang mi skye yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la yang mngon par dga' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor bar yang mi skye yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la yang mngon par dga' ba ma yin no //
translated: He is not reborn in saṃsāra and he does not delight in nirvāṇa.

original: 'chi ba dang 'tsho ba la mngon par dga' ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'chi ba dang 'tsho ba la mngon par dga' ba ma yin pas /
translated: He does not delight in death or in life.

original: thar pa yang mi dmigs bcings pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: thar pa yang mi dmigs bcings pa yang ma yin no //
translated: He does not observe liberation and he is not bound.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa dang / phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir kun du mi 'khor zhing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa dang / phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir kun du mi 'khor zhing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
translated: He does not cycle and he does not attain complete nirvāṇa because he has abandoned the afflictions and because he still has the remaining aggregates.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa la sogs pa mi slob pa'i chos rnams su rig par bya'o //🔽'di ni dgu pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa la sogs pa mi slob pa'i chos rnams su rig par bya'o // 'di ni dgu pa ste /
translated: The phrase “utterly beyond suffering by nature” refers to the qualities of those beyond training, such as the knowledge of termination and the knowledge of nonarising.

original: mngon sum du byed pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the ninth excellence, that of the excellence of direct realization.🔽The three kinds of spiritual practitioners are those who are spiritual practitioners only in name, those who are spiritual practitioners only by virtue of their austerities, and those who are spiritual practitioners in the true sense of the word.🔽The first two are spiritual practitioners only in name, while the third is a spiritual practitioner in the true sense of the word.

original: dge sbyong gsum po dag gis dge sbyong gi ming gi don med pa dang / mi 'tsham par kun du bstan pa'i phyir ming gis gnod pa ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong gsum po dag gis dge sbyong gi ming gi don med pa dang / mi 'tsham par kun du bstan pa'i phyir ming gis gnod pa ste /
translated: The first two are spiritual practitioners only in name because they are spiritual practitioners who have been revealed to be devoid of the meaning of the name “spiritual practitioner” and to be unworthy of that name.

original: skyes bu dbul po'i dpes ston to //
analyzed: skyes bu dbul po'i dpes ston to //
translated: This is illustrated by the example of the poor man.

original: ji ltar ming gis gnod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ming gis gnod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In what way are they spiritual practitioners only in name?

original: dge sbyong gi ming gi sgo nas dad pas byin pa la log par yongs su spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi ming gi sgo nas dad pas byin pa la log par yongs su spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are spiritual practitioners who, by virtue of their name, engage in the misuse of the offerings of the faithful.

original: 'di man chad du yang dag pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i dge sbyong rnams dang / yang dag par sgrub pa'i dge sbyong shes pa dang tshul khrims kyis mngon @254a * //
analyzed: 'di man chad du yang dag pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i dge sbyong rnams dang / yang dag par sgrub pa'i dge sbyong shes pa dang tshul khrims kyis mngon @254a * //
translated: From this point onward, the text explains the spiritual practitioners who are not correctly practicing and the spiritual practitioners who are correctly practicing.

original: pa'i nga rgyal can du gyur pa de'i phyin ci log tu yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir dpe rnams dang tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams kyang ston to //
analyzed: pa'i nga rgyal can du gyur pa de'i phyin ci log tu yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir dpe rnams dang tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams kyang ston to //
translated: In order to completely understand the error of those who are arrogant about their understanding, the Buddha taught the parables and the story of the virtuous man.

original: thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyis de'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal las brtsams nas dpe gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyis de'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal las brtsams nas dpe gnyis pa ste /
translated: The second parable is taught in order to begin to overcome the arrogance of those who think they understand the Dharma through the wisdom of hearing and reflection.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu la la zhig rgya mtsho'i chus khyer la chus skom bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed pa de bzhin du 'od srungs 'di la dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig chos mang po blangs te /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu la la zhig rgya mtsho'i chus khyer la chus skom bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed pa de bzhin du 'od srungs 'di la dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig chos mang po blangs te /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this: for example, a man is carried away by the water of the ocean and dies of thirst. In the same way, Kāśyapa, some ascetics and brahmins take up many teachings

original: yongs su chub par byas kyang 'dod chags kyi sred pa mi sel /
analyzed: yongs su chub par byas kyang 'dod chags kyi sred pa mi sel /
translated: but do not eliminate the craving of desire,

original: zhe sdang gi sred pa mi sel /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi sred pa mi sel /
translated: do not eliminate the craving of anger,

original: gti mug gi sred pa mi sel ba de dag chos kyi rgya mtshos khyer la nyon mongs pa'i skom pas 'chi ba'i dus byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gti mug gi sred pa mi sel ba de dag chos kyi rgya mtshos khyer la nyon mongs pa'i skom pas 'chi ba'i dus byas par 'gyur te /
translated: do not eliminate the craving of delusion. They are carried away by the ocean of the Dharma but die of the thirst of the afflictions.

original: ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dpe des na thos pa'i shes pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed par ston te /
analyzed: ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dpe des na thos pa'i shes pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed par ston te /
translated: The example of going to the miserable realms shows that one should not be proud of one's knowledge of the scriptures.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na /🔽sman pa sman sgro thogs te /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na / sman pa sman sgro thogs te /
translated: KaSyapa, it is like this:🔽For example, a doctor who goes to the cardinal and intermediate directions with a medicine bag

original: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su rgyu ba de nad gcig gis btab nas nad de gso bar mi nus pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su rgyu ba de nad gcig gis btab nas nad de gso bar mi nus pa de bzhin du /
translated: cannot cure a disease that he himself has contracted.

original: 'od srungs mang du thos pa'i nyon mongs pa'i nad blta ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs mang du thos pa'i nyon mongs pa'i nad blta ste /
translated: KaSyapa, the disease of the afflictions of the learned should be seen in the same way.🔽If one cannot cure the disease of one's own afflictions with the knowledge one has acquired, then that knowledge is useless.

original: gang thos pa des bdag nyon mongs pa'i nad las gso bar mi nus na de'i thos pa ni don med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni bsam pa'i shes pas so //
