analyzed: gang thos pa des bdag nyon mongs pa'i nad las gso bar mi nus na de'i thos pa ni don med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni bsam pa'i shes pas so //
translated: This shows that one should not be proud of one's knowledge of the scriptures.

original: so so'i skye bo 'dod chags dang bral ba snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myong bar byed pa dang slob pa thob pa dang / bkur sti la chags pa dang / nyes pa dang bcas pa'i 'gyod pas bsgom pa'i ye shes la log pa sbyor yang dag par sbyor ba mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo 'dod chags dang bral ba snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myong bar byed pa dang slob pa thob pa dang / bkur sti la chags pa dang / nyes pa dang bcas pa'i 'gyod pas bsgom pa'i ye shes la log pa sbyor yang dag par sbyor ba mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa las brtsams te /
translated: The first is the case of the ordinary man who is free from passion, who experiences the taste of meditative concentration, who is a learner, who is attached to honor, and who is remorseful because of a fault.

original: dpe lhag ma bzhi dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: dpe lhag ma bzhi dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The remaining four examples should be applied in order to the four remaining cases.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
translated: Kaśyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na skyes bu na ba zhig la rgyal po la 'os pa'i sman btang la cho ga bzhin du ma byas pas 'chi ba'i dus byas pa de bzhin du mang du thos pa'i nyon mongs pa'i nad du blta ste /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu na ba zhig la rgyal po la 'os pa'i sman btang la cho ga bzhin du ma byas pas 'chi ba'i dus byas pa de bzhin du mang du thos pa'i nyon mongs pa'i nad du blta ste /
translated: For example, a sick person is given medicine appropriate to the king, but because he does not follow the proper regimen, he dies. In the same way, the disease of the afflictions of the one who has heard much should be seen.

original: gang sdom pa med pa des 'chi ba'i dus byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i dpe 'di ni dang po'i'o //
analyzed: gang sdom pa med pa des 'chi ba'i dus byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i dpe 'di ni dang po'i'o //
translated: The one who is not restrained dies. This is the example for the first.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
translated: Kaśyapa, it is like this:🔽For example, a person who is not sick does not need medicine.

original: dper na nor bu rin po che mi gtsang ba'i nang du lhung na smad par 'gyur ba de bzhin du mang du thos pa 'thob pa dang bkur sti'i mi gtsang ba'i nang du lhung bar blta ste /
analyzed: dper na nor bu rin po che mi gtsang ba'i nang du lhung na smad par 'gyur ba de bzhin du mang du thos pa 'thob pa dang bkur sti'i mi gtsang ba'i nang du lhung bar blta ste /
translated: For example, if a precious jewel falls into filth, it is despised. In the same way, one should see that one who has obtained much learning and honor falls into the filth of nonvirtue.

original: ci yang med pa la ni lha dang mi rnams dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nor bu rin po che'i dpe 'di ni gnyis pa'i'o //
analyzed: ci yang med pa la ni lha dang mi rnams dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nor bu rin po che'i dpe 'di ni gnyis pa'i'o //
translated: But if he has nothing, gods and humans delight in him. This is the second example of the precious jewel.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na ro la gser gyi phreng ba btags pa de bzhin du @254b ngang tshul ngan pa can dur smrig gyon par blta'o zhes bya ba ro'i 'di ni gsum pa'i'o //
analyzed: dper na ro la gser gyi phreng ba btags pa de bzhin du @254b ngang tshul ngan pa can dur smrig gyon par blta'o zhes bya ba ro'i 'di ni gsum pa'i'o //
translated: For example, a golden necklace is tied around the neck of a corpse. In the same way, one should see that a person of bad character wears the saffron robes. This is the third example of the corpse.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na tshong dpon gyi bu shin tu khrus byas te /
analyzed: dper na tshong dpon gyi bu shin tu khrus byas te /
translated: For example, the son of a merchant is well bathed,

original: rab tu rnam par byugs la skra dang sen mo bregs nas gos dkar po bgos te /
analyzed: rab tu rnam par byugs la skra dang sen mo bregs nas gos dkar po bgos te /
translated: well anointed, his hair and nails trimmed, and he is dressed in clean white clothes.

original: tsan dan sa mchog gis bskus pa'i mgo la tsam pa ka'i me tog gi 'phreng ba thogs pa de bzhin du tshul khrims dang ldan zhing mang du thos pa dur smrig gyon par blta'o zhes bya ba yang gsum pa 'di nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: tsan dan sa mchog gis bskus pa'i mgo la tsam pa ka'i me tog gi 'phreng ba thogs pa de bzhin du tshul khrims dang ldan zhing mang du thos pa dur smrig gyon par blta'o zhes bya ba yang gsum pa 'di nyid kyi'o //
translated: Just as one would regard a head anointed with the best sandalwood ointment and wearing a garland of campaka flowers, so should one regard one who is endowed with morality and learning and wears the saffron robe.

original: tshul khrims kyis de mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa las brtsams nas tshul khrims dang ldan pa 'dra ba bzhi ston to //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis de mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa las brtsams nas tshul khrims dang ldan pa 'dra ba bzhi ston to //
translated: The four who are like those endowed with morality are taught beginning from the conceit of those endowed with morality.

original: 'od srungs bzhi po 'di dag ni ngang tshul ngan pa can tshul khrims dang ldan pa 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: 'od srungs bzhi po 'di dag ni ngang tshul ngan pa can tshul khrims dang ldan pa 'dra ba yin te /
translated: KaSyapa, there are four who are of bad character but who seem to be endowed with morality.

original: bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: What are the four? and so on.

original: dang po ni yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims te /
analyzed: dang po ni yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims te /
translated: The first is the morality of taking up.

original: 'od srungs 'di la dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di la dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: KaSyapa, here a monk is endowed with morality,

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams shing gnas /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams shing gnas /
translated: and is restrained by the vow of individual liberation and lives.

original: cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa kha na ma tho ba rnams la 'jigs par lta ;
analyzed: cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa kha na ma tho ba rnams la 'jigs par lta ;
translated: They have perfect ritual and field of activity and they fear misdeeds.

original: yang dag par blangs te bslab pa'i gnas rnams la slob /
analyzed: yang dag par blangs te bslab pa'i gnas rnams la slob /
translated: They train in the precepts they have taken.🔽They maintain pure conduct through their pure physical, verbal and mental activity.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yongs su dag pa dang ldan par gnas pas 'tsho ba yongs su dag kyang de bdag tu smra ba yin te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yongs su dag pa dang ldan par gnas pas 'tsho ba yongs su dag kyang de bdag tu smra ba yin te /
translated: But they are proponents of a self.

original: 'od srungs de ni dang tshul ngan pa can tshul khrims dang ldan pa 'dra ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'od srungs de ni dang tshul ngan pa can tshul khrims dang ldan pa 'dra ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: KaSyapa, they are of bad character but appear to be ethical.🔽The second is as follows:

original: gnyis pa ni 'od srungs gzhan yang 'di la dge slong kha cig 'dul ba 'dzin zhing 'dul ba la zhugs pa 'dul ba'i tshul la gnas pa yin yang /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'od srungs gzhan yang 'di la dge slong kha cig 'dul ba 'dzin zhing 'dul ba la zhugs pa 'dul ba'i tshul la gnas pa yin yang /
translated: KaSyapa, some monks uphold the vinaya and engage in the vinaya, they abide by the rules of the vinaya,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba las ma bskyod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba las ma bskyod pa yin te /
translated: but they are not moved from the view of the perishing aggregates.

original: de ni ngang tshul ngan pa can tshul khrims dang ldan pa gnyis pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir bya ba'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de ni ngang tshul ngan pa can tshul khrims dang ldan pa gnyis pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir bya ba'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The second is the morality of action, because it is said, “He is of bad character, but he is moral.”

original: gsum pa ni 'od srungs gzhan yang 'di la dge slong kha cig byams pa la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'od srungs gzhan yang 'di la dge slong kha cig byams pa la gnas pa yin te /
translated: The third is the morality of overcoming opposition, because it is said, “Again, Kasyapa, here some monk dwells in loving-kindness,

original: sems can la dmigs pa'i byams pa dang ldan yang 'du byed thams cad la skyes pa med pa thos na skrag pa kun du rab tu skrag par 'gyur ba de ni 'od srungs dang tshul ngan pa la tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems can la dmigs pa'i byams pa dang ldan yang 'du byed thams cad la skyes pa med pa thos na skrag pa kun du rab tu skrag par 'gyur ba de ni 'od srungs dang tshul ngan pa la tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and though he has loving-kindness that is focused on sentient beings, when he hears that all things are unproduced, he is frightened and terrified.

original: byams pa la gnas pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang tshul ngan pa 'joms pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'joms pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: byams pa la gnas pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang tshul ngan pa 'joms pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'joms pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: This, Kasyapa, is called ‘bad character, but moral.’ Because it overcomes opposition by dwelling in loving-kindness, it is the morality of overcoming opposition.

original: bzhi pa ni 'od srungs gzhan yang 'di la dge slong kha cig sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis yang dag blangs kyang dmigs @255a * //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni 'od srungs gzhan yang 'di la dge slong kha cig sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis yang dag blangs kyang dmigs @255a * //
translated: The fourth is the morality of the vow, because it is said, “Again, Kasyapa, here some monk undertakes the twelve ascetic practices,

original: par lta ba yin te /
analyzed: par lta ba yin te /
translated: but he is a view-fixated person.

original: dar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa gnas pa de ni ngang tshul ngan pa can tshul khrims dang ldan pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: dar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa gnas pa de ni ngang tshul ngan pa can tshul khrims dang ldan pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the one who is of bad character but who appears to be endowed with morality, who is attached to gain and honor and to the grasping of “mine.”🔽Kāśyapa, these four are of bad character but appear to be endowed with morality.

original: 'od srungs bzhi po 'di dag ni ngan tshul dang pa can tshul khrims dang ldan pa 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis yang dag par blangs pas yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'od srungs bzhi po 'di dag ni ngan tshul dang pa can tshul khrims dang ldan pa 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis yang dag par blangs pas yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of austerity is the morality of one who has taken up the twelve ascetic practices.

original: de la gong ma gnyis ni lta ba'i nyes pas ngang tshul ngan pa'i gnyen po 'joms pa dang / ngang tshul ngan pa'i rgyu dang ldan pas ngang tshul ngan pa can du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gong ma gnyis ni lta ba'i nyes pas ngang tshul ngan pa'i gnyen po 'joms pa dang / ngang tshul ngan pa'i rgyu dang ldan pas ngang tshul ngan pa can du rig par bya'o //
translated: The first two of these are of bad character because they are the opponents of the morality of the destruction of the bad characters through the fault of view, and because they are endowed with the cause of bad character.

original: de yang bdag tu smra ba yin zhes bya ba dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba las ma bskyod pa yin pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang bdag tu smra ba yin zhes bya ba dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba las ma bskyod pa yin pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: And this should be understood respectively as the one who is a proponent of self and the one who is not shaken from the view of the transitory aggregates, because it is said, “He is a proponent of self” and “He is not shaken from the view of the transitory aggregates.”

original: 'og ma gnyis ni ngang tshul ngan pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'og ma gnyis ni ngang tshul ngan pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The latter two are not different from bad natures.

original: de gnyis ni gcig las chos thams cad med na thos na skrag par 'gyur zhes sngar gsungs pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la skrag nas ngang tshul ngan pa 'joms pa'i gnyen po mi rtsom pa'o//
analyzed: de gnyis ni gcig las chos thams cad med na thos na skrag par 'gyur zhes sngar gsungs pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la skrag nas ngang tshul ngan pa 'joms pa'i gnyen po mi rtsom pa'o//
translated: The first is frightened of nirvana, since it was previously stated that if one hears that all phenomena do not exist, one is frightened.

original: gnyis pa ni dmigs par lta ba yin zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dmigs par lta ba yin zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second is the view that observes the object.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can ni bdag grol lo snyam du bdag la dmigs nas de'i gnyen por yang dag pa'i don gyi tshul khrims kyis ston te /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can ni bdag grol lo snyam du bdag la dmigs nas de'i gnyen por yang dag pa'i don gyi tshul khrims kyis ston te /
translated: Those with manifest pride think i am liberated, observing the self.

original: de yang spong bas rab tu phye ba dang / lam gyis rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: de yang spong bas rab tu phye ba dang / lam gyis rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: The first is distinguished by abandonment and the second is distinguished by the path.

original: de ni tshul khrims dang po ni nang gi skye mched yin gyi phyi rol gyi ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni tshul khrims dang po ni nang gi skye mched yin gyi phyi rol gyi ma yin te /
translated: The first is internal bases, not external bases.

original: 'od srungs tshul khrims tshul khrims zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'od srungs tshul khrims tshul khrims zhes bya ba ni /
translated: KaSyapa, that which is called moral discipline🔽is not moral discipline.

original: gang la bdag med cing bdag gi ba med pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang la bdag med cing bdag gi ba med pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said that it is not a self and it is not a being of mine.

original: gnyis pa ste bya ba med pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi las so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ste bya ba med pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi las so //
translated: The second, non-action, is defiled action.

original: mi bya ba med pa ni dge ba'i las so //
analyzed: mi bya ba med pa ni dge ba'i las so //
translated: Non-non-action is virtuous action.

original: byed pa med pa ni lus la sogs pa gang gis kyang nyon mongs pa can gyi las mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa med pa ni lus la sogs pa gang gis kyang nyon mongs pa can gyi las mi byed pa'o //
translated: Non-agent is that by which no defiled action is performed, such as the body, etc.

original: byed pa med pa ni gang gis dge ba'i las byed pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa med pa ni gang gis dge ba'i las byed pa'o //
translated: Non-non-agent is that by which virtuous action is performed.

original: rgyu ba ma yin pa mi rgyu ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni zas kyi phyir rgyu ba las brtsams pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu ba ma yin pa mi rgyu ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni zas kyi phyir rgyu ba las brtsams pa ste /
translated: Not moving, not not moving, etc. refers to moving for the sake of food,

original: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: which is either defiled or undefiled.

original: rab tu byed pa med pa rab tu spyod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su spyod pa las brtsams pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa med pa rab tu spyod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su spyod pa las brtsams pa ste /
translated: Not an activity, not non-activity refers to complete enjoyment,

original: nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: which is either defiled or undefiled.

original: ming med pa gzugs med pa zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: ming med pa gzugs med pa zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The one called “nameless and formless” is nirvana without any remainder of the aggregates.

original: mtshan ma med pa mtshan ma med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa ni mtshan @255b ma thams cad yid la mi byed pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings yid la byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa mtshan ma med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa ni mtshan @255b ma thams cad yid la mi byed pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings yid la byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one called “signless and not signless” is the state of abiding in the signless, because one does not pay attention to any signs and one pays attention to the realm of signlessness.

original: rab tu zhi ba rab tu zhi ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa la gnas pa na phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba rab tu zhi ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa la gnas pa na phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: The one called “calm and not calm” is the state of abiding in the state of no more learning, because of the remainder of the aggregates and the afflictions.

original: 'dzin pa med pa gtong ba med pa zhes bya ba ni rtag par gnas pa la yid bde ba dang ; yid mi bde ba med pa dang / btang snyoms dang dran pa dang / shes bzhin yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa med pa gtong ba med pa zhes bya ba ni rtag par gnas pa la yid bde ba dang ; yid mi bde ba med pa dang / btang snyoms dang dran pa dang / shes bzhin yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one called “not grasped and not let go” is the state of abiding in the constant, because of the absence of mental pleasure and mental pain, and because of equanimity, mindfulness, and vigilance.

original: gzung ba med pa gzung ba med pa ma yin pa de nyid la de'i gnas su 'gyur ba'i yul yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba gnyis kyis mi 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin gyis 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba med pa gzung ba med pa ma yin pa de nyid la de'i gnas su 'gyur ba'i yul yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba gnyis kyis mi 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin gyis 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of an apprehended object is not the absence of an apprehending subject, because the object that is the basis of that is not apprehended by either mental pleasure or mental pain, but is apprehended by equanimity, mindfulness, and introspection.

original: sems can med pa sems can du 'dogs pa med pa tshig med pa tshig tu 'dogs pa med pa sems med pa sems su 'dogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni bka' lung brda sprod pa las brtsams pa ste /
analyzed: sems can med pa sems can du 'dogs pa med pa tshig med pa tshig tu 'dogs pa med pa sems med pa sems su 'dogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni bka' lung brda sprod pa las brtsams pa ste /
translated: The absence of a sentient being, the absence of the designation of a sentient being, the absence of a word, the absence of the designation of a word, the absence of a mind, and the absence of the designation of a mind are based on the transmission of the scriptures.

original: spong ba'i tshul khrims kyi tshe gang brda sprod par byed pa dang / gang brda phrad pa dang / gang gis brda sprod pa'o //
analyzed: spong ba'i tshul khrims kyi tshe gang brda sprod par byed pa dang / gang brda phrad pa dang / gang gis brda sprod pa'o //
translated: When one is observing the morality of abandoning, there is the one who transmits the scriptures, the one who receives the scriptures, and the one who transmits the scriptures.

original: 'jig rten med pa 'jig rten med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten na ljongs rgyu ba las brtsams pa ste nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten med pa 'jig rten med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten na ljongs rgyu ba las brtsams pa ste nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: The absence of a world, the absence of a non-world, is based on wandering in the world of the container, because it is both afflicted and unafflicted.

original: brten pa med pa brten pa med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni grong dang zhing las brtsams pa ste /
analyzed: brten pa med pa brten pa med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni grong dang zhing las brtsams pa ste /
translated: The phrase “not based on, not not based on” refers to the village and fields.

original: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: They are afflicted and unafflicted.

original: bdag gi tshul la mi ltos pa dang / gzhan ngang tshul ngan pa can du mi smod pa zhes bya ba ni khyim du 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi tshul la mi ltos pa dang / gzhan ngang tshul ngan pa can du mi smod pa zhes bya ba ni khyim du 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “not dependent on one’s own way of life, not disparaging the bad way of life of others” refers to going to the homes of laypeople, etc.

original: tshul khrims kyis rlom sems su mi byed ces bya ba ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dang 'grogs pa las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis rlom sems su mi byed ces bya ba ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dang 'grogs pa las brtsams pa'o //
translated: The phrase “not conceited about morality” refers to living with fellow practitioners of celibacy.

original: tshul khrims la mi rtog rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba ni bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa bdag gi tshul khrims ni 'di lta bu'o snyam du de'i ngo bo nyid dang / bye brag la mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims la mi rtog rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba ni bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa bdag gi tshul khrims ni 'di lta bu'o snyam du de'i ngo bo nyid dang / bye brag la mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “not conceptualizing morality, not discriminating it” means that one does not conceptualize its intrinsic reality or its distinctions, thinking, “I am moral,” or “My morality is like this.”

original: de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi tshul khrims zag pa med pa mi ldan pa khams gsum pa dang bral ba rten thams cad med pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i spong ba la zag pa med kyang ldan pa yod pas bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir mi🔽ldan pa smos so //
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi tshul khrims zag pa med pa mi ldan pa khams gsum pa dang bral ba rten thams cad med pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i spong ba la zag pa med kyang ldan pa yod pas bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir mi ldan pa smos so //
translated: The word “unassociated” is used to distinguish it from the mundane abandonment, which is uncontaminated but still associated.

original: de yang gang khams gsum pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pa dang / khams gsum pa'i rgyu yang ma yin zhes tshig gnyis kyis ston to //
analyzed: de yang gang khams gsum pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pa dang / khams gsum pa'i rgyu yang ma yin zhes tshig gnyis kyis ston to //
translated: It is also shown by two phrases that it is not the result of the three realms and is not the cause of the three realms.

original: bslab pa dang mi mthun pa dang / mthun pa'i chos las brtsams te /🔽dge slong legs @256a * //
analyzed: bslab pa dang mi mthun pa dang / mthun pa'i chos las brtsams te / dge slong legs @256a * //
translated: It is based on the Dharma that is incompatible with training and compatible with training.🔽The monk who is not well trained and the monk who is well trained are established in this way.

original: par ma bslabs pa dang / dge slong legs par bslabs pa rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni gzhan du mtshams sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: par ma bslabs pa dang / dge slong legs par bslabs pa rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni gzhan du mtshams sbyor ba'o //
translated: This is the connection to the next section.

original: dge sbyong legs par ma bslabs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge sbyong legs par ma bslabs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is a non-virtuous ascetic?

original: de dag ni gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ni gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: They should be known as three types.

original: kha dog dang rtags kyi dbyibs kyi dge sbyong ni dge sbyong nyid dang mi 'tsho ba ste /
analyzed: kha dog dang rtags kyi dbyibs kyi dge sbyong ni dge sbyong nyid dang mi 'tsho ba ste /
translated: The ascetic who is a mere color and shape is not a true ascetic.

original: cha byad dang rtags 'dra yang cho ga dang 'tsho ba dang yongs su spyod pa dang rtsom pa dang / tshul khrims dang / lta ba dang bsam pa mi 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: cha byad dang rtags 'dra yang cho ga dang 'tsho ba dang yongs su spyod pa dang rtsom pa dang / tshul khrims dang / lta ba dang bsam pa mi 'dra ba'o //
translated: Even though he may have the same appearance and signs, his conduct, livelihood, behavior, activity, morality, view, and intention are different.

original: de la kha dog dang rtags kyi dbyibs zhes bya ba ni kha dog gi dbyibs dang rtags kyi dbyibs so //
analyzed: de la kha dog dang rtags kyi dbyibs zhes bya ba ni kha dog gi dbyibs dang rtags kyi dbyibs so //
translated: Here, “color and shape” means the color and shape and the signs.

original: de la kha dog gi dbyibs kyi dge sbyong gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la kha dog gi dbyibs kyi dge sbyong gang zhe na /
translated: What is an ascetic who is a mere color and shape?

original: 'di la dge sbyong kha cig kha dog dang rtags kyi dbyibs dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la dge sbyong kha cig kha dog dang rtags kyi dbyibs dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: There are some ascetics who have the color and shape and the signs.

original: chos gos sbyar ma gyon ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos sbyar ma gyon ces bya'o //
translated: They are called “wearers of patched cloth robes.”

original: sbyor ba bgos pas ni cha byad 'dra bar ston te /🔽rtags kyi dbyibs ni mgo bregs te lag tu lhung bzed thogs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba bgos pas ni cha byad 'dra bar ston te / rtags kyi dbyibs ni mgo bregs te lag tu lhung bzed thogs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The patched cloth robe shows that they have the same appearance.🔽The shape of the signs is having a shaven head and carrying an alms bowl.

original: mgo bregs pa dang lag na lhung bzed thogs pas ni rtags 'dra'o //
analyzed: mgo bregs pa dang lag na lhung bzed thogs pas ni rtags 'dra'o //
translated: Having a shaven head and carrying an alms bowl shows that they have the same signs.

original: de lus kyi las yongs su ma dag pa spyod /
analyzed: de lus kyi las yongs su ma dag pa spyod /
translated: He practices impure bodily actions.

original: ngag gi las yongs su ma dag pa spyod /
analyzed: ngag gi las yongs su ma dag pa spyod /
translated: He practices impure verbal actions.🔽He practices impure mental actions.

original: yid kyi las yongs su ma dag pa spyod ces bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yongs su ma dag pa kun du spyod pas cho ga mi 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi las yongs su ma dag pa spyod ces bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yongs su ma dag pa kun du spyod pas cho ga mi 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: He practices impure bodily, verbal, and mental actions.

original: 'tsho ba yongs su ma dag pa zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba yongs su ma dag pas 'tsho ba mi 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba yongs su ma dag pa zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba yongs su ma dag pas 'tsho ba mi 'dra'o //
translated: He has an impure livelihood.

original: 'dod chen can zhes bya ba ni 'dod chen byed pas yongs su spyod pa mi 'dra ba'o //🔽le lo can zhes bya ba ni le lo byed pas brtson pa mi 'dra ba'o //🔽ngang tshul ngan pa can zhes bya ba ni ngang tshul ngan pas tshul khrims mi 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chen can zhes bya ba ni 'dod chen byed pas yongs su spyod pa mi 'dra ba'o // le lo can zhes bya ba ni le lo byed pas brtson pa mi 'dra ba'o // ngang tshul ngan pa can zhes bya ba ni ngang tshul ngan pas tshul khrims mi 'dra ba'o //
translated: He is a hedonist.🔽He is lazy.🔽He is immoral.

original: sdig pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i chos can bas lta ba mi 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i chos can bas lta ba mi 'dra ba'o //
translated: He is evil.

original: ma dul ba ma sbas pa ma byang ba zhes bya ba ni ma dul ba ma sbas pa ma byang bas bsam pa mi 'dra ba'o /
analyzed: ma dul ba ma sbas pa ma byang ba zhes bya ba ni ma dul ba ma sbas pa ma byang bas bsam pa mi 'dra ba'o /
translated: The phrase “uncontrolled, undisciplined, and unrefined” means that their attitude is different.

original: gnyis pa cho ga bsrung zhing tshul 'chos pa'i dge spyong ni yo byad la gzhol bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa cho ga bsrung zhing tshul 'chos pa'i dge spyong ni yo byad la gzhol bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The second type of spiritual practitioner is one who observes rituals and is a hypocrite.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi rtags 'dra /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi rtags 'dra /
translated: They are similar to those who have the signs of superior discipline,

original: lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi rtags 'dra yang de bsgrub pa'i bsam pa mi 'dra ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi rtags 'dra yang de bsgrub pa'i bsam pa mi 'dra ste /
translated: but their attitude is different in that they do not practice the latter.

original: de la cho ga bsrung zhing tshul 'chos pa'i dge sbyong gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la cho ga bsrung zhing tshul 'chos pa'i dge sbyong gang zhe na /
translated: What is a spiritual practitioner who observes rituals and is a hypocrite?

original: 'di dge sbyong kha cig cho ga spyod yul dang / spyong pa phun sum tshogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dge sbyong kha cig cho ga spyod yul dang / spyong pa phun sum tshogs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is a spiritual practitioner who is perfect in his conduct, sphere of activity, and austerity.

original: cho ga dang 'tsho ba dang spyod pa phun sum tshogs pas lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi rtags 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: cho ga dang 'tsho ba dang spyod pa phun sum tshogs pas lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi rtags 'dra ba'o //
translated: They are similar to those who have the signs of superior discipline,🔽but they are not perfect in their superior attitude, superior wisdom, and superior meditative absorption.

original: spyod lam bzhir shes @256b bzhin du spyod zas dang skom ngan pa za ba 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi po dag gis chog par 'dzin /
analyzed: spyod lam bzhir shes @256b bzhin du spyod zas dang skom ngan pa za ba 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi po dag gis chog par 'dzin /
translated: He practices with awareness in the four modes of behavior. He is satisfied with the four noble families.

original: khyim na gnas pa dang / rab tu byung ba rnams dang mi 'dra ste zhes bya ba ni shes bzhin du byed pa nas /
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa dang / rab tu byung ba rnams dang mi 'dra ste zhes bya ba ni shes bzhin du byed pa nas /
translated: He is not like householders or renunciates.

original: mi 'dra ba'i bar gyis lhag pa'i sems kyi rtags 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba'i bar gyis lhag pa'i sems kyi rtags 'dra ba'o //
translated: These are the similar qualities of the signs of superior mind.🔽He speaks little and says little.

original: tshig nyung smra ba nyung zhing zhes bya ba ni tshig nyung zhing smra ba nyung bas lhag pa'i shes rab kyi rtags 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: tshig nyung smra ba nyung zhing zhes bya ba ni tshig nyung zhing smra ba nyung bas lhag pa'i shes rab kyi rtags 'dra ba'o //
translated: These are the similar qualities of the signs of superior wisdom.

original: de'i spyod lam de dag kyang tshul 'chos pa dang / gcam gyis yongs su brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i spyod lam de dag kyang tshul 'chos pa dang / gcam gyis yongs su brtags pa yin te /
translated: His behavior is contrived and feigned,

original: sems yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: sems yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of purifying the mind,

original: dul bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: dul bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of self-discipline,

original: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin la dmigs par lta ba yin te /
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin la dmigs par lta ba yin te /
translated: not for the sake of tranquility, but with a view to an object.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa la gnas pa stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i chos rnams la g-yang sar 'du shes pa yin /🔽stong pa nyid smra ba'i dge spyod rnams la dgrar 'du shes pa yin zhes bya ba ni tshul 'chos pa la sogs pas lhag pa'i shes rab sgrub pa'i bsam pa mi 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa la gnas pa stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i chos rnams la g-yang sar 'du shes pa yin / stong pa nyid smra ba'i dge spyod rnams la dgrar 'du shes pa yin zhes bya ba ni tshul 'chos pa la sogs pas lhag pa'i shes rab sgrub pa'i bsam pa mi 'dra ba'o //
translated: They are those who regard the virtuous practices of those who teach emptiness as enemies.🔽The third, the virtuous practice of the sound of expression, is to be understood as being devoted to sound.

original: gsum pa brjod pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa'i dge sbyong ni sgra la gzhol bar rig par bya ste /🔽zhi gnas kyi yan lag 'dra /🔽lhag mthong gi yan lag 'dra /
analyzed: gsum pa brjod pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa'i dge sbyong ni sgra la gzhol bar rig par bya ste / zhi gnas kyi yan lag 'dra / lhag mthong gi yan lag 'dra /
translated: The fourth, the virtuous practice of the sound of expression in verse, is to be understood as being devoted to the sound of expression in verse.🔽The fifth, the virtuous practice of the sound of expression in verse that is like a branch of serenity, is to be understood as being devoted to the sound of expression in verse that is like a branch of serenity.

original: de gnyi ga bsgom pa'i yan lag 'dra /🔽de gnyi ga'i tshogs kyi yan lag 'dra yang bsam pa mi 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga bsgom pa'i yan lag 'dra / de gnyi ga'i tshogs kyi yan lag 'dra yang bsam pa mi 'dra ba'o //
translated: The sixth, the virtuous practice of the sound of expression in verse that is like a branch of insight, is to be understood as being devoted to the sound of expression in verse that is like a branch of insight.🔽The seventh, the virtuous practice of the sound of expression in verse that is like a branch of the meditation on both, is to be understood as being devoted to the sound of expression in verse that is like a branch of the meditation on both.🔽The eighth, the virtuous practice of the sound of expression in verse that is like a branch of the accumulation of both, is to be understood as being devoted to the sound of expression in verse that is like a branch of the accumulation of both.

original: de la brjod pa sgra tshigs su bcad pa'i dge sbyong gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la brjod pa sgra tshigs su bcad pa'i dge sbyong gang zhe na /
translated: What is the virtuous practice of the sound of expression in verse?

original: ji ltar bdag tshul khrims dang ldan par gzhan gyis shes par 'gyur snyam du so sor brtags nas tshul khrims bsrung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag tshul khrims dang ldan par gzhan gyis shes par 'gyur snyam du so sor brtags nas tshul khrims bsrung zhes bya'o //
translated: One should guard morality after having reflected, How can others know that I am moral?

original: de la tshul khrims ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu yin pas tshul khrims ni zhi gnas kyi yan lag 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu yin pas tshul khrims ni zhi gnas kyi yan lag 'dra ba'o //
translated: Since morality is the cause of meditative concentration, morality is like a limb of serenity.

original: ji ltar na bdag mang du thos par gzhan gyis shes par 'gyur snyam du so sor brtags nas thos pa 'dzin zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: ji ltar na bdag mang du thos par gzhan gyis shes par 'gyur snyam du so sor brtags nas thos pa 'dzin zhes bya ba la ;
translated: One should study after having reflected, How can others know that I am learned?

original: thos pa ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab bskyed pas thos pa ni lhag mthong gi yan lag 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab bskyed pas thos pa ni lhag mthong gi yan lag 'dra ba'o //
translated: Since learning produces uncontaminated wisdom, learning is like a limb of insight.

original: ji ltar bdag dgon pa par gzhan gyis shes par 'gyur snyam du so sor brtags nas thos pa 'dzin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag dgon pa par gzhan gyis shes par 'gyur snyam du so sor brtags nas thos pa 'dzin zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should live in the wilderness after having reflected, How can others know that I am a wilderness-dweller?

original: dgon pa na gnas pa ni bsgom pa'i rgyu yin pas dgon pa ni de gnyi ga bsgom pa'i yan lag 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dgon pa na gnas pa ni bsgom pa'i rgyu yin pas dgon pa ni de gnyi ga bsgom pa'i yan lag 'dra ba'o //
translated: Since living in the wilderness is the cause of meditation, the wilderness is like a limb of the meditation of both serenity and insight.

original: so sor brtags nas 'dod pa nyung zhing chog shes pa dang rab tu dben par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: so sor brtags nas 'dod pa nyung zhing chog shes pa dang rab tu dben par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
translated: One becomes one who, having investigated, has few desires and is content, and one becomes one who is secluded.

original: 'dod pa nyung pa la sogs pa ni de'i chogs su gyur pa'i phyir 'dod pa nyung pa la sogs pas ni de gnyi ga'i chogs kyi yan lag 'dra ba'o //🔽ji tsam du gzhan la nye bar bstan pa'i phyir yin @257a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa nyung pa la sogs pa ni de'i chogs su gyur pa'i phyir 'dod pa nyung pa la sogs pas ni de gnyi ga'i chogs kyi yan lag 'dra ba'o // ji tsam du gzhan la nye bar bstan pa'i phyir yin @257a * //
translated: Having few desires, etc. are the branches of the two, since they are included in them. Having few desires, etc. are similar to the branches of the two, since they are included in them.

original: gyi ; skyo bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: gyi ; skyo bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: To the extent that one teaches others, one is not for the sake of weariness,

original: 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of freedom from attachment,

original: 'gag par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /🔽nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: 'gag par bya ba'i phyir ma yin / nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of cessation,🔽not for the sake of complete nirvana,

original: rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of perfect enlightenment,

original: dge sbyong gi phyir ma yin /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of being a sramana,

original: tshangs pa'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: not for the sake of being a brahmana.

original: gzhan la nye bar bstan pa la sogs pa ni bsam pa mi 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan la nye bar bstan pa la sogs pa ni bsam pa mi 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that teaching others, etc. have different intentions.

original: 'di ni brjod pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa'i dge sbyong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brjod pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa'i dge sbyong zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the monk who is a reciter of the scriptures.

original: dge sbyong legs par bslabs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge sbyong legs par bslabs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the monk who is well trained?

original: rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: He should be understood as being of four types:

original: sbyor ba dang bsam pa dang / rab tu rtogs pa dang / mthar phyir pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang bsam pa dang / rab tu rtogs pa dang / mthar phyir pa'o //
translated: one who is well trained in application, in thought, in full attainment, and in conclusion.

original: de la yang dag par sgrub pa'i dge spyod gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang dag par sgrub pa'i dge spyod gang zhe na /
translated: What is the monk who is well trained in application?

original: 'od srungs lus dang srog la yang mi lta ba yin na 'thob pa dang / bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs lus dang srog la yang mi lta ba yin na 'thob pa dang / bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: The Sutra says: Kasyapa, if he does not even care about his body and life, what can be said about his indifference to gain, honor, and fame?

original: lus dang srog la mi lta bas tshe 'di la skyo ba sbyor ro //
analyzed: lus dang srog la mi lta bas tshe 'di la skyo ba sbyor ro //
translated: He is indifferent to the present life because he does not care about body and life.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos rnams thos na dga' zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa thos na dga' bas tshe rabs snga ma la rgyud yongs su smin pas sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos rnams thos na dga' zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa thos na dga' bas tshe rabs snga ma la rgyud yongs su smin pas sbyor ba ste /
translated: The Sutra says: He is pleased to hear of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness. He is well trained in application because he is pleased to hear of emptiness, etc.

original: 'di ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the perfection of application.

original: de bzhin nyid du zhugs pa yin zhes bya ba ni chos la bdag med par mos pa'i bsam pa can gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du zhugs pa yin zhes bya ba ni chos la bdag med par mos pa'i bsam pa can gyi phyir ro //
translated: “He has entered into reality” means that he has the intention of being devoted to the selflessness of dharmas.

original: mya ngan 'das pa yang 'dod pa med par tshangs par spyad pa spyod pa na khams gsum pa la mngon par dga' ba la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa yang 'dod pa med par tshangs par spyad pa spyod pa na khams gsum pa la mngon par dga' ba la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: Since he does not even desire nirvana, how much less would he desire the three realms, which are the opposite of nirvana, and engage in pure conduct?

original: stong pa nyid du lta ba yang mi 'dod pa yin na bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / gang zag tu lta ba la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du lta ba yang mi 'dod pa yin na bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / gang zag tu lta ba la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba la /
translated: Since he does not even desire the view of emptiness, how much less would he desire the views of self, sentient being, life-force, nourished being, or person?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la 'dod pa med pa dang / stong pa nyid la 'dod pa med pas gang thob par bya ba dang / gang gis thob par bya ba tha snyad can gyi ngo bo nyid de gnyi ga la mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la 'dod pa med pa dang / stong pa nyid la 'dod pa med pas gang thob par bya ba dang / gang gis thob par bya ba tha snyad can gyi ngo bo nyid de gnyi ga la mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
translated: Since he does not desire nirvana and does not desire emptiness, he has no attachment to either the nature of the conventional, which is what is to be attained, or the means by which it is attained.

original: don gyi phyir 'brang gi yi ge'i phyir 'brang pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'i don tshol ba'o //
analyzed: don gyi phyir 'brang gi yi ge'i phyir 'brang pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'i don tshol ba'o //
translated: “Not following the syllables for the sake of the meaning” means seeking the intended meaning.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams las rnam par thar pa nang du tshol gyi phyi rol du mi rgyug ces bya ba ni sgra tsam gyi rjes su mi 'brang ba ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams las rnam par thar pa nang du tshol gyi phyi rol du mi rgyug ces bya ba ni sgra tsam gyi rjes su mi 'brang ba ste /
translated: “Seeking liberation from the afflictions within, not running outside” means not following mere words.

original: 'di ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //🔽chos thams cad shin tu dag cing rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med par mthong bas bdag nyid gling yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o // chos thams cad shin tu dag cing rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med par mthong bas bdag nyid gling yin te /
translated: This is the perfection of intention.

original: gzhan gyi gling ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'i @257b ye shes kyis chos kyi de bzhin nyid rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med par rab tu rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gling ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'i @257b ye shes kyis chos kyi de bzhin nyid rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med par rab tu rtogs pa'o //
translated: “Being an island unto oneself, not another’s island” means that by seeing all phenomena as utterly pure and naturally free of afflictions, one realizes the suchness of phenomena through the wisdom of not relying on others.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pa la chos nyid du'ang mi lta na /
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pa la chos nyid du'ang mi lta na /
translated: “Not viewing the Tathāgata even as the true nature” means that the Tathāgata is not an object of conceptual mind.

original: gzugs kyi sgur lta smos kyang ci dgos chos la 'dod chags dang bral bar yang mi lta na smra ba'i tshig gis lam nas brjod pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gzugs kyi sgur lta smos kyang ci dgos chos la 'dod chags dang bral bar yang mi lta na smra ba'i tshig gis lam nas brjod pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If one does not look even at one who is free from attachment to phenomena, what need is there to mention speaking with words?

original: 'phags pa 'dus ma byas pa'i dge 'dun la yang mi lta na mang po 'dus par lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'dus ma byas pa'i dge 'dun la yang mi lta na mang po 'dus par lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If one does not look even at the noble unconditioned saṅgha, what need is there to mention looking at a multitude?

original: chos gang spang bar bya ba'i phyir yang brtson pa ma yin /
analyzed: chos gang spang bar bya ba'i phyir yang brtson pa ma yin /
translated: One does not strive to abandon any phenomenon.

original: bsgom par bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin /
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin /
translated: One does not strive to cultivate any phenomenon.

original: 'khor bar yang mi skye mya ngan las 'das pa la yang mngon par dga' ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'khor bar yang mi skye mya ngan las 'das pa la yang mngon par dga' ba ma yin /
translated: One is not born in saṃsāra, nor does one delight in nirvāṇa.🔽One does not observe liberation, nor is one bound.

original: thar par yang mi dmigs bcings pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba de la dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa thar pa'i mtha' rnams kyang brda'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: thar par yang mi dmigs bcings pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba de la dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa thar pa'i mtha' rnams kyang brda'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The three jewels and so on are the ultimate of liberation, but they are the nature of symbols.

original: dmigs su med pas 'di ni rab tu rtogs pa phun sum tshogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs su med pas 'di ni rab tu rtogs pa phun sum tshogs par bya'o //
translated: Since they are not observed, this is the perfection of realization.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das par rig nas kun du mi 'khor zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnyen po shin tu bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das par rig nas kun du mi 'khor zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnyen po shin tu bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having understood that all phenomena are by nature completely extinguished, they do not cycle. This is because they cultivate the antidotes to all afflictions.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid chad pa med cing 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid chad pa med cing 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are completely extinguished because suchness is without interruption and without fear.

original: 'di ni mthar phyin pa phun sum tshogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mthar phyin pa phun sum tshogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood as the perfection of the ultimate.

original: 'di ni yang dag par sgrub pa'i dge sbyong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag par sgrub pa'i dge sbyong zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the true spiritual practitioner.

original: 'od srungs yang dag par sgrub pa'i dge sbyong gi phyir sbyor bar bya'i /
analyzed: 'od srungs yang dag par sgrub pa'i dge sbyong gi phyir sbyor bar bya'i /
translated: Kāśyapa, one should practice for the sake of the true spiritual practitioner.

original: ming gis gnod par 'gyur bar mi bya'o //🔽zhes bya ba 'di ni bzhi ba dge spyod legs par bslabs pa yin te /
analyzed: ming gis gnod par 'gyur bar mi bya'o // zhes bya ba 'di ni bzhi ba dge spyod legs par bslabs pa yin te /
translated: One should not be harmed by the name.🔽This is the fourth one who is well trained in the practice of virtue.

original: 'od srungs bzhi po 'di dag ni dge sbyong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs bzhi po 'di dag ni dge sbyong zhes bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, these four are called spiritual practitioners.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu dbul po zhig la mdzod 'byor ba zhes ming gdags na 'od srungs de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu dbul po zhig la mdzod 'byor ba zhes ming gdags na 'od srungs de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this: for example, if a poor person were called by the name “wealthy person,” Kāśyapa, what do you think?

original: skyes bu dbul ba de ming de dad 'tsham pa yin nam /
analyzed: skyes bu dbul ba de ming de dad 'tsham pa yin nam /
translated: Is that name suitable for that poor person?

original: gsol ba bcom ldan 'das de ni mi 'tsham mo //
analyzed: gsol ba bcom ldan 'das de ni mi 'tsham mo //
translated: He replied, “Blessed One, it is not suitable.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽'od srungs de bzhin du dge sbyong dang bram ze zhes bya ba gang dag dge spyod dang bram ze'i yon tan dang mi ldan pa de dag ni skyes bu dbul po zhes nga 'chad do zhes bya ba skyes bu dbul po'i dpe 'dis ni dge sbyong legs par
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / 'od srungs de bzhin du dge sbyong dang bram ze zhes bya ba gang dag dge spyod dang bram ze'i yon tan dang mi ldan pa de dag ni skyes bu dbul po zhes nga 'chad do zhes bya ba skyes bu dbul po'i dpe 'dis ni dge sbyong legs par
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Kāśyapa, in the same way, I explain that those who are called ‘ascetics and brahmins’ but do not possess the qualities of ascetics and brahmins are poor people.”

original: ma bslabs pa'o //
analyzed: ma bslabs pa'o //
translated: This example of a poor person shows that the ascetics are not well-trained.

original: de la yang rnam pa gsum gyis ming gi don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la yang rnam pa gsum gyis ming gi don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be understood that they are not suitable in three ways:

original: bsam pa log par zhugs la sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa la sbyor ba log par zhugs pa dang / bsam pa log par zhugs la sbyor @258a * //
analyzed: bsam pa log par zhugs la sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa la sbyor ba log par zhugs pa dang / bsam pa log par zhugs la sbyor @258a * //
translated: There are those who have wrong thought but perfect application, those who have perfect thought but wrong application and those who have both wrong thought and wrong application.🔽

original: ba yang log par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: ba yang log par zhugs pa'o //
translated: One who has a wrong attitude but perfect application, one who has a perfect attitude but a wrong application, and one who has a wrong attitude and a wrong application.

original: de la bsam pa log par zhugs la sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bsam pa log par zhugs la sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
translated: One who has a wrong attitude but perfect application should be known as threefold:

original: thos pa de tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa dang / smra ba de tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa de'i ro myong ba de tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa de tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa dang / smra ba de tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa de'i ro myong ba de tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: one who is satisfied with just that much study, one who is satisfied with just that much discussion, and one who is satisfied with just the experience of mundane meditative concentration.🔽As the Buddha said in the Kasyapa Chapter Sutra, Kasyapa, it is like this: for example, a man is carried away by the water of a river, and someone else says to him, 'Hey, you!

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu la la zhig rgya mtsho'i chus khyer la zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya mtsho'i chu'i dpe des ni bsam pa log par zhugs la sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu la la zhig rgya mtsho'i chus khyer la zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya mtsho'i chu'i dpe des ni bsam pa log par zhugs la sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The water is carrying you away, but you are trying to dig in the water for roots of grass.'🔽The Buddha said, 'The same is true of you, Kasyapa.

original: thos pa la dam par 'dzin par rig par bya'o //🔽'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na sman pa sman sgro thogs te /🔽rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpe des ni de nyid smra ba dam par 'dzin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thos pa la dam par 'dzin par rig par bya'o // 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na sman pa sman sgro thogs te / rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpe des ni de nyid smra ba dam par 'dzin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that he is one who holds the mere hearing of the Dharma to be supreme.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu na ba zhig la rgyal po la 'os pa'i sman btang la cho ga bzhin ma byas pas 'chi ba'i dus byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa na ba'i dpe des ni 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan thob pa'i ro myang
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu na ba zhig la rgyal po la 'os pa'i sman btang la cho ga bzhin ma byas pas 'chi ba'i dus byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa na ba'i dpe des ni 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan thob pa'i ro myang
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this: for example, a physician gives medicine to a sick person, but because he does not follow the proper regimen, he dies.

original: ba tsam la dam par 'dzin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ba tsam la dam par 'dzin par rig par bya'o //
translated: By this example of the sick person, one should understand that he is one who holds the mere enjoyment of the attainment of mundane meditative concentration to be supreme.

original: de la gang rgyal po la 'os pa'i sman lta bu ni 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de la gang rgyal po la 'os pa'i sman lta bu ni 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The medicine appropriate for a king is like the mundane meditative concentration.

original: cho ga bzhin ma byas pa lta bu ni de'i ro myang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: cho ga bzhin ma byas pa lta bu ni de'i ro myang ba lta bu'o //
translated: Not following the proper regimen is like the enjoyment of that.

original: des 'chi ba'i dus byas pa lta bu ni /
analyzed: des 'chi ba'i dus byas pa lta bu ni /
translated: Dying is like

original: ting nge 'dzin de las yongs su nyams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de las yongs su nyams par rig par bya'o //
translated: falling away from that meditative concentration.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na nor bu rin po che mi gtsang bar lhung na smad par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa nor bu rin po che'i dpe des ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa la sbyor ba log par zhugs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na nor bu rin po che mi gtsang bar lhung na smad par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa nor bu rin po che'i dpe des ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa la sbyor ba log par zhugs par rig par bya'o //
translated: By this example of the jewel, one should understand that the attitude is perfect, but the application is faulty.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
translated: As for the example of the corpse, Kasyapa, it is like a man who is garlanded with gold.

original: dper na mi rol gser gyi phreng ba btags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ro'i dpes ni bsam pa yang log par zhugs la sbyor ba yang log par zhugs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na mi rol gser gyi phreng ba btags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ro'i dpes ni bsam pa yang log par zhugs la sbyor ba yang log par zhugs par rig par bya'o //
translated: By this example of the corpse, one should understand that both the attitude and the application are faulty.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na tshod dpon gyi bu shin tu khrus byas te rab tu rnam par byugs la skra dang sen mo bregs nas gos dkar po bgos te /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na tshod dpon gyi bu shin tu khrus byas te rab tu rnam par byugs la skra dang sen mo bregs nas gos dkar po bgos te /
translated: As for the example of the merchant's son, Kasyapa, it is like a merchant's son who has bathed, anointed himself well, shaved his hair and nails, put on white clothes,

original: tsandan sa mchog gis byugs pa'i mgo la tsam pa ka'i me tog gi phreng ba thogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshong dpon gyi bu'i dpe des ni /
analyzed: tsandan sa mchog gis byugs pa'i mgo la tsam pa ka'i me tog gi phreng ba thogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshong dpon gyi bu'i dpe des ni /
translated: and has his head anointed with the best sandalwood and is wearing a garland of champak flowers on his head.

original: bsam pa yang phun sum tshogs la sbyor ba yang phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa yang phun sum tshogs la sbyor ba yang phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The thought is also perfect and the application is also perfect.

original: rnam pa gcig pus ni dge sbyong legs par bslabs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig pus ni dge sbyong legs par bslabs par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the one with all of these aspects is a well-trained spiritual practitioner.

original: 'od srungs bzhi po 'di dag dang tshul ngan pa can tshul khrims dang ldan pa 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: 'od srungs bzhi po 'di dag dang tshul ngan pa can tshul khrims dang ldan pa 'dra ba yin te /
translated: Kāśyapa, these four are like those of bad character who pretend to be moral.

original: bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs @258b pa mtshams ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs @258b pa mtshams ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: don dam pa'i dge sbyong gis don dam pa'i sdom pa bstan nas tshul khrims dang 'dra ba rnams kyis brda'i sdom pa ston to //
analyzed: don dam pa'i dge sbyong gis don dam pa'i sdom pa bstan nas tshul khrims dang 'dra ba rnams kyis brda'i sdom pa ston to //
translated: Having taught the ultimate vow of the ultimate spiritual practitioner, those who pretend to be moral teach the conventional vow.

original: brda'i sdom pa la gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: brda'i sdom pa la gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is it to abide in the conventional vow?

original: bzhi po 'di dag rab tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag rab tu rig par bya'o //
translated: These four should be well known.

original: de dag kyang bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pas rgyun nyams pa'i phyir brda'i sdom pa la gnas pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pas rgyun nyams pa'i phyir brda'i sdom pa la gnas pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: And because they are impaired by grasping at self and so forth, they are called those who abide in the conventional vow.

original: dang po ni yan lag drug pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan yang gnod pa gnyis kyis gnod pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: dang po ni yan lag drug pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan yang gnod pa gnyis kyis gnod pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The first is the morality that is harmed by the two harms, even though it is endowed with the morality of the six factors.

original: yan lag drug po gang zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag drug po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six factors?

original: 'od srungs 'di la dge slong kha cig tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di la dge slong kha cig tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Kāśyapa, here some monks are moral,

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams shing gnas /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams shing gnas /
translated: restrained by the vow of individual liberation,

original: cho ga phun sum tshogs /
analyzed: cho ga phun sum tshogs /
translated: perfect in conduct,🔽perfect in the sphere of activity, and they also take up the minor precepts.

original: spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa kha na ma tho ba phra rab rnams las yang 'dzin pa dang / gang zag tu 'dzin pa 'dong pa de'i gnyen por 'dzin pa med pa gtod ba med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa kha na ma tho ba phra rab rnams las yang 'dzin pa dang / gang zag tu 'dzin pa 'dong pa de'i gnyen por 'dzin pa med pa gtod ba med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to that is taught as “without grasping, without clinging.”🔽In that selflessness of persons, there is no object to be grasped,

original: gang zag la bdag med pa de la gzung ba med pa dang / gzung ba med pa de'i gnyen por gzung ba med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa de la gzung ba med pa dang / gzung ba med pa de'i gnyen por gzung ba med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: and the antidote to that is taught as “not without grasping.”

original: des gzugs la sogs pa la sems can du 'dzin pa dang / der 'dogs pa la legs par 'dzin pa de'i gnyen por sems can med pa sems can du 'dogs pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: des gzugs la sogs pa la sems can du 'dzin pa dang / der 'dogs pa la legs par 'dzin pa de'i gnyen por sems can med pa sems can du 'dogs pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The remedy for the apprehension of form, etc. as sentient beings and for the proper apprehension of the designation of those as sentient beings is the statement: “the non-existence of sentient beings, the designation of sentient beings.”

original: der 'dogs pa'i ngag dang / der 'dogs pa la legs par 'dzin pa de'i gnyen por tshig med pa tshig tu 'dogs pa med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: der 'dogs pa'i ngag dang / der 'dogs pa la legs par 'dzin pa de'i gnyen por tshig med pa tshig tu 'dogs pa med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The remedy for the speech that designates those and for the proper apprehension of the designation of those is the statement: “the non-existence of speech, the non-designation of speech.”

original: der 'dogs par byed pa'i sems dang / der 'dogs pa la legs par 'dzin pa de'i gnyen por sems med pa sems su 'dogs pa med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: der 'dogs par byed pa'i sems dang / der 'dogs pa la legs par 'dzin pa de'i gnyen por sems med pa sems su 'dogs pa med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The remedy for the mind that designates those and for the proper apprehension of the designation of those is the statement: “the non-existence of mind, the non-designation of mind.”

original: der sdom pa la gnas pa gsum pa la ni 'jig rten gong mar skye ba dang / 'jig rten med pa 'og ma yongs su gtong ba ste /
analyzed: der sdom pa la gnas pa gsum pa la ni 'jig rten gong mar skye ba dang / 'jig rten med pa 'og ma yongs su gtong ba ste /
translated: The third, the observance of the vow, is the generation of the higher world and the relinquishment of the lower world.

original: de'i gnyen por 'jig rten med pa 'jig rten med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por 'jig rten med pa 'jig rten med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The remedy for that is the statement: “the non-existence of the world, the non-existence of the world.”

original: snyoms par 'jug pa la brten pa dang / 'dod pa la brten pa de'i gnyen por brten pa med pa brten pa med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa la brten pa dang / 'dod pa la brten pa de'i gnyen por brten pa med pa brten pa med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to the one based on meditative attainment and the one based on desire is not based on and not non-based.

original: bdag gi tshul khrims yang dag par rab tu 'dzin pa dang gzhan gyi tshul khrims la rlom sems su byed pa de'i gnyen por bdag gi tshul khrims la mi bstod gzhan gyi tshul khrims la mi smod pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag gi tshul khrims yang dag par rab tu 'dzin pa dang gzhan gyi tshul khrims la rlom sems su byed pa de'i gnyen por bdag gi tshul khrims la mi bstod gzhan gyi tshul khrims la mi smod pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to the one who upholds one's own morality and disparages others' morality is not praising one's own morality and not disparaging others' morality.

original: sdom pa la gnas pa bzhi pa la ni bdag tshul khrims dang ldan no snyam du rlom sems pa ste /
analyzed: sdom pa la gnas pa bzhi pa la ni bdag tshul khrims dang ldan no snyam du rlom sems pa ste /
translated: In the fourth stage of abiding in the precepts, one conceitedly thinks, I have morality.

original: de'i gnyen por tshul khrims kyis rlom sems su mi @259a * //🔽byed ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por tshul khrims kyis rlom sems su mi @259a * // byed ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to that is not conceited about morality.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid dang bye brag la yongs su rtog pa rnams kyis tshul khrims la yongs su rtog pa de'i gnyen por tshul khrims la mi rtog ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid dang bye brag la yongs su rtog pa rnams kyis tshul khrims la yongs su rtog pa de'i gnyen por tshul khrims la mi rtog ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to the one who conceptualizes morality due to conceptualizing its nature and distinctions is not conceptualizing morality.

original: zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims la ni spros pa'i chos rnams zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims la ni spros pa'i chos rnams zhi ba yin no //
translated: In the morality of the uncontaminated, the phenomena of elaboration are pacified.🔽This is called the uncontaminated morality of the noble ones.

original: 'di ni 'phags pa rnams kyi tshul khrims zag pa med pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags pa rnams kyi tshul khrims zag pa med pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig go //
translated: This is the statement of the teaching.

original: mi ldan pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi ldan pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not associated because it is supramundane.

original: bral ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bral ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is free from because it is not associated with any afflictions.

original: brten pa thams cad med pa ni khams gsum pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brten pa thams cad med pa ni khams gsum pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the absence of all bases because it is the antidote to the three realms.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i khyad par bstan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i khyad par bstan par rig par bya ste /
translated: Here, the verse should be understood to teach the distinction of pure morality.

original: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshegs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshegs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One spoke these verses at that time.

original: tshul khrims ldan pa dri ma med cing ci yang med //
analyzed: tshul khrims ldan pa dri ma med cing ci yang med //
translated: The moral one is stainless and has nothing at all.

original: ces bya ba tshigs su bcad pa rtsa ba dang pos ni dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa ci yang med pa'i phyir de'i gzhi rnam par dag pas tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid gzhi dang bcas pa rnam par dag pa yongs su ston te /
analyzed: ces bya ba tshigs su bcad pa rtsa ba dang pos ni dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa ci yang med pa'i phyir de'i gzhi rnam par dag pas tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid gzhi dang bcas pa rnam par dag pa yongs su ston te /
translated: The first basic verse shows the purity of the nature of morality and the purity of its basis, because it is free from stains and because there is no attachment, etc.

original: rtsa ba lhag ma gsum pos ni tshul khrims de nyid kyis grogs gzhi dang bcas par rnam par dag par yongs su ston to //
analyzed: rtsa ba lhag ma gsum pos ni tshul khrims de nyid kyis grogs gzhi dang bcas par rnam par dag par yongs su ston to //
translated: The remaining three basic verses show the purity of that morality together with its basis and its companions.

original: de la ngang tshul ngan pa'i grogs gzhi dang bcas pa rnams kyi gnyen por tshul khrims kyi grogs gzhi dang bcas pa rnams rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la ngang tshul ngan pa'i grogs gzhi dang bcas pa rnams kyi gnyen por tshul khrims kyi grogs gzhi dang bcas pa rnams rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The companions of bad character together with their basis should be understood as the resistances to the companions of morality together with its basis.

original: de la ngang tshul ngan pa'i grogs po ni gsum ste /
analyzed: de la ngang tshul ngan pa'i grogs po ni gsum ste /
translated: Therein, the companions of bad character are three:

original: rgyags pa gzugs la sogs pa la brten pa'i gzhi dang bcas pa de'i gnyen por /
analyzed: rgyags pa gzugs la sogs pa la brten pa'i gzhi dang bcas pa de'i gnyen por /
translated: The companion of bad character based on intoxication, which is based on such things as physical beauty, is resisted by

original: tshul khrims ldan la rgyags pa med de brten pa med //
analyzed: tshul khrims ldan la rgyags pa med de brten pa med //
translated: The one who has morality is not arrogant and is not dependent.

original: ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rnam par rmongs pa'i bdag nyid mun pa lta bu'i lta ba snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba'i 'ching ba'i gzhi dang bcas pa de'i gnyen por 'jigs par lta /
analyzed: rnam par rmongs pa'i bdag nyid mun pa lta bu'i lta ba snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba'i 'ching ba'i gzhi dang bcas pa de'i gnyen por 'jigs par lta /
translated: The view that is like darkness, which is the nature of delusion, is the basis of the fetter of relishing meditative concentration.

original: bslab pa'i gnas rnams yang dag par blangs te slob /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gnas rnams yang dag par blangs te slob /
translated: One should see fear in that and train in the precepts.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yongs su dag pa dang ldan pas gnas la 'tsho ba yongs su dag kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yongs su dag pa dang ldan pas gnas la 'tsho ba yongs su dag kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One should abide with pure bodily, verbal, and mental actions, and have pure livelihood.

original: gnod pa gnyis po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnod pa gnyis po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two kinds of harm?

original: bdag tu smra bar gyur pa zhes bya ba 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i kun nas bskor ba dang / nyes pa las 'byung ba ma byang ba'o //
analyzed: bdag tu smra bar gyur pa zhes bya ba 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i kun nas bskor ba dang / nyes pa las 'byung ba ma byang ba'o //
translated: The first is the harm of the view of self, which is being surrounded by the view of the transitory collection, and not purifying the arising of faults.

original: gnyis pa ni nyes pa de gnyi ga rnam par spangs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni nyes pa de gnyi ga rnam par spangs pa ste /
translated: The second is abandoning both of those faults.

original: 'od srungs gzhan yang 'di @259b la dge slong kha cig 'dul ba 'dzin pa zhes bya ba 'am /
analyzed: 'od srungs gzhan yang 'di @259b la dge slong kha cig 'dul ba 'dzin pa zhes bya ba 'am /
translated: KaSyapa, furthermore, here some monks say I am an upholder of the Vinaya or I am an upholder of the Sūtra or I am an upholder of the Abhidharma.

original: ngang tshul ngan pa can tshul khrims dang ldan pa 'dra ba gnyis pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar dag go //
analyzed: ngang tshul ngan pa can tshul khrims dang ldan pa 'dra ba gnyis pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar dag go //
translated: The fourth is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The fifth is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The sixth is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.

original: nyes pa de gnyi ga rnam par spangs zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa nyes pa las 'byin pa la mkhas pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i kun nas bskor ba rnam par spangs pa'o //🔽de lta mod kyi 'on kyang 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa ma thob pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i lhan cig skyes pa rnam par ma mnan to //
analyzed: nyes pa de gnyi ga rnam par spangs zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa nyes pa las 'byin pa la mkhas pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i kun nas bskor ba rnam par spangs pa'o // de lta mod kyi 'on kyang 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa ma thob pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i lhan cig skyes pa rnam par ma mnan to //
translated: The seventh is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The eighth is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The ninth is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The tenth is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The eleventh is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The twelfth is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.

original: gsum pa ni chos 'di la zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni chos 'di la zhugs pa ste /
translated: The thirteenth is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The fourteenth is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The fifteenth is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The sixteenth is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The seventeenth is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The eighteenth is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The nineteenth is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The twentieth is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The twenty-first is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The twenty-second is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The twenty-third is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The twenty-fourth is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The twenty-fifth is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.

original: gzhan yang 'di la dge slong kha cig byams pa la gnas pa yin te zhes bya ba nas 'di ngang tshul ngan pa can tshul khrims dang ldan pa 'dra ba gsum pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar dag ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di la dge slong kha cig byams pa la gnas pa yin te zhes bya ba nas 'di ngang tshul ngan pa can tshul khrims dang ldan pa 'dra ba gsum pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar dag ste /
translated: The twenty-sixth is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The twenty-seventh is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The twenty-eighth is one who is of bad character but appears to be of good character.🔽The twenty-ninth is one who is of bad

original: 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa'i sdom pa rnyed nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba lhan cig skyes pa rnam par mnan kyang gtan nas ma phyin pas chos la bdag med pa ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa'i sdom pa rnyed nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba lhan cig skyes pa rnam par mnan kyang gtan nas ma phyin pas chos la bdag med pa ma rig pa ste /
translated: Having obtained the mundane pure vow, the innate view of the transitory collection is suppressed, but since it is not abandoned forever, it is the morality of fear.

original: 'jigs pas gnod pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'jigs pas gnod pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of injury is the morality of one who is ignorant of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: bzhi pa ni de las gzhan pa'i nyes pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni de las gzhan pa'i nyes pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa ste /
translated: The fourth is the complete abandonment of all faults other than those.

original: gzhan yang 'di la dge slong kha cig sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis yang dag par blangs kyang dmigs par lta ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di la dge slong kha cig sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis yang dag par blangs kyang dmigs par lta ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, some monks here undertake the twelve ascetic practices, but they are view-fixated.
