original: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: They are said to abide in the grasping of “I” and “mine,”

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni dang tshul ngan pa tshul khrims dang ldan pa 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar dag ste /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni dang tshul ngan pa tshul khrims dang ldan pa 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar dag ste /
translated: up to “these four are the bad conduct that resembles good conduct.”

original: chos la bdag med pa la log par mos pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis gnod pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa la log par mos pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis gnod pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of injury is the morality of one who is ignorant of the selflessness of phenomena and is injured by manifest pride.

original: sdom pa la gnas pa bzhi po dag las spros pa'i chos gang dag dmigs pa de dag rab tu zhi ba'i mtshan nyid de ni zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdom pa la gnas pa bzhi po dag las spros pa'i chos gang dag dmigs pa de dag rab tu zhi ba'i mtshan nyid de ni zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims su rig par bya'o //
translated: Of the four who abide in the vow, the characteristic of the pacification of those mental processes and those objects that are mental proliferations is to be known as uncontaminated morality.

original: spros pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: spros pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the mental processes and objects that are mental proliferations?

original: sdom pa la gnas pa dang po la ni bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: sdom pa la gnas pa dang po la ni bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir dmigs pa ste /
translated: For the first who abides in the vow, there is the observation of the self and of what belongs to the self.

original: de'i gnyen phor 'od srungs tshul khrims zhes bya ba ni gad la bdag gi med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽nyes pa med pa dang / de mi byed pa'i de'i gnyen por bya ba med pa mi bya ba med pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i gnyen phor 'od srungs tshul khrims zhes bya ba ni gad la bdag gi med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so // nyes pa med pa dang / de mi byed pa'i de'i gnyen por bya ba med pa mi bya ba med pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to that is taught as “non-self” and “non-mine.”🔽The antidote to the absence of faults and to the performance of what is not to be done is taught as “non-action” and “non-performance of what is not to be done.”

original: bsam pa bzhin du byed pa la sbyor ba dang / de la mi sbyor ba de'i gnyen por byed pa med pa byed pa med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bsam pa bzhin du byed pa la sbyor ba dang / de la mi sbyor ba de'i gnyen por byed pa med pa byed pa med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to the application to what is to be done as one wishes and to the non-application to that is taught as “non-action” and “non-non-action.”

original: shes bzhin du rgyu ba dang des mi rgyu ba de'i gnyen por rgyu ba med pa rgyu ba med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: shes bzhin du rgyu ba dang des mi rgyu ba de'i gnyen por rgyu ba med pa rgyu ba med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to that is “not non-wandering,” which is wandering with awareness.🔽The antidote to that is “not non-wandering,” which is not wandering.🔽The antidote to that is “not non-enjoyment,” which is enjoyment.

original: dran pa nyams pa rab tu spyod pa dang / des rab tu mi spyod pa de'i gnyen @260a * //
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa rab tu spyod pa dang / des rab tu mi spyod pa de'i gnyen @260a * //
translated: The antidote to that is “not enjoyment,” which is non-enjoyment.🔽The antidote to that is “not non-enjoyment,” which is enjoyment.🔽The antidote to that is “not non-enjoyment,” which is enjoyment.🔽The antidote to that is “not non-wandering,” which is wandering with awareness.🔽The antidote to that is “not non-wandering,” which is not wandering.🔽The antidote to that is “not non-enjoyment,” which is enjoyment.🔽The antidote to that is “not enjoyment,” which is non-enjoyment.🔽The antidote to that is “not non-enjoyment,” which is enjoyment.🔽The antidote to that is “not non-wandering,” which is wandering with awareness.

original: por rab tu spyod pa med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽sdom pa la gnas pa gnyis pa la ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i phyogs gnas ngan len dang ldan pa'i ming dang gzugs dmigs te /
analyzed: por rab tu spyod pa med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so // sdom pa la gnas pa gnyis pa la ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i phyogs gnas ngan len dang ldan pa'i ming dang gzugs dmigs te /
translated: The antidote to that is “not non-wandering,” which is not wandering.🔽The antidote to that is “not non-enjoyment,” which is enjoyment.🔽The antidote to that is “not enjoyment,” which is non-enjoyment.🔽The antidote to that is “not non-enjoyment,” which is enjoyment.🔽The antidote to that is “not non-wandering,” which is wandering with awareness.

original: de'i gnyen por ming med pa gzugs med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por ming med pa gzugs med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to that is “not non-wandering,” which is not wandering.🔽The antidote to that is “not non-enjoyment,” which is enjoyment.🔽The antidote to that is “not enjoyment,” which is non-enjoyment.🔽The antidote to that is “not non-enjoyment,” which is enjoyment.🔽The antidote to that is “not non-wandering,” which is wandering with awareness.🔽The antidote to that is “not non-wandering,” which is not wandering.🔽The antidote to that is “not non-enjoyment,” which is enjoyment.🔽The antidote to that is “not enjoyment,” which is non-enjoyment.

original: ma 'ongs pa na skye ba'i mtshan ma dang / de na mtshan ma med pa de'i gnyen por mtshan ma med pa /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na skye ba'i mtshan ma dang / de na mtshan ma med pa de'i gnyen por mtshan ma med pa /
translated: The antidote to that is “not non-enjoyment,” which is enjoyment.🔽The antidote to that is “not non-wandering,” which is wandering with awareness.🔽The antidote to that is “not non-wandering,” which is not wandering.

original: mtshan ma med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to that is “not non-enjoyment,” which is enjoyment.🔽The

original: kun nas bskor ba rab tu zhi ba dang / de'i bag la nyal ma zhi ba de'i gnyen por rab tu zhi ba ma yin pa rab tu ma zhi ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: kun nas bskor ba rab tu zhi ba dang / de'i bag la nyal ma zhi ba de'i gnyen por rab tu zhi ba ma yin pa rab tu ma zhi ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to the non-pacification of the latent impressions of that is the statement “not pacified, not non-pacified.”

original: gang zag la bdag med pa tshul khrims ldan la mun pa med cing 'ching ba med ces bya ba gsungs so //🔽log par 'tsho ba dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rdul lta bu bdag la chags pa'i skyon gyi gzhi dang bcas pa de'i gnyen por /🔽tshul khrims ldan pa rdul rnams med de nyes pa med //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa tshul khrims ldan la mun pa med cing 'ching ba med ces bya ba gsungs so // log par 'tsho ba dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rdul lta bu bdag la chags pa'i skyon gyi gzhi dang bcas pa de'i gnyen por / tshul khrims ldan pa rdul rnams med de nyes pa med //
translated: The absence of self in the person is stated in “the one with morality has no darkness, no bondage.”

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The conceptualization associated with wrong livelihood is like dust, along with the basis of the fault of attachment to self. The antidote to that is stated in “the one with morality has no dust, no fault.”

original: 'di tshigs su bcad pa dang po'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: 'di tshigs su bcad pa dang po'i tshig gi don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the words of the first verse.

original: zhi ba rab tu zhi ba nye bar zhi ba'i yid //
analyzed: zhi ba rab tu zhi ba nye bar zhi ba'i yid //
translated: The mind that is peaceful, very peaceful, completely peaceful,

original: rtog dang rnam par rtog dang bral zhing nyon mongs med //
analyzed: rtog dang rnam par rtog dang bral zhing nyon mongs med //
translated: free from conceptual thought and discrimination, free from afflictions,

original: g-yo ba dang ni rlom sems kun dang rnam bral ba //
analyzed: g-yo ba dang ni rlom sems kun dang rnam bral ba //
translated: free from all movement and conceit,

original: de ni 'od srungs sangs rgyas bstan la tshul khrims ldan //
analyzed: de ni 'od srungs sangs rgyas bstan la tshul khrims ldan //
translated: That is the Buddha’s teaching for Kashyapa, with morality.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa ni tshul khrims de'i rnam pa thams cad rnam par dag pa las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa ni tshul khrims de'i rnam pa thams cad rnam par dag pa las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
translated: The second verse should be understood as beginning with the purification of all the aspects of that morality.

original: de la ngo bo nyid dang / grogs nyes pa gzhi dang bcas pa'i gnyen por so sor thar pa'i sdom pa rnam par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid dang / grogs nyes pa gzhi dang bcas pa'i gnyen por so sor thar pa'i sdom pa rnam par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therein, the pratimoksha vow should be understood as the antidote to the faults of the basis of the nature and the faults of the basis of the friend.

original: de la tshul khrims rang bzhin la log par zhugs pa'i dri ma nyes pa'i gzhi dang bcas pa'i gnyen por zhi ba'o //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims rang bzhin la log par zhugs pa'i dri ma nyes pa'i gzhi dang bcas pa'i gnyen por zhi ba'o //
translated: Therein, tranquility is the antidote to the defilement that wrongly engages the nature of morality, together with the basis of the fault.

original: grogs rgyags pa'i nyes pa gzhi dang bcas pa'i gnyen por rab tu zhi ba'o //
analyzed: grogs rgyags pa'i nyes pa gzhi dang bcas pa'i gnyen por rab tu zhi ba'o //
translated: Extreme tranquility is the antidote to the fault of the basis of the friend’s intoxication.

original: lta ba'i nyes pa gzhi dang bcas pa'i gnyen por nye bar zhi ba'i yid do //
analyzed: lta ba'i nyes pa gzhi dang bcas pa'i gnyen por nye bar zhi ba'i yid do //
translated: The pacification of the mind is the antidote to the fault of the basis of the view.

original: log par 'tsho ba dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i nyes pa gzhi dang bcas pa'i gnyen por rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: log par 'tsho ba dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i nyes pa gzhi dang bcas pa'i gnyen por rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: The remedy for the fault of conceptualization, together with its basis, is freedom from conceptualization and discursive thought.

original: de ltar na sdom pa rnam par dag par bya'o ;
analyzed: de ltar na sdom pa rnam par dag par bya'o ;
translated: Thus, one should purify the vow.

original: / nyon mongs pa med pas ni bsam gtan gyi sdom pa rnam par dag pa'o //🔽g-yo ba dang ni rlom sems kun dang rnam bral ba //
analyzed: / nyon mongs pa med pas ni bsam gtan gyi sdom pa rnam par dag pa'o // g-yo ba dang ni rlom sems kun dang rnam bral ba //
translated: By being free from afflictions, one purifies the vow of meditation.

original: zhes bya ba lhag mas ni zag pa med pa'i sdom pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lhag mas ni zag pa med pa'i sdom pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The remaining verses show the purification of the untainted vow.

original: de ni 'od srungs sangs rgyas bstan la tshul khrims ldan //
analyzed: de ni 'od srungs sangs rgyas bstan la tshul khrims ldan //
translated: KaSyapa, the one who has morality in the Buddha’s teaching

original: zhes bya ba ni ji skad gsungs pa @260b rnams bye brag med par tshul khrims dang ldan par ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji skad gsungs pa @260b rnams bye brag med par tshul khrims dang ldan par ston to //
translated: shows that one who has morality is not distinguished by the above.

original: lus la mi lta srog la phangs par 'dzin mi byed //
analyzed: lus la mi lta srog la phangs par 'dzin mi byed //
translated: Not regarding the body, not holding life dear,

original: srid pa rnams su skye ba kun la 'dod pa med //
analyzed: srid pa rnams su skye ba kun la 'dod pa med //
translated: not desiring any of the births in existence,

original: yang dag zhugs shing de nyid tshul khrims rab gnas pa //
analyzed: yang dag zhugs shing de nyid tshul khrims rab gnas pa //
translated: rightly engaged, well-established in morality,

original: de ni 'od srungs sangs rgyas bstan la tshul khrims ldan //
analyzed: de ni 'od srungs sangs rgyas bstan la tshul khrims ldan //
translated: That is the Buddha’s teaching for Kashyapa, endowed with morality.

original: zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa ni tshul khrims nyid kyi nyes pa med pa'i rnam par dag pa las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa ni tshul khrims nyid kyi nyes pa med pa'i rnam par dag pa las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
translated: The third verse is to be understood as beginning the purification of morality itself, which is free from five faults.

original: nyes pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: nyes pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The faults are fivefold.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'thob pa dang bkur sti'i zil gyis non pa'i nyes pa dang / lus la lta ba dang bcas bas le lo'i nyes pa dang / lta ba la rnam par rtog pas srog la phangs par 'dzin te /
analyzed: 'thob pa dang bkur sti'i zil gyis non pa'i nyes pa dang / lus la lta ba dang bcas bas le lo'i nyes pa dang / lta ba la rnam par rtog pas srog la phangs par 'dzin te /
translated: The fault of being overcome by the desire for gain and honor, the fault of laziness due to concern for one’s body, the fault of holding life dear and of conceptualizing views,

original: smon lam btab nas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa'i nyes pa dang / srid par skye ba thams cad la gnas pas tshul khrims tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa'i nyes pa dang / tshul khrims las gong du ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab bsgom pa la yang dag par ma zhugs pas mi 'byung ba'i nyes pa ste /
analyzed: smon lam btab nas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa'i nyes pa dang / srid par skye ba thams cad la gnas pas tshul khrims tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa'i nyes pa dang / tshul khrims las gong du ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab bsgom pa la yang dag par ma zhugs pas mi 'byung ba'i nyes pa ste /
translated: the fault of being satisfied with mere morality, abiding in all births in existence, and the fault of not attaining concentration and wisdom, which is the cultivation higher than morality.

original: dper na gzhan mu stegs can rnams kyi yang dag pa ma yin pa'i tshul khrims lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzhan mu stegs can rnams kyi yang dag pa ma yin pa'i tshul khrims lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the morality of the non-Buddhists is not right.

original: nyes pa lnga po de dag dang bral bas nyes pa med pa'i rnam par ngag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyes pa lnga po de dag dang bral bas nyes pa med pa'i rnam par ngag par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the absence of the five faults is the purity of morality.

original: 'jig rten ma gos 'jig rten dag la gnas pa med //
analyzed: 'jig rten ma gos 'jig rten dag la gnas pa med //
translated: Not defiled by the world, not dwelling in the world,

original: snang ba thob cing bdag gi med de ci yang med //
analyzed: snang ba thob cing bdag gi med de ci yang med //
translated: attaining illumination, without self, without anything,

original: bdag tu 'du shes med cing gzhan du 'du shes med //
analyzed: bdag tu 'du shes med cing gzhan du 'du shes med //
translated: without the notion of self, without the notion of other,🔽morality is pure through the thorough knowledge of the notion.

original: 'du shes yongs su shes pas tshul khrims rnam par dag / ces bya ba tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i rnam par dag pa las brtsams pa'o //🔽de la 'jig rten ma gos zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pas bsdus pa /🔽dga' ba can gyi 'dod chags dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'du shes yongs su shes pas tshul khrims rnam par dag / ces bya ba tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i rnam par dag pa las brtsams pa'o // de la 'jig rten ma gos zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pas bsdus pa / dga' ba can gyi 'dod chags dang ldan pa /
translated: The fourth verse is a praise of the purity of non-affliction.🔽Therein, “not defiled by the world” means that one is not defiled by worldly dharmas because one has abandoned the craving associated with the attachment of the world, which is included in the truth of origination,

original: de dang der mngon par dga' ba'i srid pa spangs pas 'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi gos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang der mngon par dga' ba'i srid pa spangs pas 'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi gos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because one has abandoned the existence that delights in this and that.

original: 'jig rten dag la gnas pa med //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag la gnas pa med //
translated: He does not dwell in the world.

original: ces bya ba ni yang srid pa 'byung ba'i srid pa spangs pas 'jig rten la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni yang srid pa 'byung ba'i srid pa spangs pas 'jig rten la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not dwell in the world because he has abandoned the craving that is the origin of the world.

original: snang ba thob ces bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis snang ba thob pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: snang ba thob ces bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis snang ba thob pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: He has attained the light, because he has attained the light of the path of insight.

original: / bdag gi med de ci yang med //
analyzed: / bdag gi med de ci yang med //
translated: He has no self, nothing of his own.

original: ces bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam ni ma rig pa la sogs pa dang / de las gzhan pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i gnyen po yin pas bdag gi med de ci yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam ni ma rig pa la sogs pa dang / de las gzhan pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i gnyen po yin pas bdag gi med de ci yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He has no self, nothing of his own, because the path of meditative development is the antidote to ignorance, etc., and to all that is other than that, i.e. to all that is impure.

original: bdag tu 'du shes med cing gzhan du 'du shes med //
analyzed: bdag tu 'du shes med cing gzhan du 'du shes med //
translated: He has no notion of self, nor of other.

original: 'du shes yongs su shes pas tshul khrims @261a * //
analyzed: 'du shes yongs su shes pas tshul khrims @261a * //
translated: His morality is pure through the complete understanding of his notion.

original: rnam par dag / ces bya ba ni mi slob pa'i lam gyis bdag dang gzhan du 'du shes med pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang la tshu rol med cing pha rol dbus kyang med //
analyzed: rnam par dag / ces bya ba ni mi slob pa'i lam gyis bdag dang gzhan du 'du shes med pa'i phyir ro // gang la tshu rol med cing pha rol dbus kyang med //
translated: His morality is pure through the complete understanding of his notion of self and other on the path of no-more-learning.🔽He who has no near shore, no far shore, and no middle,

original: tshu rol pha rol dag la nams kyang mi chags shing //
analyzed: tshu rol pha rol dag la nams kyang mi chags shing //
translated: is never attached to the near shore or the far shore.

original: bcings dang chags med tshul 'chos med cing zag med pa //
analyzed: bcings dang chags med tshul 'chos med cing zag med pa //
translated: He is not bound, not attached, not hypocritical, and not defiled.

original: de ni 'od srungs sangs rgyas bstan la tshul khrims ldan //
analyzed: de ni 'od srungs sangs rgyas bstan la tshul khrims ldan //
translated: He is a monk, Kaśyapa, in the teaching of the Buddha.

original: zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa lnga pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'i rnam par dag pa las brtsams par rig par bya'o //🔽de la / gang la tshu rol med cing pha rol dbus kyang med //
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa lnga pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'i rnam par dag pa las brtsams par rig par bya'o // de la / gang la tshu rol med cing pha rol dbus kyang med //
translated: The fifth verse is to be understood as beginning the praise of the purity of the absence of pride.

original: ces bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa na tshu rol dang pha rol dang dbus zhes brjod pa nang dang / phyi'i skye mched dang / rnam par shes pa drug gi mtshan ma kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽tshu rol pha rol dag la nams kyang mi chags shing //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa na tshu rol dang pha rol dang dbus zhes brjod pa nang dang / phyi'i skye mched dang / rnam par shes pa drug gi mtshan ma kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro // tshu rol pha rol dag la nams kyang mi chags shing //
translated: There, “He has no near shore, no far shore, and no middle” means that when he is established in the absence of signs, the signs of the near shore, the far shore, and the middle, that is, the internal and external sense bases and the six consciousnesses, do not appear.

original: zhes bya ba ni rtag tu gnas kyang 'dod pa la yid bde ba la sogs pa tha dad pa nas mi chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtag tu gnas kyang 'dod pa la yid bde ba la sogs pa tha dad pa nas mi chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “He is never attached to near or far” means that he is never attached to the differences of pleasure, etc. in the objects of desire, even though he always remains in the world.

original: bcings dang chags med tshul 'chos med cing zag med pa //
analyzed: bcings dang chags med tshul 'chos med cing zag med pa //
translated: He is not bound, not attached, not hypocritical, and not defiled.

original: zhes bya ba ni bag la nyal dang bcas pa'i kun nas bskor ba spangs pas nyon mongs pa spangs pa na tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal med par rnam par gzhag pas zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bag la nyal dang bcas pa'i kun nas bskor ba spangs pas nyon mongs pa spangs pa na tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal med par rnam par gzhag pas zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This shows that when he has abandoned the afflictions along with their latent tendencies, he is not hypocritical and not arrogant, and so he is not defiled.

original: de ni 'od srungs sangs rgyas bstan la tshul khrims ldan //
analyzed: de ni 'od srungs sangs rgyas bstan la tshul khrims ldan //
translated: “ Kāśyapa, he is moral in the Buddha’s religion.

original: zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi don sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi don sngar bshad zin to //
translated: ” This shows the same meaning as was explained above.

original: ming dang gzugs rnams la ni chags pa med pa'i yid //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs rnams la ni chags pa med pa'i yid //
translated: “ His mind is not attached to name and form.

original: de ni mnyam par gzhag cing shin tu dul ba'i sems //
analyzed: de ni mnyam par gzhag cing shin tu dul ba'i sems //
translated: He is concentrated and has a well-controlled mind.

original: gang la bdag med bdag gir 'dzin pa med pa ni //
analyzed: gang la bdag med bdag gir 'dzin pa med pa ni //
translated: He has no self and no grasping at self.

original: de tsam gyis na tshul khrims gnas zhes brjod pa yin //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na tshul khrims gnas zhes brjod pa yin //
translated: Just that much is called ‘abiding in morality.’

original: zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa drug pa ni rab tu rnam par dag pa las brtsams par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa drug pa ni rab tu rnam par dag pa las brtsams par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: ” The sixth verse should be understood as a praise of the perfection of morality.

original: de la / ming dang gzugs rnams la ni chags pa med pa'i yid //
analyzed: de la / ming dang gzugs rnams la ni chags pa med pa'i yid //
translated: As to that, the mind is unattached to name and form.

original: ces bya ba ni ming dang gzugs la chags pa med pas yang srid pa la mi smon pa'i phyir ro //🔽de ni mnyam par gzhag ces bya ba ni tshul khrims tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pas sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni ming dang gzugs la chags pa med pas yang srid pa la mi smon pa'i phyir ro // de ni mnyam par gzhag ces bya ba ni tshul khrims tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pas sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the mind is unattached to name and form, and so does not aspire to renewed existence.🔽It is in meditative equipoise, because it does not consider mere morality to be sufficient, and so the mind is in meditative equipoise.

original: shin tu dul ba'i sems zhes bya ba ni sems shin tu dul bas ting nge 'dzin tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu dul ba'i sems zhes bya ba ni sems shin tu dul bas ting nge 'dzin tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a well-controlled mind, because it does not consider mere concentration to be sufficient, and so the mind is well-controlled.

original: gang la bdag med bdag gir 'dzin pa med pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi dang bral bas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi 'jig rten pa'i shes rab kyis chog par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //🔽@261b de tsam gyis na tshul khrims gnas zhes brjod pa yin //
analyzed: gang la bdag med bdag gir 'dzin pa med pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi dang bral bas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi 'jig rten pa'i shes rab kyis chog par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro // @261b de tsam gyis na tshul khrims gnas zhes brjod pa yin //
translated: It is free from the notion of self and the notion of “mine”, because it does not consider even mundane wisdom up to the Pinnacle of Existence to be sufficient, and so is free from the notion of “mine”.🔽One is called “morally disciplined” to that extent.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims zhes bya ba'i tshig gi tshul khrims rab yin par ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims zhes bya ba'i tshig gi tshul khrims rab yin par ston to //
translated: This shows that the term “morality” is a term for the perfection of morality.

original: so sor thar pa slob pa rlom sems byed pa med //
analyzed: so sor thar pa slob pa rlom sems byed pa med //
translated: He trains in the pratimoksa, but does not make a display of it.

original: des ni 'di na de la chags par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: des ni 'di na de la chags par mi 'gyur te //
translated: He does not become attached to it here in this world.

original: de yi gang du 'phags pa'i lam rnams tshol byed pa //
analyzed: de yi gang du 'phags pa'i lam rnams tshol byed pa //
translated: He seeks the noble paths beyond that.

original: de ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: de ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: This is the sign of pure morality.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bdun pa ni 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa las brtsams par blta'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bdun pa ni 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa las brtsams par blta'o //
translated: The seventh verse is to be regarded as beginning the discussion of mundane purity.

original: so sor thar pa slob pa rlom sems byed pa med //
analyzed: so sor thar pa slob pa rlom sems byed pa med //
translated: He trains in the pratimoksa, but does not make a display of it.

original: des ni 'di na de la chags par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: des ni 'di na de la chags par mi 'gyur te //
translated: He does not become attached to it here in this world.

original: zhes bya bas ni tshul khrims tsam gyis khengs par mi 'dzin pa dang / chog par mi 'dzin pa ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni tshul khrims tsam gyis khengs par mi 'dzin pa dang / chog par mi 'dzin pa ston to //
translated: This shows that he does not become proud with mere morality, and that he is not satisfied with mere morality.

original: de yi gong du 'phags pa'i lam rnams tshol byed pa //
analyzed: de yi gong du 'phags pa'i lam rnams tshol byed pa //
translated: He seeks the noble paths beyond that.

original: de ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: de ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: This is the sign of pure morality.

original: zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam tshol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam tshol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This shows that he is not satisfied with mere concentration, because he seeks the supramundane path.

original: tshul khrims gtso bo ma yin ting 'dzin der chags med //
analyzed: tshul khrims gtso bo ma yin ting 'dzin der chags med //
translated: Morality is not the main thing, and he is not attached to that concentration.

original: de yi gong du shes rab bsgom pa yongs su tshol //
analyzed: de yi gong du shes rab bsgom pa yongs su tshol //
translated: He seeks to cultivate wisdom beyond that.

original: dmigs pa med pa 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs yin te //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs yin te //
translated: The family of the noble ones is without objective support.

original: tshul khrims de ni bde bar gshegs pas rab tu bsngags /
analyzed: tshul khrims de ni bde bar gshegs pas rab tu bsngags /
translated: That morality is highly praised by the Well-Gone Ones.

original: zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa brgyad pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa brgyad pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
translated: This eighth verse on the perfections is to be understood as beginning the discussion of supramundane purity.

original: de la tshul khrims gtso bo ma yin zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims gtso bo ma yin zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, “morality is not the main thing” means that one does not consider morality alone to be sufficient.

original: ting 'dzin der chags med ces bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi ro myang bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting 'dzin der chags med ces bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi ro myang bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “He is not attached to that concentration” means that he does not relish the taste of concentration.

original: de yi gong du shes rab bsgom pa yongs su tshol //🔽dmigs pa med pa 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs yin te /
analyzed: de yi gong du shes rab bsgom pa yongs su tshol // dmigs pa med pa 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs yin te /
translated: “He seeks to cultivate wisdom beyond that” means that he seeks to cultivate the wisdom that transcends the mundane.

original: dmigs pa med pas bsdus pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pas bsdus pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “The family of the noble ones is without objective support” means that the family of the noble ones is not associated with objective supports.🔽“That morality is highly praised by the Well-Gone Ones” means that the morality of the noble ones is highly praised by the Buddhas.

original: bde bar gshegs pas rab tu bsngags //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas rab tu bsngags //
translated: The Sugata has praised it well.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig ni de'i pha rol na rab tu bsngags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig ni de'i pha rol na rab tu bsngags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “well” in the verse means that there is nothing better than that praise.

original: 'jig pa'i tshogs la lta las rnam par grol ba'i yid //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i tshogs la lta las rnam par grol ba'i yid //
translated: The mind is liberated from the view of the perishable composite.

original: de 'dir nga dang nga yi snyam du 'gyur ba med //
analyzed: de 'dir nga dang nga yi snyam du 'gyur ba med //
translated: Herein, there is no thought of “I” or “mine.”

original: sangs rgyas spyod yul stong pa nyid la lhag par mos ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas spyod yul stong pa nyid la lhag par mos ;
translated: He has great faith in the Buddha’s sphere, emptiness.

original: / de yi tshul khrims de ni mnyam pa med pa'o //
analyzed: / de yi tshul khrims de ni mnyam pa med pa'o //
translated: His morality is unequaled.

original: zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa dgu pa ni slob pa dang mi slob pa dang / slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa rnam par dag pa las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa dgu pa ni slob pa dang mi slob pa dang / slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa rnam par dag pa las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
translated: The ninth verse shows the purity of the learner, the accomplished, and the neither.

original: de la / 'jig pa'i tshogs la lta las rnam par grol ba'i yid //
analyzed: de la / 'jig pa'i tshogs la lta las rnam par grol ba'i yid //
translated: The mind is liberated from the view of the perishable composite.

original: ces bya ba ni @262a * //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni @262a * //
translated: Herein, there is no thought of “I” or “mine.”

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba rnam par brtags pa spangs pa'i phyir slob pa rnam par dag pa ston to //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba rnam par brtags pa spangs pa'i phyir slob pa rnam par dag pa ston to //
translated: The phrase “liberated from the view of the perishable composite” shows the purity of the learner, because the imagined view of the perishable composite is abandoned.

original: de 'dir nga dang nga yi snyam du 'gyur ba med //
analyzed: de 'dir nga dang nga yi snyam du 'gyur ba med //
translated: Here, there is no “I” or “mine” in that.

original: ces bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba lhan cig skyes pa spangs pa'i phyir mi slob pa rnam par dag pa ston to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba lhan cig skyes pa spangs pa'i phyir mi slob pa rnam par dag pa ston to //
translated: This shows the purity of the nonlearner, because the innate identity view has been abandoned.

original: sangs rgyas spyod yul stong pa nyid la lhag par mos //
analyzed: sangs rgyas spyod yul stong pa nyid la lhag par mos //
translated: He has conviction in emptiness, the domain of the buddhas.

original: zhes bya ba ni stong ba nyid lhag par mos pa'i phyir slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa ma yin pa rnam par dag pa ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stong ba nyid lhag par mos pa'i phyir slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa ma yin pa rnam par dag pa ston to //
translated: This shows the purity of neither learner nor nonlearner, because of conviction in emptiness.

original: de yi tshul khrims de ni mnyam pa med pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba ni slob pa la sogs pa gsum rnam par dag pas tshul khrims dang 'dra ba'am /
analyzed: de yi tshul khrims de ni mnyam pa med pa'o // zhes bya ba ni slob pa la sogs pa gsum rnam par dag pas tshul khrims dang 'dra ba'am /
translated: His morality is unequaled.

original: lhag pa med pa'i phyir bla na med pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: lhag pa med pa'i phyir bla na med pa nyid du ston to //
translated: This shows it to be unexcelled because there is no morality equal to or greater than the three of the learner, etc.

original: tshul khrims la ni gnas nas ting nge 'dzin kyang thob /
analyzed: tshul khrims la ni gnas nas ting nge 'dzin kyang thob /
translated: Having taken up morality, he attains concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams thob nas shes rab shin tu bsgom //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams thob nas shes rab shin tu bsgom //
translated: Having attained concentration, he cultivates wisdom.

original: shes rab kyis ni ye shes rnam par dag pa 'thob //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni ye shes rnam par dag pa 'thob //
translated: Through wisdom, he attains the purity of knowledge.

original: ye shes rnam par dag pas tshul khrims phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: ye shes rnam par dag pas tshul khrims phun sum tshogs //
translated: And through the purity of intuition, morality is perfected.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu pa ni thog ma dang tha mar rnam par dag pa las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu pa ni thog ma dang tha mar rnam par dag pa las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
translated: These ten verses beginning with the first one should be understood as teaching the purity of the beginning and the end.🔽Therein,

original: de la / tshul khrims la ni gnas nas ting nge 'dzin kyang thob //
analyzed: de la / tshul khrims la ni gnas nas ting nge 'dzin kyang thob //
translated: Having taken up morality, one attains concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams thob nas shes rab shin tu bsgom //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams thob nas shes rab shin tu bsgom //
translated: Having attained concentration, one cultivates wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the teaching.

original: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims thob pa ni tshul khrims thob pa rnam par dag par ston /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims thob pa ni tshul khrims thob pa rnam par dag par ston /
translated: The attainment of morality pleasing to the noble is the purity of the attainment of morality.

original: shes rab kyis ni ye shes rnam par dag pa 'thob //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni ye shes rnam par dag pa 'thob //
translated: Through wisdom, one attains the purity of intuition.

original: ye shes rnam par dag pas tshul khrims phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: ye shes rnam par dag pas tshul khrims phun sum tshogs //
translated: And through the purity of intuition, morality is perfected.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims 'thob pa na tha mar tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ston to /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims 'thob pa na tha mar tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ston to /
translated: This is the teaching of the purity of morality at the end, when one attains morality pleasing to the noble.

original: tshigs su bcad pa mngon par sgrub pa 'di gsungs pa'i tshe dge slong brgyad brgyan len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //🔽srog chags stong phrag sum cu rtsa gnyis ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma med pa rnam par dag go zhes bya ba ni de ltar gdams ngag 'di nges par 'byung ba don chen por bstan nas da ni mi slob pa dang /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa mngon par sgrub pa 'di gsungs pa'i tshe dge slong brgyad brgyan len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo // srog chags stong phrag sum cu rtsa gnyis ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma med pa rnam par dag go zhes bya ba ni de ltar gdams ngag 'di nges par 'byung ba don chen por bstan nas da ni mi slob pa dang /
translated: At the time when this verse was uttered, the minds of eight hundred monks were liberated from the defilements without further clinging.🔽Thirty-two thousand living beings purified the dust-free, stainless Dharma-eye in regard to phenomena.

original: slob pa thob pa'i phyir 'dul ba rnams kyi 'bras bu don chen po ston to //
analyzed: slob pa thob pa'i phyir 'dul ba rnams kyi 'bras bu don chen po ston to //
translated: Thus, having taught the great purpose of the going forth through this instruction, now, in order to demonstrate the great purpose of the result of the training for those who have attained the state of no-more-learning and the state of learning,🔽he says, “Five hundred monks who had attained meditative concentration rose from their seats and departed.”

original: dge slong bsam gtan thob pa lnga brgya stan las langs nas dong ngo zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyis 'dul ba dka' ba don chen por ston to //
analyzed: dge slong bsam gtan thob pa lnga brgya stan las langs nas dong ngo zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyis 'dul ba dka' ba don chen por ston to //
translated: This shows the great purpose of the difficulty of training.

original: chos bstan pa zab mo 'di la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos bstan pa zab mo 'di la mi 'jug ste /
translated: They do not enter into this profound teaching of the Dharma.🔽They do not understand, they do not have faith.

original: ma rtogs ma mos zhes bya ba la rnam pa gnyis kyis mi 'jug ste ;
analyzed: ma rtogs ma mos zhes bya ba la rnam pa gnyis kyis mi 'jug ste ;
translated: There are two ways in which they do not enter.

original: ma rtog pa na dad pas chos la mi mos pa dang / ma mos na shes rab kyis don mi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma rtog pa na dad pas chos la mi mos pa dang / ma mos na shes rab kyis don mi rtogs pa'o //
translated: If one does not understand, one will not be interested in the Dharma out of faith. If one is not interested, one will not understand the meaning through wisdom.

original: @262b de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa 'od srungs chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: @262b de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa 'od srungs chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Mahākāśyapa said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das dge slong bsam gtan thob pa lnga brgya po 'di dag chos bstan pa 'di la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge slong bsam gtan thob pa lnga brgya po 'di dag chos bstan pa 'di la mi 'jug ste /
translated: “Blessed One, these five hundred monks who have attained meditative concentration do not engage with this teaching of the Dharma.

original: ma rtogs ma mos nas stan las langs te mchis so //
analyzed: ma rtogs ma mos nas stan las langs te mchis so //
translated: Not understanding and not being interested, they have risen from their seats and departed.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: 'od srungs 'di ltar dge slong mngon pa'i nga rgyal can 'di dag ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa zag pa med pa 'di la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di ltar dge slong mngon pa'i nga rgyal can 'di dag ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa zag pa med pa 'di la mi 'jug ste /
translated: “Kāśyapa, in this way, these monks who are full of conceit do not engage with this pure and undefiled moral discipline.

original: ma rtogs ma mos so //
analyzed: ma rtogs ma mos so //
translated: They do not understand and are not interested.

original: 'od srungs tshigs su bcad pa mngon par sgrub pa zab ces bya ba ni don shes par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs tshigs su bcad pa mngon par sgrub pa zab ces bya ba ni don shes par dka' ba'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, the profound accomplishment of verses is said to be difficult to understand.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi byang chub zab ces bya ba ni dgongs pa shes par dka'o ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi byang chub zab ces bya ba ni dgongs pa shes par dka'o ;
translated: The profound enlightenment of the Blessed Buddhas is said to be difficult to understand.”

original: / dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskrun pa sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs su zin pa dang / ma dad pa mang ba dag gis mos par mi nus so zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs su zin pa dang / ma dad pa mang bas dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: / dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskrun pa sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs su zin pa dang / ma dad pa mang ba dag gis mos par mi nus so zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs su zin pa dang / ma dad pa mang bas dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun par rig par bya'o //
translated: Those who have not planted the roots of virtue, who are controlled by bad friends, and who have much lack of faith are not able to believe.

original: 'od srungs dge slong lnga brgya po 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs kyi gsung rab la gzhan mu stegs can gyi nyan thos su gyur te /
analyzed: 'od srungs dge slong lnga brgya po 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs kyi gsung rab la gzhan mu stegs can gyi nyan thos su gyur te /
translated: Kāśyapa, these five hundred monks were the disciples of the tīrthikas in the teachings of the Tathāgata Kāśyapa.

original: de dag de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs las brgal ba'i bsam pas chos bstan pa gcig thos so //
analyzed: de dag de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs las brgal ba'i bsam pas chos bstan pa gcig thos so //
translated: They heard a single Dharma teaching from the Tathāgata Kāśyapa, with the intention of refuting it.

original: thos nas dad pa'i sems gcig snyed de /
analyzed: thos nas dad pa'i sems gcig snyed de /
translated: Having heard it, they generated a single thought of faith.

original: de 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srungs kyis 'jam zhing snyan par gsungs pa ngo mtshar to zhes de dag dad pa'i sems gcig snyed pa sems des 'chi ba'i dus byas nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha🔽rnams kyi nang du skyes so //
analyzed: de 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srungs kyis 'jam zhing snyan par gsungs pa ngo mtshar to zhes de dag dad pa'i sems gcig snyed pa sems des 'chi ba'i dus byas nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skyes so //
translated: The Thus-Gone, the Worthy, the Perfect Buddha Kāśyapa spoke so gently and pleasantly. How amazing!” With that single thought of faith, they died and were reborn among the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: rgyu de nyid kyis 'dir nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: rgyu de nyid kyis 'dir nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung ste /
translated: Because of that cause, they have now gone forth in my teachings.

original: 'od srungs dge slong lnga brgya po lta ba la chags pa 'di dag chos bstan pa zab mo 'di la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs dge slong lnga brgya po lta ba la chags pa 'di dag chos bstan pa zab mo 'di la mi 'jug ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, these five hundred monks are attached to their views and do not engage with this profound teaching of the Dharma.

original: mi rtogs mi mos so //
analyzed: mi rtogs mi mos so //
translated: They do not understand it and do not have faith in it.

original: yang 'di dag ni bstan pa 'dis yongs su sbyang ba byas te /
analyzed: yang 'di dag ni bstan pa 'dis yongs su sbyang ba byas te /
translated: However, they have been refined by this teaching.

original: phyis ngan 'gro log par ltung bar 'gro bar mi 'gyur zhing phung po 'di dag nyid kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: phyis ngan 'gro log par ltung bar 'gro bar mi 'gyur zhing phung po 'di dag nyid kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: Later, they will not go to the lower realms, but will attain nirvāṇa with these very aggregates.”🔽“

original: slob dpon chos kyi bdag pos tshigs su bcad pa'i don bstan pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: slob dpon chos kyi bdag pos tshigs su bcad pa'i don bstan pa las brtsams te /
translated: The Master Dharmapala, beginning with the explanation of the meaning of the verse,

original: gzhan du rnam grangs gzhan gyis brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan du rnam grangs gzhan gyis brjod do //
translated: states it in another way.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gong ma'i don tshigs su bcad pa phyi ma phyi mas mngon par sgrub ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gong ma'i don tshigs su bcad pa phyi ma phyi mas mngon par sgrub ste /
translated: The meaning of the preceding verse is established by the following verse.

original: 'dren pas tshigs su bcad pa mngon par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dren pas tshigs su bcad pa mngon par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the establishment of the verse by the Master.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni nyes pa gzhi dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa rnam par dag par @263a * //
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni nyes pa gzhi dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa rnam par dag par @263a * //
translated: In this regard, the first verse teaches the purity of the training in superior morality because it abandons faults together with their basis.🔽The second verse teaches the purity of the training in superior mind because it abandons the faults of the mind together with their basis.

original: yongs su ston to //
analyzed: yongs su ston to //
translated: The verse says:

original: tshul khrims ldan la dri ma med cing ci yang med //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: tshul khrims ldan la dri ma med cing ci yang med // ces bya ba la /
translated: The moral person is stainless and has nothing.

original: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: dri ma ni nyes pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma ni nyes pa'o //
translated: Faults are stains.

original: ci yang ni nyes pa'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: ci yang ni nyes pa'i gzhi'o //
translated: The basis of faults is nothing.

original: tshul khrims ldan la rgyags pa med de brten pa med //
analyzed: tshul khrims ldan la rgyags pa med de brten pa med //
translated: The moral person is not intoxicated and is not dependent.

original: ces bya ba ni ro myong ba gzhi dang bcas pa spangs pas lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa rnam par dag par yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni ro myong ba gzhi dang bcas pa spangs pas lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa rnam par dag par yongs su bstan te /
translated: This verse shows the purity of the training in superior mind, through the abandonment of indulgence together with its basis.

original: rgyags pa ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: rgyags pa ni bzhi'o //
translated: There are four kinds of intoxication.

original: gnas pa ni ro myang ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni ro myang ba'o //
translated: Dwelling is indulgence.

original: tshul khrims ldan la mun pa med de 'ching ba med /
analyzed: tshul khrims ldan la mun pa med de 'ching ba med /
translated: The moral person has no darkness, no bondage.

original: ces bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa gzhi dang bcas pa spangs pas lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa gzhi dang bcas pa spangs pas lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: This verse shows the purity of the training in superior wisdom, through the abandonment of action and affliction together with their basis.

original: mun pa ni ma rig pa'i bdag nyid do ;
analyzed: mun pa ni ma rig pa'i bdag nyid do ;
translated: Darkness is the nature of nescience.

original: /'ching ba ni las te gzhi'o //
analyzed: /'ching ba ni las te gzhi'o //
translated: Bondage is action, which is the basis.

original: tshul khrims ldan la rdul rnams med de nyes pa med //
analyzed: tshul khrims ldan la rdul rnams med de nyes pa med //
translated: The moral person has no dust, no fault.

original: ces bya ba la rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid ni rdul lo //
analyzed: ces bya ba la rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid ni rdul lo //
translated: Dust is the nature of discursive thought.

original: nyes pa ni nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: nyes pa ni nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Fault is affliction.

original: nyon mongs ni gzhi'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs ni gzhi'o //
translated: Affliction is the basis.🔽What is the benefit of the purity of these three trainings?

original: bslab pa 'di gsum rnam par dag na legs pa ci zhig tu 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: bslab pa 'di gsum rnam par dag na legs pa ci zhig tu 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: The verse says,

original: zhi ba rab tu zhi ba nye bar zhi ba'i yid ;
analyzed: zhi ba rab tu zhi ba nye bar zhi ba'i yid ;
translated: The mind of peace, of perfect peace, of utter peace,

original: / ces bya ba gsungs te /🔽sdug bsngal ldog pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: / ces bya ba gsungs te / sdug bsngal ldog pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Thus he spoke.

original: sdug bsngal gsum ni ngan song gi sdug bsngal dang / shes pa la sgrib pa'i sdug bsngal dang / skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum ni ngan song gi sdug bsngal dang / shes pa la sgrib pa'i sdug bsngal dang / skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The three sufferings are the suffering of the unfortunate realms, the suffering of the obscurations to knowledge, and the suffering of birth, etc.

original: bslab pa pa rnam par dag pa legs pa dang bcas pa 'di ji ltar thob snyam pa la /
analyzed: bslab pa pa rnam par dag pa legs pa dang bcas pa 'di ji ltar thob snyam pa la /
translated: How is this pure training with its excellence attained?

original: rtog dang rnam par rtog dang bral zhing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rtog dang rnam par rtog dang bral zhing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He said, “Free from conceptualization and discrimination. ”

original: phyi rol gyi rnam par rag pa mtshan ma rnam par rig pa tsam du 'dzin pas rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rnam par rag pa mtshan ma rnam par rig pa tsam du 'dzin pas rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Free from conceptualization means that one does not grasp external images as signs.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam de la yang mi 'dzin pas rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam de la yang mi 'dzin pas rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: Free from discrimination means that one does not grasp even the mere representation of the object.

original: mi dmigs pas de'i thabs yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: mi dmigs pas de'i thabs yongs su bstan to //
translated: Non-apprehension is taught as the means to that.

original: bslab pa rnam par dag pa legs pa dang bcas pa de yod par ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: bslab pa rnam par dag pa legs pa dang bcas pa de yod par ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How is the existence of that pure training with its excellence to be known?

original: de ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
translated: It is the absence of afflictions when not in meditative equipoise.

original: sdig pa 'dod pa'i nye bar spyod pa med pas nyon mongs pa med pa'i mdo sde bzhin no //
analyzed: sdig pa 'dod pa'i nye bar spyod pa med pas nyon mongs pa med pa'i mdo sde bzhin no //
translated: It is the absence of afflictions because there is no enjoyment of evil. It is like the sutra of the absence of afflictions.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i dus na ni g-yo ba dang rlom sems kun dang rnam par bral ba zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i dus na ni g-yo ba dang rlom sems kun dang rnam par bral ba zhes bya'o ;
translated: When in meditative equipoise, it is free from all movement and conceit.

original: / de ni tshul khrims ldan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / de ni tshul khrims ldan zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is called “endowed with morality” because

original: tshul khrims ni bslab pa gsum goms par byed pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni bslab pa gsum goms par byed pa ste /
translated: morality is the cultivation of the three trainings.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims su bzhed de /
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims su bzhed de /
translated: This is accepted as morality.

original: bslab pa gsum rnam par dag pa'i legs pa dang / thabs dang rtags yongs su bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa'i don 'di ni tshigs su bcad pa snga ma mngon par @263b sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa gsum rnam par dag pa'i legs pa dang / thabs dang rtags yongs su bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa'i don 'di ni tshigs su bcad pa snga ma mngon par @263b sgrub pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this verse is established by the previous verse, in order to demonstrate the excellence of the purification of the three trainings, the method, and the signs.

original: zhi ba rab tu zhi ba nye bar zhi ba'i yid //
analyzed: zhi ba rab tu zhi ba nye bar zhi ba'i yid //
translated: The mind of peace, complete peace, and utter peace

original: ces bya ba de ni lus la lta ba dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba de ni lus la lta ba dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: is not associated with the view of the body.

original: gang lta ba ni thob pa dang bkur sti la mngon par brtson par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang lta ba ni thob pa dang bkur sti la mngon par brtson par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whoever is intent on gain and honor will have a view.🔽He does not hold life dear.

original: srog la phangs par 'dzin mi byed ces bya ba la gang phangs par 'dzin pa ni rnam par rtog pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: srog la phangs par 'dzin mi byed ces bya ba la gang phangs par 'dzin pa ni rnam par rtog pa la gnas nas /
translated: Whoever holds life dear, having taken up a conceptual position,

original: bsam gtan gyi ro myong bar byed cing dus ring por dge ba'i chos bsgom pa la mi brtson par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi ro myong bar byed cing dus ring por dge ba'i chos bsgom pa la mi brtson par 'gyur ro //
translated: will experience the taste of meditation and will not be intent on cultivating wholesome dharmas for a long time.

original: srid par skye ba kun la gnod pa med //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: srid par skye ba kun la gnod pa med // ces bya ba la /
translated: He is not harmed by any rebirth in existence.

original: gang 'dod pa ni smon nas tshangs par spyad pa spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa ni smon nas tshangs par spyad pa spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whoever wishes will practice celibacy through aspiration.

original: de la ni mngon par brtson pa'i nyes pa dang / mngon par mi brtson pa'i nyes pa dang / smon nas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa'i nyes pa ste /
analyzed: de la ni mngon par brtson pa'i nyes pa dang / mngon par mi brtson pa'i nyes pa dang / smon nas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa'i nyes pa ste /
translated: There are three faults: the fault of being intent, the fault of not being intent, and the fault of abiding in celibacy through aspiration.

original: nyes pa gsum med do //
analyzed: nyes pa gsum med do //
translated: He is free from these three faults.

original: rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: He is rightly engaged, being free from conceptual thoughts and discriminations.

original: nyon mongs pa med pas yang dag pa'i tshul la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pas yang dag pa'i tshul la gnas pa yin no //
translated: He abides in the right way, being free from afflictions.

original: gang lus la lta ba dang bcas pas ma yin pa de ni phyi rol gyi 'jig rten nye bar gzung ste /
analyzed: gang lus la lta ba dang bcas pas ma yin pa de ni phyi rol gyi 'jig rten nye bar gzung ste /
translated: He who is not attached to the body, he takes hold of the external world.

original: 'jig rten gyis mi gos so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis mi gos so //
translated: He is not defiled by the world.

original: gang srog la phangs par mi 'dzin pa de ni nang gi 'jig rten nye bar gzung ste /
analyzed: gang srog la phangs par mi 'dzin pa de ni nang gi 'jig rten nye bar gzung ste /
translated: He who does not cling to life, he takes hold of the internal world.

original: 'jig rten la mi gnas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten la mi gnas so //
translated: He does not dwell in the world.

original: gang srid par skye ba thams cad mi 'dod pa de ni srid par skye ba thams cad yongs su shes pas snang ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: gang srid par skye ba thams cad mi 'dod pa de ni srid par skye ba thams cad yongs su shes pas snang ba thob pa'o //
translated: He who does not desire any rebirth in existence, he attains the light of the knowledge of all rebirths in existence.

original: gang yang dag par zhugs pa de bdag gi ba med do //
analyzed: gang yang dag par zhugs pa de bdag gi ba med do //
translated: He who is rightly engaged, he has no possessions.

original: yang dag pa'i tshul khrims pa de ci yang med do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i tshul khrims pa de ci yang med do //
translated: He who has right morality, he has nothing.

original: ji ltar ci yang med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar ci yang med ce na /
translated: How does he have nothing?

original: bdag tu 'du shes med cing gzhan du 'du shes med //
analyzed: bdag tu 'du shes med cing gzhan du 'du shes med //
translated: He has no perception of self and no perception of other.

original: ces bya ba dang / 'du shes yongs su shes so //
analyzed: ces bya ba dang / 'du shes yongs su shes so //
translated: He knows perception.

original: gang 'jig rten ma gos 'jig rten dag la gnas pa med pa de'i ma 'ongs pa na pha rol dang / tshu rol dang dbus te /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten ma gos 'jig rten dag la gnas pa med pa de'i ma 'ongs pa na pha rol dang / tshu rol dang dbus te /
translated: He who is not defiled by the world, who does not dwell in the world, for him there is no far shore, no near shore, no middle.

original: nang dang phyi'i skye mched dag la dga' ba can gyi 'dod chags kyis bsdus pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i skye mched dag la dga' ba can gyi 'dod chags kyis bsdus pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is free from the attachment that is included in the internal and external sense-spheres.

original: tshe 'di la nang gi skye mched dang / phyi'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa la tshu rol dang / pha rol la ma chags so //
analyzed: tshe 'di la nang gi skye mched dang / phyi'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa la tshu rol dang / pha rol la ma chags so //
translated: In this life, he is not attached to the internal and external sense-spheres, nor to this shore or the further shore.

original: gang snang ba thob pa de ma bcings so //
analyzed: gang snang ba thob pa de ma bcings so //
translated: He who has attained the visible is not bound.

original: gang bdag gi ba med pa ni mi chags so //
analyzed: gang bdag gi ba med pa ni mi chags so //
translated: He who is without “mine” is not attached.

original: gang ci yang med pa de ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pas tshul 'chos pa med do //
analyzed: gang ci yang med pa de ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pas tshul 'chos pa med do //
translated: He who is without anything at all is without hypocrisy, because he is without conceit.

original: dgra bcom pa thob pas zag pa med do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa thob pas zag pa med do //
translated: He is without the contaminants, because he has attained Arhatship.

original: ming dang gzugs rnams la ni chags pa med //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs rnams la ni chags pa med //
translated: He is without attachment to name-and-form.

original: ces bya ba ni ji ltar de tshu rol dang / pha rol dang / dbus med pa dang / pha rol dang tshu rol nas kyang chags pa med ces bya ba de ston to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni ji ltar de tshu rol dang / pha rol dang / dbus med pa dang / pha rol dang tshu rol nas kyang chags pa med ces bya ba de ston to //
translated: This shows how he is without this shore, the further shore, and the middle, and how he is without attachment to the further shore and this shore.

original: de ni mnyam par gzhag ces bya ba ni de bcings pa @264a * //🔽dang chags pa med pa de ston to //
analyzed: de ni mnyam par gzhag ces bya ba ni de bcings pa @264a * //🔽dang chags pa med pa de ston to //
translated: He is “equipoised” means that he is without bondage and attachment.

original: shin tu dul ba'i sems zhes bya ba ni ji ltar de tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / zag pa med pa de ston to //
analyzed: shin tu dul ba'i sems zhes bya ba ni ji ltar de tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / zag pa med pa de ston to //
translated: The phrase “a well-tamed mind” shows that he is free of hypocrisy and free of the outflows.

original: ji ltar shin tu dul ba'i sems zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar shin tu dul ba'i sems zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How is it that he has a well-tamed mind?

original: gang la bdag med bdag gir 'dzin pa med //
analyzed: gang la bdag med bdag gir 'dzin pa med //
translated: He has no self and no grasping at self.

original: ces bya'o // de ltar 'gyur bas de go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: ces bya'o // de ltar 'gyur bas de go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The verse should be connected with these terms in the same order.

original: so sor thar pa slob pa rlom sems byed pa med //
analyzed: so sor thar pa slob pa rlom sems byed pa med //
translated: The one who is training in the vow of individual liberation has no pride.

original: des ni 'di na de la chags par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: des ni 'di na de la chags par mi 'gyur te //
translated: He does not become attached to it in this life.

original: de yi gong du 'phags pa'i lam rnams tshol byed pa //
analyzed: de yi gong du 'phags pa'i lam rnams tshol byed pa //
translated: He seeks the noble paths that are beyond it.

original: zhes bya ba ni yon tan bye brag can mngon par sgrub pa'i phyir 'phags pa rnams kyis lam gang yin pa de yongs su tshol lo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yon tan bye brag can mngon par sgrub pa'i phyir 'phags pa rnams kyis lam gang yin pa de yongs su tshol lo //
translated: Because he is seeking to achieve a special quality, he seeks the path that is taught by the noble ones.

original: de nyid kyis don gsal bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyis don gsal bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he is clarifying that very meaning,

original: tshul khrims gtso bor ma yin ting 'dzin der chags med //
analyzed: tshul khrims gtso bor ma yin ting 'dzin der chags med //
translated: he does not value morality, and he is not attached to meditative absorption.

original: de yi gong du shes rab bsgom pa yongs su tshol //
analyzed: de yi gong du shes rab bsgom pa yongs su tshol //
translated: He seeks the cultivation of wisdom that is beyond those two.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The verse says this.

original: shes rab bsgom pa ji lta bu snyam pa la /
analyzed: shes rab bsgom pa ji lta bu snyam pa la /
translated: How does one cultivate wisdom?

original: dmigs pa med pa 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs yin te //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs yin te // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The noble ones’ lineage is without reference points.

original: ji ltar tshul khrims gtso bor ma yin snyam pa la //🔽'jig pa'i tshogs la lta las rnam par grol ba'i yid //
analyzed: ji ltar tshul khrims gtso bor ma yin snyam pa la // 'jig pa'i tshogs la lta las rnam par grol ba'i yid //
translated: How is it that morality is not primary?

original: ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The mind is liberated from the view of the transitory collection.

original: ci'i phyir ting nge 'dzin der chags pa med ce na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir ting nge 'dzin der chags pa med ce na //
translated: Why is there no attachment to that samādhi?

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba de nyid spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba de nyid spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that very view of the transitory collection is abandoned.

original: ting nge 'dzin de la ni 'dir nga dang nga yi snyam du 'gyur ba med pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la ni 'dir nga dang nga yi snyam du 'gyur ba med pa'o //
translated: In that samādhi, there is no thought of “I” or “mine.”

original: ji ltar dmigs pa med pa yongs su tshol snyam pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar dmigs pa med pa yongs su tshol snyam pa la /
translated: How does one search for the absence of reference points?

original: sangs rgyas spyod yul stong pa nyid la lhag par mos //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas spyod yul stong pa nyid la lhag par mos // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: One has conviction in emptiness, the domain of the buddhas.

original: go rims gang gis 'jig tshogs la lta ba rnam par grol ba'i yid du 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: go rims gang gis 'jig tshogs la lta ba rnam par grol ba'i yid du 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: In what sequence does the mind become liberated from the view of the transitory collection?

original: tshul khrims la ni gnas nas ting nge 'dzin kyang thob //
analyzed: tshul khrims la ni gnas nas ting nge 'dzin kyang thob //
translated: One who abides in morality attains samādhi.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams thob nas shes rab shin tu sgom //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams thob nas shes rab shin tu sgom // zhes gsungs te /
translated: Having attained the meditative concentrations, he cultivates wisdom.

original: nges par rtogs pa'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'i shes rab kyis ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par rtogs pa'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'i shes rab kyis ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the side of definite understanding, wisdom becomes the pure supramundane intuition.

original: ye shes rnam par dag pas tshul khrims phun sum tshogs so //
analyzed: ye shes rnam par dag pas tshul khrims phun sum tshogs so //
translated: By the purity of intuition, morality is perfect.

original: de ltar na tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni bslab pa gsum rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni bslab pa gsum rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Thus, the first verse shows the purity of the three educations.

original: lhag ma rnams kyi tshigs su bcad pa phyi ma phyi ma'i don 'dren pas bslab pa gsum rnam par dag par mngon par sgrub pa yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyi tshigs su bcad pa phyi ma phyi ma'i don 'dren pas bslab pa gsum rnam par dag par mngon par sgrub pa yongs su bstan to //
translated: The remaining verses show the accomplishment of the three educations in their purity, by the meaning of the following verses.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa rnam par dag pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa rnam par dag pa las brtsams te /
translated: Purity of the Cultivation of the Factors of Enlightenment

original: rnam grangs gzhan du'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan du'o //
translated: Another enumeration of the perfections is given in the next verse.

original: lus dang ngag gi las nyes par spyod pa gzhi dang bcas pa spangs pa lus dran pa nye @264b par gzhag pa bsgom pa rnam par dag pa dang / tshor ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i ro myang ba spangs bas tshor ba dran pa nya bar gzhag pa bsgom pa rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las nyes par spyod pa gzhi dang bcas pa spangs pa lus dran pa nye @264b par gzhag pa bsgom pa rnam par dag pa dang / tshor ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i ro myang ba spangs bas tshor ba dran pa nya bar gzhag pa bsgom pa rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: The cultivation of mindfulness of feeling is pure by abandoning the enjoyment of the taste of grasping.🔽The cultivation of mindfulness of mind is pure by abandoning ignorance and the formative forces.

original: ma rig pa dang 'du byed spangs pas sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa rnam par dag pa dang / dge ba'i chos rnams la nga dang nga'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi chos spangs pa'i phyir chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa rnam par dag pa yongs su ston to //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'du byed spangs pas sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa rnam par dag pa dang / dge ba'i chos rnams la nga dang nga'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi chos spangs pa'i phyir chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa rnam par dag pa yongs su ston to //
translated: The cultivation of mindfulness of dharmas is pure by abandoning the concepts of ‘I’ and ‘mine’ in regard to wholesome dharmas and by abandoning defiled dharmas.

original: zhi bas ni yang dag pa'i spong ba bsgom pa dang po rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: zhi bas ni yang dag pa'i spong ba bsgom pa dang po rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: By means of peace, the first of the correct exertions is pure.

original: rab tu zhi bas ni gnyis pa'o //🔽nye bar zhi ba'i yid /
analyzed: rab tu zhi bas ni gnyis pa'o //🔽nye bar zhi ba'i yid /
translated: By means of complete peace, the second is pure.🔽By means of complete tranquility, the third is pure.🔽By means of the absence of mental activity, the fourth is pure.

original: rtog dang rnam par rtog dang bral zhing nyon mongs med //
analyzed: rtog dang rnam par rtog dang bral zhing nyon mongs med //
translated: Free from conceptualization and discursive thought, free from afflictions.

original: ces bya bas ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya bas ni gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third.

original: g-yo ba dang ni rlom sems kun dang rnam bral ba //
analyzed: g-yo ba dang ni rlom sems kun dang rnam bral ba //
translated: Free from all movements and presumptive conceptions.

original: zhes bya bas ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth.

original: lus la mi lta srog la phangs par 'dzin mi byed //
analyzed: lus la mi lta srog la phangs par 'dzin mi byed //
translated: Not concerned with the body, not holding life dear,

original: srid pa rnams su skye ba kun la 'dod pa med //
analyzed: srid pa rnams su skye ba kun la 'dod pa med //
translated: Not desiring any rebirth in existence.

original: ces bya bas ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rtags te ;
analyzed: ces bya bas ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rtags te ;
translated: This is the sign of the concentration of the bases of supernatural power.

original: des na thob pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa ma yin dge bar sbyor ba la mi brtson pa ma yin /
analyzed: des na thob pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa ma yin dge bar sbyor ba la mi brtson pa ma yin /
translated: Therefore, he is not desirous of gain and honor, not averse to the practice of virtue,

original: yang srid pa la chags pa ma yin /
analyzed: yang srid pa la chags pa ma yin /
translated: Not attached to renewed existence.

original: yang dag par zhugs pa ni mos pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa bzhis yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par zhugs pa ni mos pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa bzhis yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who is rightly engaged is applied to the four right efforts by means of the four kinds of concentration such as will, etc.

original: yang dag pa'i tshul la gnas pa ni spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i tshul la gnas pa ni spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who is established in the right way is endowed with the applications of abandoning.

original: 'jig rten mi gos pa ni dad pa'i dbang pos mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan la mngon par yid ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten mi gos pa ni dad pa'i dbang pos mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan la mngon par yid ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The world does not stain him, because of the faculty of faith, since he has full confidence in the virtues of nirvana.

original: 'jig rten dag na gnas pa med pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na gnas pa med pa ni /
translated: He does not dwell in the world,

original: brtson 'grus kyi dbang pos da ltar byung ba'i yul rnams la'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi dbang pos da ltar byung ba'i yul rnams la'o //
translated: because of the faculty of vigor, since he is not attached to the objects of the present.

original: snang ba thob cing bdag med de ci yang med pa ni dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang ; shes rab kyi dbang po rnams kyis so //
analyzed: snang ba thob cing bdag med de ci yang med pa ni dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang ; shes rab kyi dbang po rnams kyis so //
translated: He has attained the light, and is without self and without anything, because of the faculties of mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: bdag tu 'du shes med cing gzhan du 'du shes med /
analyzed: bdag tu 'du shes med cing gzhan du 'du shes med /
translated: He has no notion of self, and no notion of other.

original: 'du shes yongs su shes pas zhes bya bas ni ci yang med pa nyid ston to //
analyzed: 'du shes yongs su shes pas zhes bya bas ni ci yang med pa nyid ston to //
translated: By the phrase “he has full knowledge of notion,” he shows that there is nothing at all.

original: gang la tshu rol med cing pha rol dbus kyang med //
analyzed: gang la tshu rol med cing pha rol dbus kyang med //
translated: Where there is no near shore, no far shore, and no middle,

original: ces bya ba ni dad pa'i stobs kyis ma 'ongs pa na de mi 'jigs par 'dod pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni dad pa'i stobs kyis ma 'ongs pa na de mi 'jigs par 'dod pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: This shows that he is without fear in the future, because of the power of faith.

original: tshu rol pha rol dag la nams kyang mi chags shing //
analyzed: tshu rol pha rol dag la nams kyang mi chags shing //
translated: He is never attached to near or far,

original: zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis da ltar byung ba rnams la ma chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis da ltar byung ba rnams la ma chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because of non-attachment to present things through the power of effort.

original: bcings pa med pa chags pa med pa ni dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs so //
analyzed: bcings pa med pa chags pa med pa ni dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs so //
translated: The mind is unfettered and unattached through the power of mindfulness and samadhi.

original: tshul 'chos pa med cing zag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi stobs @265a * //
analyzed: tshul 'chos pa med cing zag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi stobs @265a * //
translated: It is without hypocrisy and without defilement through the power of wisdom.

original: kyis so // nges par rtogs pa'i phyogs rnams kyis zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyis so // nges par rtogs pa'i phyogs rnams kyis zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the realization of the factors of enlightenment, there is no defilement.

original: ming dang gzugs rnams las ni chags pa med pa'i yid //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs rnams las ni chags pa med pa'i yid //
translated: The mind is unattached to name-and-form

original: ces bya bas ni byang chub kyi yan lag 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya bas ni byang chub kyi yan lag 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of attaining the supramundane path of the factors of enlightenment.

original: de ni mnyam par gzhag ces bya ba ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mnyam par gzhag ces bya ba ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is in meditative equipoise because of attaining the factor of enlightenment of right mindfulness.

original: shin tu dul ba'i sems ni byang chub kyi yan lag lhag ma rnams kyis so //
analyzed: shin tu dul ba'i sems ni byang chub kyi yan lag lhag ma rnams kyis so //
translated: The mind is well-tamed through the remaining factors of enlightenment.

original: so sor thar la slob pa rlom sems byed pa med //
analyzed: so sor thar la slob pa rlom sems byed pa med //
translated: One who trains in the pratimoksha does not have pride.

original: ces bya ba ni yang dag par lta ba'i lam gyi yan lag thob pas chos nyid kyis thob pa'i tshul khrims rab tu thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni yang dag par lta ba'i lam gyi yan lag thob pas chos nyid kyis thob pa'i tshul khrims rab tu thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because, by obtaining the branch of the path that is right view, one obtains morality that is obtained by the Dharma itself.

original: des ni 'di na de la chags par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: des ni 'di na de la chags par mi 'gyur te //
translated: One does not become attached to it here.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyis so sor thar pa'i bslab pa rgyun gcad pa'i phyir ro //
