analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyis so sor thar pa'i bslab pa rgyun gcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because, by the Dharma itself, one cuts off the training in the code of morality.

original: de yi gang du 'phags pa'i lam rnams tshol byed pa //
analyzed: de yi gang du 'phags pa'i lam rnams tshol byed pa //
translated: One who seeks the noble paths there

original: zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rtog pa rnams kyis yang dag pa'i lta bar rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rtog pa rnams kyis yang dag pa'i lta bar rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because, by the correct thoughts, one establishes right view.

original: tshul khrims gtso bor ma yin pa ni yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba'i lam gyi yan lag thob pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshul khrims gtso bor ma yin pa ni yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba'i lam gyi yan lag thob pa'i phyir te /
translated: One who does not make morality primary obtains the branches of the path that are right speech, right action, and right livelihood,

original: de las gzhan pa'i tshul khrims ni rlom sems med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i tshul khrims ni rlom sems med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is without conceit about morality that is other than that.

original: ting nge 'dzin der chags med ces bya ba ni de'i 'gyod pa med pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis skyes pa bsam gtan gyi ro myang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin der chags med ces bya ba ni de'i 'gyod pa med pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis skyes pa bsam gtan gyi ro myang ba med pa'o //
translated: The concentration called “unattached” is the absence of relishing the taste of the meditative absorptions that arise in sequence, beginning with the absence of regret about that.

original: de'i gong du shes rab bsgom pa yongs su tshol ba ni yang dag pa'i rtsol bas so //🔽'jig pa'i tshogs la lta las rnam par grol ba'i yid //
analyzed: de'i gong du shes rab bsgom pa yongs su tshol ba ni yang dag pa'i rtsol bas so // 'jig pa'i tshogs la lta las rnam par grol ba'i yid //
translated: The search for the cultivation of wisdom above that is by right effort.🔽The verse says, “The mind is liberated from the view of the perishable collection.”

original: ces bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni yang dag pa'i dran pas so //
analyzed: ces bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni yang dag pa'i dran pas so //
translated: This is by right mindfulness.

original: tshul khrims la ni gnas nas ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob //
analyzed: tshul khrims la ni gnas nas ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob //
translated: The verse says, “Having abided in morality, one attains concentration.”

original: ces bya ba ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is by right concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams thob nas shes rab shin tu bsgom //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams thob nas shes rab shin tu bsgom //
translated: The verse says, “Having attained the concentrations, one cultivates wisdom well.”

original: zhes bya ba ni kun du sbyor ba lhag ma yongs su spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun du sbyor ba lhag ma yongs su spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is for the sake of abandoning the remaining fetters.

original: shes rab kyis ni ye shes rnam par dag pa 'thob //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni ye shes rnam par dag pa 'thob //
translated: The verse says, “By wisdom, one attains the purity of knowledge.”

original: ces bya ba ni zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa mngon par sgrub pa 'dis byang chub kyi phyogs rnam par dag pa bsgom pa yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa mngon par sgrub pa 'dis byang chub kyi phyogs rnam par dag pa bsgom pa yongs su bstan to //
translated: Thus, by this composition of verses, the cultivation of the purity of the factors of enlightenment is revealed.

original: las kyi lam rnam par dag pa las brtsams nas rnam grangs gzhan du'o //
analyzed: las kyi lam rnam par dag pa las brtsams nas rnam grangs gzhan du'o //
translated: From the purity of the path of action, another enumeration is begun.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa dang / gnyen po rnam par dag pas srog gcod pa las phyir ldog pa rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa dang / gnyen po rnam par dag pas srog gcod pa las phyir ldog pa rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan to //
translated: The purity of turning away from killing is revealed by the abandonment of the opposing side and the purity of the antidote.

original: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa ni /
analyzed: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa ni /
translated: Therein, the abandonment of the opposing side is

original: srog gcod pa'i bag chags dang de'i gzhi spangs pa'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa'i bag chags dang de'i gzhi spangs pa'o //
translated: the abandonment of the latent tendencies of killing and the basis of that.

original: gnyen @265b po ni rnam par dag pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gnyen @265b po ni rnam par dag pa gsum ste /
translated: The purity of the antidote is threefold:

original: de las phyir log pa las chog mi shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / sgrib pa med pa rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par smin par nges pa yongs su mi 'dzin pas kun du sbyor ba ma lus par rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de las phyir log pa las chog mi shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / sgrib pa med pa rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par smin par nges pa yongs su mi 'dzin pas kun du sbyor ba ma lus par rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: the purity of not being satisfied with turning away from that, the purity of being free from obscurations, and the purity of the complete abandonment of fetters by not appropriating the maturation of karma.

original: ma byin par len pa'i rkyen 'jigs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang / dgra rnams spangs pa dang / rku ba dang / yongs su spyod pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa spangs pa dang / de'i gzhi'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang /🔽de ma byin par len pa'i ngal ba dang / gsad pa dang / bcing ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa spangs pa dang / de 'byor pa'i nga rgyal spangs bas ma byin par len pa las phyir ldog pa rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i rkyen 'jigs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang / dgra rnams spangs pa dang / rku ba dang / yongs su spyod pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa spangs pa dang / de'i gzhi'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / de ma byin par len pa'i ngal ba dang / gsad pa dang / bcing ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa spangs pa dang / de 'byor pa'i nga rgyal spangs bas ma byin par len pa las phyir ldog pa rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan to //
translated: The conditions for taking what is not given are fear, blame, enemies, stealing, enjoyment, formation, the afflictions that are the basis of that,🔽and the suffering of taking what is not given, killing, binding, and so on. The purity of turning away from taking what is not given is taught by abandoning pride in one's wealth.

original: spyod yul ma yin pa yongs su spong ba dang / mi sdug pa la sogs pa gnyen po bsgom pas 'dod pas log par g-yem pa las phyir ldog pa rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan to //🔽zang zing gi phyir ram /
analyzed: spyod yul ma yin pa yongs su spong ba dang / mi sdug pa la sogs pa gnyen po bsgom pas 'dod pas log par g-yem pa las phyir ldog pa rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan to // zang zing gi phyir ram /
translated: The purity of abstaining from sexual misconduct is taught by the avoidance of inappropriate sexual intercourse and by the cultivation of antidotes such as the contemplation of the unattractive nature of the body.

original: 'jigs pa'i gzhi gang gis brdzun du smra ba zer ba de spangs pa dang / de'i gnyen por thos pa la sogs pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa dang / gzhi gang gis bdag dang gzhan la gnod par 'gyur ba brdzun gyi tshig smra ba de spangs pas brdzun du smra ba las phyir ldog pa rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i gzhi gang gis brdzun du smra ba zer ba de spangs pa dang / de'i gnyen por thos pa la sogs pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa dang / gzhi gang gis bdag dang gzhan la gnod par 'gyur ba brdzun gyi tshig smra ba de spangs pas brdzun du smra ba las phyir ldog pa rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan to //
translated: The purity of abstaining from false speech is taught by the avoidance of the causes of false speech, such as the desire for material gain or the fear of losing it, and by the cultivation of the antidotes to false speech, such as the wisdom gained from listening to the teachings.

original: rang gi nyes pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir yul gyi phyir dga' bar bya ba'i phyir phra ma byed pa de gang las med pa dang / de'i nang nas phyi'i skye mched la chags pa med pa dang / de med pas gang 'dum par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: rang gi nyes pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir yul gyi phyir dga' bar bya ba'i phyir phra ma byed pa de gang las med pa dang / de'i nang nas phyi'i skye mched la chags pa med pa dang / de med pas gang 'dum par mi byed pa dang /
translated: And because of that absence, there is no disharmony.

original: bye ba la mi rnon pa dang / mi mthun par mi dga' mi mthun bar mi mos /
analyzed: bye ba la mi rnon pa dang / mi mthun par mi dga' mi mthun bar mi mos /
translated: One is not sharp in dividing, and one does not delight in disharmony, nor does one approve of disharmony.

original: mi mthun par 'gyur ba'i tshig mi smra ba yin /
analyzed: mi mthun par 'gyur ba'i tshig mi smra ba yin /
translated: One does not speak words that will lead to disharmony.

original: de 'byung bar byed pa chags pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa las 'gro bas de'i phra ma las phyir log pa rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de 'byung bar byed pa chags pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa las 'gro bas de'i phra ma las phyir log pa rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan to //
translated: Since one goes beyond the afflictions such as attachment that cause that, the purity of turning away from slander is shown.

original: mi bzod pa'i gzhi med pa dang / bzod pa'i gzhi yod pa tshig rtsub pa las phyir log pa rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: mi bzod pa'i gzhi med pa dang / bzod pa'i gzhi yod pa tshig rtsub pa las phyir log pa rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan to //
translated: The absence of a basis for intolerance, and the presence of a basis for tolerance, are shown by the purity of turning away from harsh speech.

original: de la mi bzod pa'i gzhi ni ming dang gzugs la chags pa'i yid do //
analyzed: de la mi bzod pa'i gzhi ni ming dang gzugs la chags pa'i yid do //
translated: Therein, the basis for intolerance is the mind attached to name-and-form.

original: bzod pa'i gzhi ni so sor brtags pa'i stobs dang / sems 'chos shing rtse gcig tu bsgoms pa'i @266a * //
analyzed: bzod pa'i gzhi ni so sor brtags pa'i stobs dang / sems 'chos shing rtse gcig tu bsgoms pa'i @266a * //
translated: The basis of patience is the power of discernment and the power of mental cultivation, which is the one-pointed mind.

original: stobs kyis nyon mongs pa med pa ni rang bzhin gyis bzod pa'o //
analyzed: stobs kyis nyon mongs pa med pa ni rang bzhin gyis bzod pa'o //
translated: The absence of afflictions is natural patience.

original: tshig thun tshags smra ba rnam pa gsum spangs pas tshig thun tshags smra ba las phyir ldog pa rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: tshig thun tshags smra ba rnam pa gsum spangs pas tshig thun tshags smra ba las phyir ldog pa rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan to //
translated: The purity of turning away from speaking untruth is taught by abandoning the three types of untruthful speech.

original: tshig thun tshags smra ba rnam pa gsum ni bdag la bstod cing gzhan la smod pa dang ldan pa dang / log par smod pa dang ldan pa dang / rang gi lta ba bsnyems pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig thun tshags smra ba rnam pa gsum ni bdag la bstod cing gzhan la smod pa dang ldan pa dang / log par smod pa dang ldan pa dang / rang gi lta ba bsnyems pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The three types of untruthful speech are: that which is associated with praising oneself and disparaging others, that which is associated with false praise, and that which is associated with arrogance about one’s own view.

original: chags sems rnam gsum spangs pas chags sems las phyir log pa rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: chags sems rnam gsum spangs pas chags sems las phyir log pa rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan te /
translated: The purity of turning away from covetousness is taught by abandoning the three types of covetousness.

original: chags sems rnam pa gsum ni mtho ris kyi gnas dang / gzhan yid ches bar bya ba'i gnas dang / bslab pa'i 'thob ba dang bkur sti'i gnas so //
analyzed: chags sems rnam pa gsum ni mtho ris kyi gnas dang / gzhan yid ches bar bya ba'i gnas dang / bslab pa'i 'thob ba dang bkur sti'i gnas so //
translated: The three kinds of attachment are to the states of the higher realms, to being a source of confidence for others, and to the acquisition and honors of the trainings.

original: gnod sems kyi gzhi spangs pas gnod sems las phyir ldog pa rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: gnod sems kyi gzhi spangs pas gnod sems las phyir ldog pa rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan te /
translated: The purity of turning away from malice is shown by the avoidance of the basis of malice.

original: de'i gzhi'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ste /🔽bdag la gnod pa byas so //
analyzed: de'i gzhi'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ste / bdag la gnod pa byas so //
translated: The basis of malice is the view of the perishable collection.🔽Malice arises when one thinks, “He has harmed me,”

original: 'di ni bdag la gnod pa byed pa'o zhes gnod sems kun du bskyed do //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag la gnod pa byed pa'o zhes gnod sems kun du bskyed do //
translated: “He is harming me,” or “He will harm me.”

original: de spangs pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de spangs pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The characteristic of its avoidance is twofold:

original: yul rnams la spyod pa na bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa kun du mi 'byung ba dang / chos yid la byed pa na sangs rgyas kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i stong pa nyid la mos pa'o //
analyzed: yul rnams la spyod pa na bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa kun du mi 'byung ba dang / chos yid la byed pa na sangs rgyas kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i stong pa nyid la mos pa'o //
translated: when one experiences objects, the absence of the notions of “I” and “mine,” and when one attends to the Dharma, the conviction in emptiness, which is the perfect enlightenment of the Buddha.

original: gnyen po rnam par dag pa log par lta ba las phyir log pa rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan to ;
analyzed: gnyen po rnam par dag pa log par lta ba las phyir log pa rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan to ;
translated: The purity of the antidote is the purity of the reversal from wrong views.

original: / de'i gnyen por ni tshul khrims la brten nas ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: / de'i gnyen por ni tshul khrims la brten nas ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The antidote to that is concentration based on morality.

original: ting nge 'dzin la brten nas 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la brten nas 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: Based on concentration is mundane right view.

original: nges par rtogs pa'i phyogs su bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: nges par rtogs pa'i phyogs su bsdus pa'o //
translated: This is included in the category of definite understanding.

original: de nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: de nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: Then there is supramundane right view.

original: de ltar las kyis rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar las kyis rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the perfection of morality is to be understood as the purity of action.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i don bstan pas rnam grangs gzhan du'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don bstan pas rnam grangs gzhan du'o //
translated: The meaning of the verses is taught in another way.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis so sor bsdus pa'i don ni dang pos ni bar du gcod pa rnam par spong bas tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis so sor bsdus pa'i don ni dang pos ni bar du gcod pa rnam par spong bas tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the individual summary meaning is as follows. The first verse is the purity of morality through the abandonment of obstacles.

original: gnyis pas ni g-yeng ba dang / rlom sems kun nas rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni g-yeng ba dang / rlom sems kun nas rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The second verse is the purity of all distractions and conceit.

original: gsum pas ni sred pa dang / lta ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa spong ba rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pas ni sred pa dang / lta ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa spong ba rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The third verse is the purification of the abandonment of craving, false views, and afflictions.

original: bzhi pas ni 'du shes yongs su shes pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pas ni 'du shes yongs su shes pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The fourth verse is the purification of the knowledge of ideation.

original: lnga pas ni zag pa med pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pas ni zag pa med pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The fifth verse is the purification of the uncontaminated.

original: drug pas ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su dag pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: drug pas ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su dag pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The sixth verse is the purification of the purification of concentration.

original: bdun pas @266b ni sbyor ba rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: bdun pas @266b ni sbyor ba rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The seventh verse is the purification of application.

original: brgyad pas ni bslab pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad pas ni bslab pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The eighth verse is the purification of training.

original: dgu pas ni mi slob pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: dgu pas ni mi slob pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The ninth verse is the purification of the non-learner.

original: bcu pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: bcu pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The tenth verse is the purification of the wisdom of the Tathagata.

original: de la tshul khrims kyi bar du gcod pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims kyi bar du gcod pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: Among them, the fourth verse is the hindrance to morality.

original: nyams pa ni bar gcod pa ste /
analyzed: nyams pa ni bar gcod pa ste /
translated: The degeneration is the hindrance.

original: de'i gnyen por tshul khrims ldan la dri ma med cing ci yang med ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por tshul khrims ldan la dri ma med cing ci yang med ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: As its antidote, it is said that one should be pure in morality, stainless, and have nothing.

original: ngang tshul ngan pa'i nyes pa'i mtshan nyid ni dri ma'o //
analyzed: ngang tshul ngan pa'i nyes pa'i mtshan nyid ni dri ma'o //
translated: The characteristic of the fault of bad character is stain.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa ci yang zhes bya ba ni gzhi ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa ci yang zhes bya ba ni gzhi ste /
translated: “Any” means any of the afflictions, such as passion.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims nyams pa bar du gcod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims nyams pa bar du gcod pa'o //
translated: This is the obstacle to the observance of morality.

original: khyad par du 'gro ba bar du gcod pa de'i gnyen por /
analyzed: khyad par du 'gro ba bar du gcod pa de'i gnyen por /
translated: The antidote to the obstacle to the special qualities is the third verse:

original: tshul khrims ldan la rgyags pa med de brten pa med //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: tshul khrims ldan la rgyags pa med de brten pa med // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The moral man is not intoxicated, nor is he bound.

original: tshul khrims tsam la yon tan du lta zhing de la brten pa de'i gzhi ni rgyags pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims tsam la yon tan du lta zhing de la brten pa de'i gzhi ni rgyags pa ste /
translated: The “intoxication” of the moral man who sees virtue in mere morality and is attached to it is the obstacle to the special qualities.

original: 'di ni khyad par du 'gro ba'i bar du gcod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par du 'gro ba'i bar du gcod pa'o //
translated: This is the obstacle to the special qualities.

original: rtogs par 'gyur ba'i bar du gcod pa'i gnyen por /
analyzed: rtogs par 'gyur ba'i bar du gcod pa'i gnyen por /
translated: The antidote to the obstacle to realization is the fourth verse:

original: tshul khrims ldan la mun pa med cing 'ching ba med //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: tshul khrims ldan la mun pa med cing 'ching ba med // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The moral man has no darkness, nor is he bound.

original: ma rig pa ni gzhi'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni gzhi'o //
translated: “Darkness” is ignorance.

original: lta ba ni 'ching ba ste /
analyzed: lta ba ni 'ching ba ste /
translated: “Bondage” is the view.

original: 'di ni de kho na rtogs par 'gyur ba'i bar du gcod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de kho na rtogs par 'gyur ba'i bar du gcod pa'o //
translated: This is the obstacle to the realization of reality.

original: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i bar du gcod pa de'i gnyen por /
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i bar du gcod pa de'i gnyen por /
translated: The antidote to the obstacle to abiding in this life in comfort is the fifth verse:

original: tshul khrims ldan la rdul rnams med de nyes pa med //
analyzed: tshul khrims ldan la rdul rnams med de nyes pa med //
translated: The one who is endowed with morality is free from dust, free from evil.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: mi dge ba la sems pa ni rdul to//
analyzed: mi dge ba la sems pa ni rdul to//
translated: The dust is the intention to do what is nonvirtuous.

original: 'thob pa dang bkur sti la chags pa'i nyes pa ni gzhi ste /
analyzed: 'thob pa dang bkur sti la chags pa'i nyes pa ni gzhi ste /
translated: The basis is the evil of attachment to gain and honor.

original: 'di ni tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa bsam gtan rnams kyi bar du gcod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa bsam gtan rnams kyi bar du gcod pa'o //
translated: This is the obstruction to the meditative concentrations, which are the means of living happily in this life.

original: gnyis pa las ni g-yo ba dang rlom sems kun las rab tu thar pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa las ni g-yo ba dang rlom sems kun las rab tu thar pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: In the second, there is purification of complete liberation from all vacillation and conceit.

original: mtshan ma dang / gnas ngan len dang / de las byung ba'i sdug bsngal spangs pa dang ; gnyen por rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang / gnas ngan len dang / de las byung ba'i sdug bsngal spangs pa dang ; gnyen por rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the elimination of the signs, the elimination of the negative reflex actions, the elimination of the suffering that arises from them, and the perfection of the nonconceptual wisdom that is their antidote and of meditative concentration.

original: de la mtshan ma spangs pas zhi ba'o //
analyzed: de la mtshan ma spangs pas zhi ba'o //
translated: Among them, there is peace because of the elimination of the signs.

original: gnas ngan len spangs pas rab tu zhi ba'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len spangs pas rab tu zhi ba'o //
translated: There is complete peace because of the elimination of the negative reflex actions.

original: de las byung ba'i sdug bsngal spangs pas nye bar zhi ba'i yid do //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i sdug bsngal spangs pas nye bar zhi ba'i yid do //
translated: There is mental tranquility because of the elimination of the suffering that arises from them.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid dang de'i khyad par skye'o //🔽'gog go zhes bya ba la sogs par rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba dang / g-yo ba med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las mi g-yo ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid dang de'i khyad par skye'o // 'gog go zhes bya ba la sogs par rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba dang / g-yo ba med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las mi g-yo ba'i phyir /
translated: The perfection of freedom is the freedom from conceptualization, from movement, and from distraction from meditative concentration, due to the absence of conceptualization and the perfection of meditative concentration as the antidote, respectively.

original: gnyen po rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pas g-yo ba dang rlom sems thams cad las rab tu thar pa phun sum tshogs so //🔽gsum @267a * //🔽pa las ni srid pa dang lta ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: gnyen po rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pas g-yo ba dang rlom sems thams cad las rab tu thar pa phun sum tshogs so // gsum @267a * // pa las ni srid pa dang lta ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The perfection of freedom is the freedom from all movement and pride due to the absence of conceptualization and the perfection of meditative concentration as the antidote, respectively.🔽The third verse shows the purity of the abandonment of existence, views, and addictions.🔽The first line shows the purity of the abandonment of addictions.

original: tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan gyi sred pa spangs pas /🔽lus la mi lta srog la phangs par 'dzin mi byed //
analyzed: tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan gyi sred pa spangs pas / lus la mi lta srog la phangs par 'dzin mi byed //
translated: The second line shows the purity of the abandonment of views.

original: srid pa rnams su skye ba kun la 'dod pa med //🔽ces bya ba'o /
analyzed: srid pa rnams su skye ba kun la 'dod pa med // ces bya ba'o /
translated: The third line shows the purity of the abandonment of existence.🔽The fourth line shows the purity of the abandonment of the pride of the three spheres.

original: theg pa chen po'i chos dang don la phyin ci ma log pas /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos dang don la phyin ci ma log pas /
translated: The fourth verse shows the purity of the abandonment of the pride of the three spheres.🔽The first line shows the purity of the abandonment of the pride of the agent.

original: yang dag par zhugs pa dang / yang dag pa'i tshul la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par zhugs pa dang / yang dag pa'i tshul la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called “one who has entered into reality” and “one who abides in the true way.”

original: bzhi pa las ni 'du shes yongs su shes pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa las ni 'du shes yongs su shes pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: In the fourth, the knowledge of ideation is purified.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos kyi 'du shes yongs su shes pas 'jig rten gyis ma gos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos kyi 'du shes yongs su shes pas 'jig rten gyis ma gos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called “one who is not defiled by the world” because he knows the ideation of worldly dharmas.

original: 'jig rten gyi 'du shes yongs su shes pas 'jig rten dag la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi 'du shes yongs su shes pas 'jig rten dag la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called “one who is focused on the world” because he knows the ideation of the world.

original: bden pa la yid gnyis dang the tshom za ba'i 'du shes yongs su shes pas snang ba thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa la yid gnyis dang the tshom za ba'i 'du shes yongs su shes pas snang ba thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called “one who has attained light” because he knows the ideation of doubt and uncertainty about the truths.

original: lus dang longs spyod kyi 'du shes yongs su shes pas bdag gi ba med ces bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod kyi 'du shes yongs su shes pas bdag gi ba med ces bya'o //
translated: He is called “one who has no sense of ownership” because he knows the ideation of body and possessions.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi tshan ma'i 'du shes yongs su shes pas ci yang med ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi tshan ma'i 'du shes yongs su shes pas ci yang med ces bya'o //
translated: He is called “one who has nothing” because he knows the ideation of the signs of desire, anger, and delusion.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi 'du shes yongs su shes pas bdag tu 'du shes med cing gzhan du 'du shes med ces bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi 'du shes yongs su shes pas bdag tu 'du shes med cing gzhan du 'du shes med ces bya'o //
translated: He is called “one who has no ideation of self and no ideation of others” because he knows the ideation of self and other.

original: lnga pa las ni zag pa med pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: lnga pa las ni zag pa med pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The fifth is the immaculate action,

original: phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings yongs su 'dzin pas /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings yongs su 'dzin pas /
translated: because it is the support of the realm of nirvana without any remainder of the aggregates.🔽It is said:

original: gang la tshu rol med cing pha rol dbus kyang med //
analyzed: gang la tshu rol med cing pha rol dbus kyang med //
translated: There is no near shore, no far shore, and no middle.

original: ces bya'o // de la nang dang / phyi'i skye mched drug dang / de las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni tshu rol dang / pha rol dang / dbus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya'o // de la nang dang / phyi'i skye mched drug dang / de las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni tshu rol dang / pha rol dang / dbus zhes bya'o //
translated: The near shore, the far shore, and the middle are the six internal and external sense bases and the consciousnesses that arise from them.

original: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la rab tu gnas pas chags pa spangs pa dang dngos po'i 'ching ba las thar pa dang / dge ba mi spyoms pas /🔽tshu rol dag la nams kyang mi chags shing //🔽bcings dang chags med tshul 'chos med //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la rab tu gnas pas chags pa spangs pa dang dngos po'i 'ching ba las thar pa dang / dge ba mi spyoms pas / tshu rol dag la nams kyang mi chags shing // bcings dang chags med tshul 'chos med //
translated: It is the support of the realm of nirvana without any remainder of the aggregates, because it abandons attachment, is liberated from the bondage of entities, and does not boast of virtue.

original: ces bya ste /
analyzed: ces bya ste /
translated: It is said:🔽It is never attached to the near shore.🔽It is without bondage, attachment, and hypocrisy.

original: dngos po la chags pa spangs pas dngos pos bcings pa las rnam par grol gyi /
analyzed: dngos po la chags pa spangs pas dngos pos bcings pa las rnam par grol gyi /
translated: Because it abandons attachment to entities, it is liberated from bondage to entities.

original: dngos po las rnam par grol ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po las rnam par grol ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not liberated from things.

original: ma bcings pa ni grol ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ma bcings pa ni grol ba zhes bya ste /
translated: What is not bound is said to be liberated.

original: dper na dge slong khyed mig la dga' ba'i 'dod chags gang yin pa de spongs shig / de spangs na mig de spangs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dge slong khyed mig la dga' ba'i 'dod chags gang yin pa de spongs shig / de spangs na mig de spangs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is said: “Monks, abandon the desire and passion that are delight in the eye. When that is abandoned, the eye is abandoned.”

original: tshul 'chos med ces bya ba ni 'thob pa dang bkur sti la chags pa med pas phyi rol gyi dngos po la @267b mi chags par ston to //
analyzed: tshul 'chos med ces bya ba ni 'thob pa dang bkur sti la chags pa med pas phyi rol gyi dngos po la @267b mi chags par ston to //
translated: “Without hypocrisy” shows that he is not attached to external things, because he is not attached to gain and honor.

original: drug pa las ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su 'dzin pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: drug pa las ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su 'dzin pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The sixth verse shows the purification of the possession of concentration.

original: dag pa can gyi ting nge 'dzin yongs su 'dzin pas /
analyzed: dag pa can gyi ting nge 'dzin yongs su 'dzin pas /
translated: Because he possesses a pure concentration,

original: ming dang gzugs rnams la ni chags pa med pa'i yid //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs rnams la ni chags pa med pa'i yid //
translated: his mind is not attached to names and forms.

original: ces bya'o // tha ba med pa can gyi ting nge 'dzin yongs su 'dzin pas de ni mnyam par gzhag cing shin tu dul ba'i sems zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ces bya'o // tha ba med pa can gyi ting nge 'dzin yongs su 'dzin pas de ni mnyam par gzhag cing shin tu dul ba'i sems zhes bya ste /
translated: Because he possesses a concentration free from callousness, his mind is said to be well-concentrated and well-tamed.

original: rtsa ba'i bsam gtan gyi ting nge 'dzin thob pas mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i bsam gtan gyi ting nge 'dzin thob pas mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And because he has attained the fundamental meditative concentrations, he is said to be “equipoised.”

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su 'dzin pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su 'dzin pas /
translated: Because he is fully engaged in the supramundane meditative absorption,

original: gang la bdag med bdag gir 'dzin pa med //
analyzed: gang la bdag med bdag gir 'dzin pa med //
translated: he has no sense of “I” or “mine.”

original: ces bya'o // bdun pa las ni sbyor ba rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya'o // bdun pa las ni sbyor ba rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: In the seventh verse, the purity of his practice is described:

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa tsam gyis rlom sems su mi byed pas /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa tsam gyis rlom sems su mi byed pas /
translated: Because he does not become conceited by merely observing the vows of individual liberation,

original: so sor thar pa slob pa rlom sems byed pa med //
analyzed: so sor thar pa slob pa rlom sems byed pa med //
translated: he is not conceited about training in the vows of individual liberation.

original: ces bya'o // de tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pas /
analyzed: ces bya'o // de tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pas /
translated: Because he does not consider that to be sufficient,

original: des ni 'di na de la chags par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: des ni 'di na de la chags par mi 'gyur te //
translated: he does not become attached to it.🔽He seeks the noble paths

original: de yi gang du 'phags pa'i lam rnams tshol byed pa //
analyzed: de yi gang du 'phags pa'i lam rnams tshol byed pa //
translated: And where the noble paths are sought,🔽

original: de ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i mtshan ma'o //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i mtshan ma'o // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the defining characteristic of pure morality.

original: brgyad pa las ni slob pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: brgyad pa las ni slob pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: In the eighth verse, the purity of his training is described:

original: tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin gyis chog par mi 'dzin pas //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin gyis chog par mi 'dzin pas //
translated: Because he does not consider morality and meditative absorption to be sufficient,

original: tshul khrims gtso bo ma yin ting nge 'dzin der chags med //
analyzed: tshul khrims gtso bo ma yin ting nge 'dzin der chags med //
translated: Not morality, not concentration, but wisdom is the principal thing.

original: ces bya'o // 'jig rten pa'i shes rab tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pas /
analyzed: ces bya'o // 'jig rten pa'i shes rab tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pas /
translated: Not being satisfied with mere mundane wisdom,

original: de kho na rtogs te /
analyzed: de kho na rtogs te /
translated: he realizes reality.

original: mi dmigs pa'i ye shes thob pa ni ;
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i ye shes thob pa ni ;
translated: Obtaining the intuition of nonapprehending,

original: de yi gong du shes rab sgom pa yongs su tshol //
analyzed: de yi gong du shes rab sgom pa yongs su tshol //
translated: he seeks the cultivation of wisdom even more.

original: dmigs pa med pa 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs yin te //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs yin te //
translated: The noble ones’ lineage is nonapprehending.

original: tshul khrims de ni bde bar gshegs pas rab tu bsngags //
analyzed: tshul khrims de ni bde bar gshegs pas rab tu bsngags //
translated: That morality is highly praised by the Well-Gone Ones.

original: zhes bya'o // dgu pa las ni mi slob pa las ni dag ste /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // dgu pa las ni mi slob pa las ni dag ste /
translated: On the ninth stage, he is purified of the state of no-more-learning,

original: mthong ba'i lam na 'jig tshogs la lta ba las rnam par grol bas /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam na 'jig tshogs la lta ba las rnam par grol bas /
translated: because on the path of seeing he is liberated from the view of the transitory composite.

original: 'jig pa'i tshogs la lta las rnam par grol ba'i yid //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i tshogs la lta las rnam par grol ba'i yid //
translated: His mind is liberated from the view of the transitory composite.

original: ces bya'o // bsgom pa'i lam na nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal las rnam par grol bas /
analyzed: ces bya'o // bsgom pa'i lam na nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal las rnam par grol bas /
translated: On the path of meditation, he is liberated from the pride of thinking “I am,”

original: de 'dir nga dang nga yi snyam du 'gyur ba med //
analyzed: de 'dir nga dang nga yi snyam du 'gyur ba med //
translated: and so he has no thought of “I” or “mine.”

original: ces bya'o // de'i rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyi /
analyzed: ces bya'o // de'i rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyi /
translated: And in the post-meditational intuition

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul zab mo stong pa nyid la mos pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul zab mo stong pa nyid la mos pas /
translated: By being devoted to the profound emptiness, the domain of the Tathagata,

original: sangs rgyas spyod yul stod pa nyid la lhag par mos /
analyzed: sangs rgyas spyod yul stod pa nyid la lhag par mos /
translated: he is devoted to the profundity of the domain of the Buddha.

original: de yi tshul khrims de ni mnyam pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de yi tshul khrims de ni mnyam pa med pa'o //
translated: His morality is unequaled.

original: zhes bya'o // bcu pa las ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // bcu pa las ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: In the tenth, the knowledge of the Tathagata is pure.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims la gnas nas theg pa rlabs po che'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims la gnas nas theg pa rlabs po che'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pas /
translated: The bodhisattva, having stood in the morality of the bodhisattva, cultivates the samadhi of the Great Vehicle.

original: tshul khrims la ni gnas nas ting nge 'dzin kyang thob //🔽ces bya'o // @268a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims la ni gnas nas ting nge 'dzin kyang thob // ces bya'o // @268a * //
translated: Having stood in morality, he also attains samadhi.

original: ting nge 'dzin la gnas te shes rab bsgom mo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la gnas te shes rab bsgom mo //
translated: Having stood in samadhi, he cultivates wisdom.

original: bsgoms pas ting nge 'dzin rnams thob nas shes rab shin tu bsgom //
analyzed: bsgoms pas ting nge 'dzin rnams thob nas shes rab shin tu bsgom //
translated: Having attained samadhi through cultivation, he cultivates wisdom well.

original: zhes bya'o // shes rab zab mo bsgom pa la gnas te thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pas /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // shes rab zab mo bsgom pa la gnas te thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pas /
translated: Having stood in the cultivation of profound wisdom, he attains the knowledge of a Buddha.

original: shes rab kyis ni ye shes rnam par dag pa 'thob //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni ye shes rnam par dag pa 'thob //
translated: Through wisdom, he attains the purity of knowledge.

original: ces bya'o // de ltar tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pas /
analyzed: ces bya'o // de ltar tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pas /
translated: Thus, through the perfection of morality,

original: ye shes rnam par dag pas tshul khrims phun sum tshogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes rnam par dag pas tshul khrims phun sum tshogs zhes bya'o //
translated: one is said to have the perfection of morality through the purity of wisdom.

original: yang gnod pa 'joms pa rnam par dag pa dang bslab pa rnam gsum rnam par dag pa dang / sbyor ba'i lam rnam par dag pa dang / mthong ba'i lam rnam par dag pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam rnam par dag pa dang / mthar phyin pa'i lam rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: yang gnod pa 'joms pa rnam par dag pa dang bslab pa rnam gsum rnam par dag pa dang / sbyor ba'i lam rnam par dag pa dang / mthong ba'i lam rnam par dag pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam rnam par dag pa dang / mthar phyin pa'i lam rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: Moreover, the purity of the destruction of harm, the purity of the three trainings, the purity of the path of preparation, the purity of the path of seeing, the purity of the path of cultivation, the purity of the path of conclusion,

original: sdom pa gsum rnam par dag pas /
analyzed: sdom pa gsum rnam par dag pas /
translated: and the purity of the three vows🔽should be understood through these verses.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis lus rnam par gzhag par bya'o zhes slob dpon gzhan dag tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gi don de skad du brjod do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis lus rnam par gzhag par bya'o zhes slob dpon gzhan dag tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gi don de skad du brjod do //
translated: Thus, other masters explain the meaning of these verses.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor song la dge slong de dag kun shes par byos shig / rab 'byor gyis gsol ba /
analyzed: rab 'byor song la dge slong de dag kun shes par byos shig / rab 'byor gyis gsol ba /
translated: Subhūti, go and make those monks understand. Subhūti replied,🔽Blessed One, I am not able to go to those monks to make them understand.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis 'di dag la bshad na yang mthun par mi bgyid na bdag gis lta smos kyang ci 'tshal zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis 'di dag la bshad na yang mthun par mi bgyid na bdag gis lta smos kyang ci 'tshal zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Blessed One himself, when he explains these things, is not in agreement with them, so what need is there to speak of me?

original: 'di la rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa ni ;
analyzed: 'di la rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa ni ;
translated: Here, the Blessed One's statement to Subhuti

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis 'dul ba'i don mdzad pa'i nus pa nyan thos rnams las khyad par du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis 'dul ba'i don mdzad pa'i nus pa nyan thos rnams las khyad par du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is to distinguish the power of the Tathagatas to accomplish the purpose of discipline from that of the Sravakas.

original: 'di man chad ni brda dang don dam pa'i sdom pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di man chad ni brda dang don dam pa'i sdom pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: From here on, the summary of the conventional and ultimate should be understood as being presented.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe dge slong de dag lam gang nas dong ba'i lam der dge slong gnyis shig sprul pa sprul to zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'dul ba'i thabs ston to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe dge slong de dag lam gang nas dong ba'i lam der dge slong gnyis shig sprul pa sprul to zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'dul ba'i thabs ston to //
translated: Then the Blessed One, at that time, emanated two monks on the path by which those monks had gone. He emanated means he manifested.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis sprul pa rab tu bstan te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis sprul pa rab tu bstan te /
translated: The emanation is fully taught by two aspects:

original: rtags dang mos pa mthun par kun tu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rtags dang mos pa mthun par kun tu bstan pa ste /
translated: the teaching of the similarity of signs and aspirations,

original: dge slong de dag bsdus nas gdams pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: dge slong de dag bsdus nas gdams pa'i phyir ro /
translated: in order to gather those monks and give them instructions.

original: de nas dge slong lnga brgya po de dag sprul pa'i dge slong gnyis po lam gang nas dong ba'i lam der dong ste phyin pa dang 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas dge slong lnga brgya po de dag sprul pa'i dge slong gnyis po lam gang nas dong ba'i lam der dong ste phyin pa dang 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the five hundred monks went on the road on which the two emanated monks had gone, and when they arrived they said this:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag gar 'gro //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag gar 'gro //
translated: “Venerable ones, where are you going?”

original: de gnyis kyis smras pa /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis smras pa /
translated: The two of them said,

original: kho bo cag ni dgon pa'i gnas rnams su bsam gtan gyi bde ba la reg par gnas par bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni dgon pa'i gnas rnams su bsam gtan gyi bde ba la reg par gnas par bya bar 'dod do //
translated: “We wish to go to the wilderness and live there, touching the bliss of concentration.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kho bo cag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa gang @268b yin pa'i chos bstan pa de la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa gang @268b yin pa'i chos bstan pa de la mi 'jug ste /
translated: We do not engage with the Dharma teaching that the Blessed One gave.

original: mi rtog mi mos shing skrag kun du skrag kun du rab tu skrag par gyur nas kho bo cag dgon pa'i gnas rnams su bsam gtan gyi bde ba la reg par gnas pa rnams kyis gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtog mi mos shing skrag kun du skrag kun du rab tu skrag par gyur nas kho bo cag dgon pa'i gnas rnams su bsam gtan gyi bde ba la reg par gnas pa rnams kyis gnas par bya'o //
translated: We do not understand it, are not inspired by it, and are afraid of it, terrified of it, and filled with dread of it. We will go to the wilderness and live there, touching the bliss of concentration.”🔽The five hundred monks said this:

original: dge slong lnga brgya po dag gis 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: dge slong lnga brgya po dag gis 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: “Venerable ones, do not do that!

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag kho bo cag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bshad pa la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag kho bo cag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bshad pa la mi 'jug ste /
translated: “Venerable friends, we also do not understand the doctrine that the Bhagavān teaches.

original: ma rtog ma mos shing skrag kun du skrag kun du rab tu skrag par gyur to //
analyzed: ma rtog ma mos shing skrag kun du skrag kun du rab tu skrag par gyur to //
translated: We do not comprehend it, do not believe in it, and are afraid of it and terrified of it.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag kyang dgon pa'i gnas rnams su bsam gtan gyi bde ba la reg par gnas pa rnams kyis gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag kyang dgon pa'i gnas rnams su bsam gtan gyi bde ba la reg par gnas pa rnams kyis gnas par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, we should live in the forest, in seclusion, with our minds set on seclusion, and experience the bliss of meditation.”

original: sprul pa gnyis kyis smras pa /
analyzed: sprul pa gnyis kyis smras pa /
translated: The two emanations said:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag de'i phyir bdag cag yang dag par 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag de'i phyir bdag cag yang dag par 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: “Venerable friends, therefore we should go to the right place.

original: rtsod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rtsod par mi bya'o //
translated: We should not argue.

original: rtsod pa med pa dam par byed pa ni dge sbyong gi chos so //
analyzed: rtsod pa med pa dam par byed pa ni dge sbyong gi chos so //
translated: The highest practice of non-argument is the Dharma of the renunciant.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag gang 'di yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba gang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag gang 'di yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba gang /
translated: Venerable friends, what is called ‘nirvāṇa’—

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i chos de gang /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i chos de gang /
translated: what is the Dharma that will attain nirvāṇa?

original: de lus 'di la bdag gam sems can nam /
analyzed: de lus 'di la bdag gam sems can nam /
translated: Is it this body, or is it a being,

original: skye ba po 'am /🔽skyes bu 'am /
analyzed: skye ba po 'am / skyes bu 'am /
translated: a living being,🔽a person,

original: gang zag gam /
analyzed: gang zag gam /
translated: or an individual?

original: shed las skyes pa 'am /
analyzed: shed las skyes pa 'am /
translated: “Who is born from a womb?

original: shed bu 'am /🔽gang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: shed bu 'am / gang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
translated: “Who is a human?🔽“Who is there to attain nirvana?

original: gang zad pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da'/
analyzed: gang zad pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da'/
translated: “What is there that will cease to exist through nirvana?”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They replied,

original: 'dod chags zad /
analyzed: 'dod chags zad /
translated: “Desire is exhausted.

original: zhe sdang zad /
analyzed: zhe sdang zad /
translated: Anger is exhausted.

original: gti mug zad pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: gti mug zad pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: Ignorance is exhausted through nirvana.”

original: sprul pa gnyis kyis smras pa /
analyzed: sprul pa gnyis kyis smras pa /
translated: The two emanations said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug yod pas yin nam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug yod pas yin nam /
translated: “Venerable ones, is it because desire, anger, and ignorance exist

original: ci na de dag zad par bya /
analyzed: ci na de dag zad par bya /
translated: that they are exhausted?”

original: de dag gis smras pa /🔽de dag gi nang na yang med /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa / de dag gi nang na yang med /
translated: They replied,🔽“They are not within.

original: phyi rol na yang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na yang med /
translated: They are not without.

original: gnyi ga med pa la yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: gnyi ga med pa la yang mi dmigs te /
translated: They are not apprehended as both.🔽They do not arise without being examined.”🔽This is the fear of the pride of those who are attached to nirvana.

original: de dag ni yongs su ma brtags pa las kyang mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni de dag mya ngan las 'das pa las log par 'dzin pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis skrag pa las yongs su mya ngan las 'das par byed pa'i sems can de gang yang med
analyzed: de dag ni yongs su ma brtags pa las kyang mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni de dag mya ngan las 'das pa las log par 'dzin pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis skrag pa las yongs su mya ngan las 'das par byed pa'i sems can de gang yang med
translated: “There is no being whatsoever who attains nirvana.”

original: la / 'dod chags la sogs pa yod pa las zad par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: la / 'dod chags la sogs pa yod pa las zad par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it that the extinction of desire and so on is due to their existence.

original: ma skyes pa de dag nyid kyi skye ba med pa tsam la mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes yongs su bstan pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa la yid ches par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa de dag nyid kyi skye ba med pa tsam la mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes yongs su bstan pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa la yid ches par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: For, the non-arising of those very things is just non-arising, and that is nirvana.

original: sprul pa gnyis kyis smras pa /🔽tshe dang ldan pa dag de lta bas na ma rtog rnam par ma rtog shig ces bya ba ni nang dang phyi'i skye mched rnams la nga dang nga'i zhes bya ba dang / go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: sprul pa gnyis kyis smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa dag de lta bas na ma rtog rnam par ma rtog shig ces bya ba ni nang dang phyi'i skye mched rnams la nga dang nga'i zhes bya ba dang / go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The two emanations said:🔽“Therefore, venerable ones, do not imagine, do not conceptualize!”

original: tshe dang ldan @269a * //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan @269a * //
translated: This is to be applied in order to the internal and external sense bases, as “I” and “mine.”🔽“Venerable ones, when you do not imagine and do not conceptualize, then you will not be attached.”

original: pa dag nam mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa de'i ni chags par yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa dag nam mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa de'i ni chags par yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because desire does not arise.🔽“You will not be free from attachment.”

original: chags pa dang bral bar yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa la 'bral ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa dang bral bar yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa la 'bral ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no separation from non-arising.

original: chags pa med cing chags pa dang bral ba yang med pa gang yin pa de ni zhi ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la ma zhi bar gyur pa las zhi bar 'gyur ro snyam du 'dzin pa yongs su btsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa med cing chags pa dang bral ba yang med pa gang yin pa de ni zhi ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la ma zhi bar gyur pa las zhi bar 'gyur ro snyam du 'dzin pa yongs su btsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is neither attached nor detached is called “peaceful.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag tshul khrims ni mi 'khor zhing mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag tshul khrims ni mi 'khor zhing mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
translated: Venerable ones, morality does not cycle and does not attain nirvana.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la yang mi 'khor zhing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la yang mi 'khor zhing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
translated: Venerable ones, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the vision of the wisdom of liberation also do not cycle and do not attain nirvana.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag chos de dag gis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa na chos de dag kyang stong pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag chos de dag gis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa na chos de dag kyang stong pa /
translated: Venerable ones, when it is taught that one attains nirvana through those dharmas, those dharmas are empty,

original: dben pa gzung du med pa'o zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: dben pa gzung du med pa'o zhes smras pa ni /
translated: isolated, and ungraspable.

original: gang dag gis gang zag zhi ba zhes bya'o /
analyzed: gang dag gis gang zag zhi ba zhes bya'o /
translated: Those who say that are called “peaceful persons.”

original: mi 'khor ba ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'khor ba ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not cycle because they are not afflicted.

original: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba ni /
translated: Not passing into complete nirvana means

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir te /
translated: that they are naturally in complete nirvana.

original: de dag la ni sngon ma zhi bar gyur pa las zhi bar 'gyur ba gzhan med do //
analyzed: de dag la ni sngon ma zhi bar gyur pa las zhi bar 'gyur ba gzhan med do //
translated: For them, there is no other state of peace than the one they have already attained.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag dngos po ci yang med pas 'di lta ste /🔽mya ngan las 'das so snyam pa'i 'du shes spongs shig / bdag yongs su mya ngan las 'das par bya'o snyam pa'i 'du shes kyis mya ngan las 'das pa la 'du shes su ma byed cig /'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'du shes kyis mya ngan las 'das pa
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag dngos po ci yang med pas 'di lta ste / mya ngan las 'das so snyam pa'i 'du shes spongs shig / bdag yongs su mya ngan las 'das par bya'o snyam pa'i 'du shes kyis mya ngan las 'das pa la 'du shes su ma byed cig /'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'du shes kyis mya ngan las 'das pa
translated: Venerable ones, since there is no existent thing at all,🔽abandon the notion that thinks, “Nirvana is.”🔽Do not form the notion that thinks, “I will attain complete nirvana,”🔽and do not form the notion that thinks, “Nirvana is the absence of desire and so on.”

original: la 'dod chags la sogs pa med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'du shes la yangs su shes par ma byed cig /'dod chags la sogs pa med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: la 'dod chags la sogs pa med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'du shes la yangs su shes par ma byed cig /'dod chags la sogs pa med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Do not form the notion that thinks, “The absence of desire and so on is nirvana.”

original: de ni de'i 'du shes kyis bcings pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i bar chad du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i 'du shes kyis bcings pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i bar chad du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is an obstacle to abiding in the signless.

original: zag pa zad par bya ba'i thabs bstan nas de'i 'og tu tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i thabs 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mngon par sgrub pa ston to //
analyzed: zag pa zad par bya ba'i thabs bstan nas de'i 'og tu tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i thabs 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mngon par sgrub pa ston to //
translated: Having taught the method of eliminating the contaminants, subsequently he teaches the method of abiding in comfort in this life, the attainment of the meditative attainment of cessation.🔽Venerable ones, enter the meditative attainment of the cessation of ideation and feeling.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la zhugs shig / tshe dang ldan pa dag 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug @269b pa las gong na bya ba med do zhes 'chad do zhes gang gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la zhugs shig / tshe dang ldan pa dag 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug @269b pa las gong na bya ba med do zhes 'chad do zhes gang gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Venerable ones, there is nothing to do above the meditative attainment of the cessation of ideation and feeling.

original: yang na 'di ni don gzhan yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni don gzhan yin te /
translated: Or this has a different meaning.

original: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa dag gis mos par mi nus zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dang mi ldan pa'i phyir shin tu rdul dang ldan pa rnams so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa dag gis mos par mi nus zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dang mi ldan pa'i phyir shin tu rdul dang ldan pa rnams so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those who have not generated the roots of virtue are unable to believe in it. This means that those who do not possess the accumulations of merit and wisdom are extremely defiled.

original: sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs su zin pa dag gis ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dam pas yongs su ma zin pa'i phyir rab tu ma rung bar 'gyur ba rnams kyis so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs su zin pa dag gis ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dam pas yongs su ma zin pa'i phyir rab tu ma rung bar 'gyur ba rnams kyis so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those who are seized by evil friends are not. This means that those who are not seized by holy beings are unrighteous.

original: ma dad pa mang bdag gis ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi tshogs dang mi ldan pas zab mo'i chos rnams la mos pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma dad pa mang bdag gis ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi tshogs dang mi ldan pas zab mo'i chos rnams la mos pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those who have much lack of faith are not. This means that those who do not possess the accumulation of wisdom are devoted to the profound Dharma.

original: mi 'jug ces bya ba ni bstan pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi 'jug ces bya ba ni bstan pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: They do not engage. This means that they are not taught.

original: mi rtog ces bya ba ni chos gnas pa'i ye shes ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtog ces bya ba ni chos gnas pa'i ye shes ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not understand. This means that they do not realize the wisdom that abides in the Dharma.

original: mi mos zhes bya ba ni de kho na shes pas nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mos zhes bya ba ni de kho na shes pas nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase those who do not aspire refers to those who are not certain about reality because they do not know it.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dul ba'i thabs de rnam pa gnyis su blta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dul ba'i thabs de rnam pa gnyis su blta ste /
translated: The method of training in the Tathāgata’s lineage should be seen as twofold:

original: sprul pa dag gis mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gyi bdag nyid dang 'dra ba dang / mos pa 'dra bas ni bka' la sems nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir 'dra ba bstan pa dang / gdams ngag de nges par 'byung ba can yin pas yang dag par rnam par dag pa'i thabs nye bar bstan pa'o//
analyzed: sprul pa dag gis mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gyi bdag nyid dang 'dra ba dang / mos pa 'dra bas ni bka' la sems nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir 'dra ba bstan pa dang / gdams ngag de nges par 'byung ba can yin pas yang dag par rnam par dag pa'i thabs nye bar bstan pa'o//
translated: The similarity of the emanations to those who are proud of their own status and the similarity of their aspirations are taught in order to establish the authority of the teaching. The instruction is also taught as a method for attaining complete purification because it leads to liberation.

original: gdams ngag kyang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gdams ngag kyang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: The instruction should be understood as being of four types:

original: rnam par byang ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa gnyis la skrag par 'byung ba'i gnas bstan pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi yongs su spang bar bstan pa dang / rnam par byang ba la skrag pa'i gzhi yongs su spang bar bstan pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa gnyis la skrag par 'byung ba'i gnas bstan pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi yongs su spang bar bstan pa dang / rnam par byang ba la skrag pa'i gzhi yongs su spang bar bstan pa dang /
translated: the teaching of the basis of fear in both purification and affliction, the teaching of the abandonment of the basis of affliction, the teaching of the abandonment of the basis of fear in purification, and the teaching of the abandonment of the basis of fear in affliction.

original: tshe 'di la mchog tu bde ba gnas pa'i thabs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di la mchog tu bde ba gnas pa'i thabs bstan pa'o //
translated: The method of abiding in the highest happiness in this life is taught.

original: de la tshe dang ldan pa dag gang 'di yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gang yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba'i chos de yang /
analyzed: de la tshe dang ldan pa dag gang 'di yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gang yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba'i chos de yang /
translated: Among them, Venerable Ones, that dharma which is called 'nirvana' and by which one would attain nirvana,

original: gang lus la bdag gam zhes bya ba ni bdag tu lta ba dgag pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba dang kun nas nyon mongs pa gnyis la skrag pa 'byung ba'i gnas bstan pas bdag med par 'gyur ro snyam ste /
analyzed: gang lus la bdag gam zhes bya ba ni bdag tu lta ba dgag pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba dang kun nas nyon mongs pa gnyis la skrag pa 'byung ba'i gnas bstan pas bdag med par 'gyur ro snyam ste /
translated: is taught in order to stop the view of self. By the teaching of the basis of the arising of fear in both purification and affliction, one might think there is no self.

original: skrag pas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skrag pas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te /
translated: Through fear, one becomes afflicted.

original: 'di ni rnam pa dang po'o //🔽sprul pa gnyis kyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa dang po'o // sprul pa gnyis kyis smras pa /
translated: This is the first aspect.

original: de tshe dang ldan pa dag de lta bas na ma rtog rnam par ma rtog shig ces @270a * //
analyzed: de tshe dang ldan pa dag de lta bas na ma rtog rnam par ma rtog shig ces @270a * //
translated: The two emanations say, Therefore, Venerable Ones, do not imagine, do not conceptualize!

original: bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi rnam pa gnyis ston to //
analyzed: bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi rnam pa gnyis ston to //
translated: This teaches the two bases of affliction.

original: tha snyad can gyi ngo bo nyid du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i yongs su rtog pa de'i dbang du byas nas ma rtog shig ces bya ba smras so //
analyzed: tha snyad can gyi ngo bo nyid du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i yongs su rtog pa de'i dbang du byas nas ma rtog shig ces bya ba smras so //
translated: The phrase do not imagine is stated in terms of the imagination that consists in the essential nature of the afflicted class, which is characterized by the essential nature of the conventional.

original: de'i yon tan dang nyes pa'i bye brag la mngon par zhen pa'i yongs su rtog pa de'i dbang du byas nas rnam par ma rtog shig ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i yon tan dang nyes pa'i bye brag la mngon par zhen pa'i yongs su rtog pa de'i dbang du byas nas rnam par ma rtog shig ces bya ba smras te /
translated: The phrase do not discriminate is stated in terms of the imagination that consists in the essential nature of the purified class, which is characterized by the essential nature of the conventional.

original: 'di ni rnam pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second aspect.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag ni mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa de na zhes bya ba de nas rgya cher de ni de'i 'du shes kyis bcings pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar dag ni rnam par byang ba ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag ni mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa de na zhes bya ba de nas rgya cher de ni de'i 'du shes kyis bcings pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar dag ni rnam par byang ba ste /
translated: The passage that begins with the words the venerable ones do not imagine and do not discriminate and concludes with the words he is bound by that perception describes purification.

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be understood as being twofold:

original: rnam par dag pa'i lam dang / mya ngan las 'das pa rnam par dag pa'i lam la skrag pa'i gzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i lam dang / mya ngan las 'das pa rnam par dag pa'i lam la skrag pa'i gzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: the path of purification and the basis for fear in regard to the path of purification that leads to nirvana.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag tshul khrims la sogs pa ni mi 'khor zhing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o zhes bya ba la tshul khrims la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sngon dang phyi mar kun nas nyon mongs par rtog pa
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag tshul khrims la sogs pa ni mi 'khor zhing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o zhes bya ba la tshul khrims la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sngon dang phyi mar kun nas nyon mongs par rtog pa
translated: “Venerable Ones, morality, etc. do not revolve and do not pass into complete Nirvana” means that the suchness of morality, etc. is completely pure, and therefore the conception of defilement and the conception of freedom from defilement in the past and future are not tenable.

original: dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i rtog pa mi 'thad na de rnam par dag pa'i lam de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar rtog pas rnam par dag pa'i lam la skrag go //
analyzed: dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i rtog pa mi 'thad na de rnam par dag pa'i lam de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar rtog pas rnam par dag pa'i lam la skrag go //
translated: If the conception of defilement and freedom from defilement in the past and future are not tenable, then the conception of defilement and freedom from defilement in the path of purification is not tenable.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis mya ngan las 'das pa rnam par dag pa la skrag pa'i gzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis mya ngan las 'das pa rnam par dag pa la skrag pa'i gzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: One should know that there are two bases for fear in regard to the purification of Nirvana.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di lta ste mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'du shes spongs shig ces bya ba ni tha snyad can gyi ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pas so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di lta ste mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'du shes spongs shig ces bya ba ni tha snyad can gyi ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pas so //
translated: “Venerable Ones, abandon the notion that this is Nirvana” means that one is attached to the nature of conventional expression.

original: 'du shes la yang 'du shes su ma byed cig ces bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni tshig bla dags kyi 'du shes la sems las byung ba'i 'du shes su byed pas so //
analyzed: 'du shes la yang 'du shes su ma byed cig ces bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni tshig bla dags kyi 'du shes la sems las byung ba'i 'du shes su byed pas so //
translated: Do not conceive of conception as conception means that the conception of the term nirvana is conceived as a mental conception.

original: 'du shes la 'du shes kyis yongs su shes par ma byed cig ces bya ba ni sems las byung ba'i 'du shes kyis zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni tshig bla dags kyi 'du shes la yongs su shes par byed pas so //
analyzed: 'du shes la 'du shes kyis yongs su shes par ma byed cig ces bya ba ni sems las byung ba'i 'du shes kyis zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni tshig bla dags kyi 'du shes la yongs su shes par byed pas so //
translated: Do not conceive of conception by conception means that the conception of the term peace is conceived by a mental conception.

original: gzhi rnam pa 'di gnyis med na mya ngan las 'das pa la skrag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhi rnam pa 'di gnyis med na mya ngan las 'das pa la skrag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If these two bases do not exist, one will not fear nirvana.

original: 'di ni rnam pa gsum par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa gsum par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be known as the third aspect.

original: gzhi de gnyis yongs su spangs pa ni @270b mchog tu gnas par bya ba'i thabs bstan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhi de gnyis yongs su spangs pa ni @270b mchog tu gnas par bya ba'i thabs bstan par rig par bya ste /
translated: The teaching of the means of supreme abiding is to be known as the complete abandonment of those two bases.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs shig / tshe dang ldan pa dag 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs na de'i gong na bya ba med do zhes gang smras so//
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs shig / tshe dang ldan pa dag 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs na de'i gong na bya ba med do zhes gang smras so//
translated: When you have entered into the attainment of the cessation of ideation and sensation, there is nothing more to do above that.

original: gzhi de gnyis yongs su spangs pa yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi yongs su spangs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la skrag pa'i gzhi yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: gzhi de gnyis yongs su spangs pa yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi yongs su spangs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la skrag pa'i gzhi yongs su spangs te /
translated: The abandonment of these two bases is the abandonment of the basis of defilement and the abandonment of the basis of fear with regard to purification.

original: 'di ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood as being of four kinds:

original: 'di yan chad ni de bzhin gshegs pas 'dul ba'i thabs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yan chad ni de bzhin gshegs pas 'dul ba'i thabs su rig par bya'o //
translated: From here on, one should understand the Tathāgata’s method of conversion.

original: 'di man chad ni dngos po drug las brtsams nas bka' lung brda sprod pa don chen por rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni dngos po drug las brtsams nas bka' lung brda sprod pa don chen por rig par bya ste /
translated: From here on, one should understand the great meaning of the transmission of the teaching that begins with the six topics.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dngos po dang / gnas kyi dngos po dang / sgra'i dngos po dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i dngos po dang / gdams ngag gi dngos po dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dngos po dang / gnas kyi dngos po dang / sgra'i dngos po dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i dngos po dang / gdams ngag gi dngos po dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: the thing that is nirvana, the thing that is the abode, the thing that is the sound, the thing that is the proper mental attention, the thing that is the instruction, and the thing that is the practice of the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de dag sems rnam par grol nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: de dag sems rnam par grol nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: Having liberated their minds, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One and sat to one side.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis dge slong de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis dge slong de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti asked those monks,🔽“Venerable ones, where are you going and where have you come from?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag gar dong dang gang nas lhags zhes dris pa dang / de dag gis smras pa /🔽btsun pa rab 'byor gang du yang 'gro ba med /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag gar dong dang gang nas lhags zhes dris pa dang / de dag gis smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor gang du yang 'gro ba med /
translated: They replied,🔽“Venerable Subhūti, the Blessed One has taught the Dharma saying, ‘There is nowhere to go and nothing to come from.’

original: gang nas kyang 'ong ba med pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan to zhes bya ba ci las brtsams te de skad smras she na /
analyzed: gang nas kyang 'ong ba med pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan to zhes bya ba ci las brtsams te de skad smras she na /
translated: What is the basis of that statement?”

original: dang po ste mya ngan las 'das pa'i dngos po'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ste mya ngan las 'das pa'i dngos po'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The first is from the point of view of the reality of nirvana.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar 'khor ba lta bur de la ni 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor ba lta bur de la ni 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba med pa'o //
translated: Because, like samsara, there is no coming or going in nirvana.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed kyi ston pa gang yin zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed kyi ston pa gang yin zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
translated: When asked, “Venerable sirs, who is your teacher?” they replied,

original: gang ma skyes shing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o zhes bya ba ci las brtsams te de skad smras she na /
analyzed: gang ma skyes shing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o zhes bya ba ci las brtsams te de skad smras she na /
translated: “He who is unborn and does not enter nirvana.”

original: gnyis pa gnas kyi dngos po ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa gnas kyi dngos po ste /
translated: The second is from the point of view of the basis.

original: gzugs kyi sku'i dbang du byas so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku'i dbang du byas so //
translated: It is from the point of view of the form body.

original: ma skyes shing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir te /
analyzed: ma skyes shing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir te /
translated: “Unborn and does not enter nirvana” means that it is the nature of nirvana.

original: smras pa / khyed kyis ji ltar chos thos zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
