analyzed: smras pa / khyed kyis ji ltar chos thos zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
translated: When asked, “How do you hear the Dharma?” they replied,

original: bcing ba'i phyir yang ma yin thar pa'i phyir @271a * //
analyzed: bcing ba'i phyir yang ma yin thar pa'i phyir @271a * //
translated: “Not for the sake of bondage, nor for the sake of liberation.”

original: yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
analyzed: yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
translated: What is the thought behind this statement?

original: gsum pa sgra'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: gsum pa sgra'i dngos po ste /
translated: The third is the thing that is the sound.

original: chos bstan pa'i dbang du byas so //
analyzed: chos bstan pa'i dbang du byas so //
translated: This is from the point of view of teaching the Dharma.

original: bcing ba'i phyir yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcing ba'i phyir yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Nor is it for the sake of being bound.

original: chos gos la sogs pa la sred pa skye ba'i gnyen po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gos la sogs pa la sred pa skye ba'i gnyen po'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the antidote to the craving for Dharma robes and so on.

original: thar pa'i phyir yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thar pa'i phyir yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Nor is it for the sake of liberation.

original: de dag grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are liberated.

original: smras pa / khyed ji ltar rab tu brtson zhes dris pa dang / smras pa ma rig pa spang ba'i phyir yang ma yin rig pa bskyed pa'i phyir yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ci las brtsams te smras she na /
analyzed: smras pa / khyed ji ltar rab tu brtson zhes dris pa dang / smras pa ma rig pa spang ba'i phyir yang ma yin rig pa bskyed pa'i phyir yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ci las brtsams te smras she na /
translated: It was asked, “How do you strive?” and they replied, “It is not for the sake of eliminating ignorance nor for the sake of generating knowledge.” What was the context of this question?

original: bzhi pa tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i dngos po'i dbang du byas so //
analyzed: bzhi pa tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i dngos po'i dbang du byas so //
translated: The fourth is from the point of view of the thing that is proper mental attention.

original: ma rig pa spang ba'i phyir ma yin pa ni ma rig pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa spang ba'i phyir ma yin pa ni ma rig pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: “It is not for the sake of eliminating ignorance” is from the point of view of nonafflicted ignorance.

original: nyan thos rnams la de kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la de kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because that ignorance occurs in śrāvakas.

original: ma rig pa bskyed pa'i phyir yang ma yin pa ni skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa bskyed pa'i phyir yang ma yin pa ni skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it that it produces ignorance, because that has already arisen.

original: smras pa khyed su'i nyan thos zhes dris pa dang / smras pa gang gis thob pa med cing mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa med de zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
analyzed: smras pa khyed su'i nyan thos zhes dris pa dang / smras pa gang gis thob pa med cing mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa med de zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
translated: When asked, “Whose śrāvakas are you?” they replied, “Those who have nothing to attain and nothing to fully awaken to.” What did they mean by that?

original: lnga pa gdams ngag gi dngos po'i dbang du byas pa ste //
analyzed: lnga pa gdams ngag gi dngos po'i dbang du byas pa ste //
translated: The fifth is from the perspective of the actual instructions.

original: dge slong gi gzugs su sprul pa gang gis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong gi gzugs su sprul pa gang gis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is for the sake of those who are to be guided by the emanations in the form of monks.

original: drug pa chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i dngos po ni don bcu'i dbang du byas par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: drug pa chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i dngos po ni don bcu'i dbang du byas par rig par bya ste /
translated: The sixth is the practice of the Dharma that accords with the Dharma. It should be understood from the perspective of ten topics.

original: phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang /
translated: the nirvana without remainder of the aggregates, the nirvana with remainder of the aggregates, the abandonment of afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing, the abandonment of afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation,

original: sdug bsngal spong ba dang / ston pa la phyir bya ba dang / sbyin bdag la lan glan pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i sa las shin tu 'das pa dang / 'phags pa'i sa la rab tu gnas pa dang / rnam par grol ba thun mong du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal spong ba dang / ston pa la phyir bya ba dang / sbyin bdag la lan glan pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i sa las shin tu 'das pa dang / 'phags pa'i sa la rab tu gnas pa dang / rnam par grol ba thun mong du gyur pa'o //
translated: the abandonment of suffering, the repayment of the teacher, the repayment of the benefactor, the transcendence of the stage of the non-ārya, the establishment in the stage of the ārya, and the attainment of common liberation.

original: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed kyi tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa gang zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
analyzed: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed kyi tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa gang zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
translated: They said, “Venerables, who are your companions in the practice of celibacy?” They replied,

original: gang dag khams gsum na mi rgyu ba dag go zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
analyzed: gang dag khams gsum na mi rgyu ba dag go zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
translated: “Those who do not move in the three realms.” What did they mean when they said this?

original: ma 'ongs pa ni phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The future is the nirvana without remainder of the aggregates.

original: dus de na mthun pa'i chos nyid kyis lhan cig 'grogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus de na mthun pa'i chos nyid kyis lhan cig 'grogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, the aggregates are not present because they have been extinguished by the power of the antidote.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed ji srid cig na yongs su mya ngan las 'da' zhes dris pa dang / @271b smras pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed ji srid cig na yongs su mya ngan las 'da' zhes dris pa dang / @271b smras pa /
translated: The questioner asked, “Venerable ones, when will you attain nirvana?”

original: nam de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba na'o zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
analyzed: nam de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba na'o zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
translated: They replied, “When the emanation of the Tathagata attains nirvana.”

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /🔽gzhan gyi dbang dang mthun pa'i chos kyis sngon gyi las kyis sprul pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste / gzhan gyi dbang dang mthun pa'i chos kyis sngon gyi las kyis sprul pa'i phyir te /
translated: This means that they will attain nirvana with remainder.🔽They will attain nirvana through the power of other conditions, because they are emanations of previous karma.

original: de'i 'phen pa zad pa'i zad na de las gzhan pa dag dang lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'phen pa zad pa'i zad na de las gzhan pa dag dang lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When the force of that karma is exhausted, they will attain nirvana without remainder.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed kyi nyon mongs pa zad dam zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed kyi nyon mongs pa zad dam zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
translated: The questioner asked, “Venerable ones, have you exhausted the defilements?”

original: chos thams cad shin tu zad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
analyzed: chos thams cad shin tu zad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
translated: What was the intention behind that statement?

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa ste /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa ste /
translated: It is the abandonment of the afflictions that are to be abandoned by means of the path of seeing.

original: chos thams cad shin tu zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad shin tu zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are utterly exhausted.

original: zhes bya ba ni ngan song ba rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngan song ba rnams so //
translated: Those who are in the lower realms.

original: smras pa / khyed kyis bya ba byas sam zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
analyzed: smras pa / khyed kyis bya ba byas sam zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
translated: He asked, “Have you done what you had to do?” They replied,

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa yongs su shes so zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa yongs su shes so zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
translated: “We have understood the view of the transitory collection.” What was the intention behind that statement?

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa ste /
translated: It is the abandonment of the afflictions that are to be abandoned by means of the path of cultivation.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba lhan cig skyes pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba lhan cig skyes pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the innate view of the transitory collection has been abandoned.

original: smras pa / khyed kyis bdud btul tam zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
analyzed: smras pa / khyed kyis bdud btul tam zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
translated: He asked, “Have you subdued the demons?” They replied,

original: phung po'i bdud mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
analyzed: phung po'i bdud mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
translated: “We have subdued the demon of the aggregates.” What was the intention behind that statement?

original: sdug bsngal spong ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal spong ba ste /
translated: The abandonment of suffering.

original: phung po'i bdud mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa na de'i skye ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po'i bdud mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa na de'i skye ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The demon of the aggregates is non-apprehension, because the future non-arising of the aggregates is non-apprehension.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdud thams cad 'dul bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdud thams cad 'dul bar rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that all demons are subdued,

original: phung po rnams med na de las gzhan pa'i bdud mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams med na de las gzhan pa'i bdud mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if the aggregates do not exist, no other demons can arise.🔽It was asked: “Have you served the Teacher?”

original: smras pa / khyed kyis ston pa'i g-yog byas sam zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
analyzed: smras pa / khyed kyis ston pa'i g-yog byas sam zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
translated: It was replied:

original: lus kyis kyang ma byas /
analyzed: lus kyis kyang ma byas /
translated: “Not with the body,

original: ngag gis kyang ma byas /
analyzed: ngag gis kyang ma byas /
translated: not with speech,🔽not with the mind.”

original: sems kyis kyang ma byas so zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
analyzed: sems kyis kyang ma byas so zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
translated: What was intended when this was said?

original: ston pa'i phyir bya ba ste /
analyzed: ston pa'i phyir bya ba ste /
translated: The Teacher is to be served by action,

original: lus la sogs pas ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: lus la sogs pas ni ma yin gyi /
translated: not by the body, etc.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa rtogs pas de'i g-yog byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa rtogs pas de'i g-yog byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: , but by realizing nirvana, one serves the Teacher.

original: smras pa / khyed kyis sbyin pa'i sa sbyangs sam zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
analyzed: smras pa / khyed kyis sbyin pa'i sa sbyangs sam zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
translated: It was asked: “Have you purified the stage of generosity?”

original: 'dzin pa med cing sdud pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa med cing sdud pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
translated: What was the Buddha thinking when he said, “There is no grasping and no letting go”?

original: sbyin bdag la lan glan pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin bdag la lan glan pa ste /
translated: He was responding to the questioner’s statement about the giver.

original: 'dzin pa med pa dang / sdud pa med pa ni lta ba dang 'jog pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba ste go rims bzhin no//
analyzed: 'dzin pa med pa dang / sdud pa med pa ni lta ba dang 'jog pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba ste go rims bzhin no//
translated: “No grasping” and “no letting go” mean freedom from the faults of attachment and rejection, respectively.

original: @272a * // smras pa /
analyzed: @272a * // smras pa /
translated: The Buddha said,

original: khyed cag 'khor ba las brgal tam zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
analyzed: khyed cag 'khor ba las brgal tam zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
translated: “Have you crossed over from cyclic existence?”

original: chad pa med cing rtag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
analyzed: chad pa med cing rtag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
translated: “Because there is no annihilation and no permanence.” What was the Buddha thinking when he said this?

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa'i sa las shin tu 'das pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa'i sa las shin tu 'das pa ste /
translated: He was referring to the fact that they had transcended the stage of being ordinary beings.

original: chad pa med pa ni 'khor ba bri bar ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chad pa med pa ni 'khor ba bri bar ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “No annihilation” means that they had not diminished cyclic existence.

original: rtag pa med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: rtag pa med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa'i phyir te //
translated: “No permanence” means that they had not made nirvana into something existent.

original: de dag gis ni 'bri ba med pa dang / 'phel ba med par bstan te //
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'bri ba med pa dang / 'phel ba med par bstan te //
translated: This shows that there is no diminution and no increase.

original: smras pa / khyed cag sbyin gnas kyi sar zhugs sam zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
analyzed: smras pa / khyed cag sbyin gnas kyi sar zhugs sam zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
translated: He said, “Have you entered the stage of the one who is worthy of offerings?”

original: 'dzin pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /
translated: What was the intention behind the statement, “Because we are completely liberated from all grasping”?

original: 'phags pa'i sa la rab tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i sa la rab tu gnas pa ste /
translated: They are completely liberated from all grasping because they have attained the stage of the noble ones.

original: 'dzin pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spangs pa ma byas kyi med pa la 'dzin pa tsam dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spangs pa ma byas kyi med pa la 'dzin pa tsam dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are completely liberated from all grasping because they are free from the mere grasping that is due to the nonexistence of what has not been relinquished.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa dag gar 'gro zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa dag gar 'gro zhes dris pa dang / smras pa /
translated: He said, “Venerable ones, where are you going?”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa gang du bzhud par ro zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na /🔽rnam par grol ba'i thun mong du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa gang du bzhud par ro zhes bya ba ci las bsams te de skad smras she na / rnam par grol ba'i thun mong du gyur pa ste /
translated: What was the intention behind the statement, “We are going to where the emanations of the Tathāgata are going”?🔽They are going to where the emanations of the Tathāgata are going because they are the same in terms of liberation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang bye brag med par de mthun pa'i chos kyi rnam par grol ba'i thun mong du gyur pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang bye brag med par de mthun pa'i chos kyi rnam par grol ba'i thun mong du gyur pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: They are the same in terms of liberation because they are not different from the Tathāgata. They are taught to be the same in terms of the Dharma of liberation that is in accord with him.

original: yang na rigs kyi bu yang dag pa'i bkas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba dag ni rnam grangs gang dang cis kyang bka' lung brda sprod de /
analyzed: yang na rigs kyi bu yang dag pa'i bkas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba dag ni rnam grangs gang dang cis kyang bka' lung brda sprod de /
translated: Or else, son of noble family, those whose minds are completely liberated by the true teaching know the meaning of the teachings by any method or means.

original: tshe dang ldan pa de dag gis ldem po dag tu smras pa ngag gis bka' lung brda sprod pa don chen por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa de dag gis ldem po dag tu smras pa ngag gis bka' lung brda sprod pa don chen por rig par bya'o //
translated: The venerable ones, with their indirect speech, should be known to teach the great meaning.

original: ldem po dag tu smras pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ldem po dag tu smras pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is indirect speech?

original: gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ye shes te /
translated: It is the wisdom of the characteristic of non-duality.

original: ldem po ngag thams cad la 'jug pa'o rgyu'o //
analyzed: ldem po ngag thams cad la 'jug pa'o rgyu'o //
translated: It is the cause for engaging in all indirect speech.

original: gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of non-duality?

original: gang brjod pa'i tshig gnas su gyur pa'i dngos po de yang ngo bo nyid med la /
analyzed: gang brjod pa'i tshig gnas su gyur pa'i dngos po de yang ngo bo nyid med la /
translated: The thing that is the basis for verbal expression is also without inherent nature.

original: brjod pas yongs su bsgos pa'i 'du shes kyi spyod yul ni ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pas yongs su bsgos pa'i 'du shes kyi spyod yul ni ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: The object of perception that is fully imbued with verbal expression is inherently existent, non-dual.

original: gnyis su med pa de la gnyis su mngon par zhen pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa de la gnyis su mngon par zhen pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Clinging to duality in that non-duality is defilement.

original: gnyis su med par zhen pa ni rnam par byang ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med par zhen pa ni rnam par byang ba'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of duality is purification.

original: brjod pa thams cad kyi tshig gi gnas su gyur ba'i dngos po de yang tha snyad kyi dngos pos yongs su bsgos pa'i 'du shes kyi spyod yul te ngo bo @272b nyid kyis yod pa'i phyir gnyis su med do //
analyzed: brjod pa thams cad kyi tshig gi gnas su gyur ba'i dngos po de yang tha snyad kyi dngos pos yongs su bsgos pa'i 'du shes kyi spyod yul te ngo bo @272b nyid kyis yod pa'i phyir gnyis su med do //
translated: That entity which is the basis of all verbal expressions is the domain of the perception of the conventional entity, because it exists by intrinsic reality, and so there is no duality.

original: gnyis su med pa de la /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa de la /
translated: In that non-duality,

original: gnyis su mngon par zhen pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su mngon par zhen pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: the apprehension of duality is defilement.

original: gnyis su med par zhen pa med pa ni rnam par byang ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med par zhen pa med pa ni rnam par byang ba'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of duality is purification.

original: de ltar na de ni gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar na de ni gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Thus, that is the characteristic of non-duality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ldem po ngag thams cad la 'jug par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ldem po ngag thams cad la 'jug par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be known that it is applied to all the indirect teachings of the Tathagatas.

original: de la ston pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga dang / des de'i gdams ngag gis btags pas 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa lnga dang / 'bras bu'i legs pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga la gnas nas ldem po ngag tu smras par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la ston pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga dang / des de'i gdams ngag gis btags pas 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa lnga dang / 'bras bu'i legs pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga la gnas nas ldem po ngag tu smras par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the teaching is spoken in an indirect manner when it is based on the five kinds of excellence of the teacher, the five kinds of excellence of the result of the teaching, and the five kinds of excellence of the result of the teaching.

original: ston pa'i phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: ston pa'i phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five kinds of excellence of the teacher?

original: gang gi phyir ston pa dang / ston pa gang yin pa dang / gang ston pa dang / ci ltar ston pa dang / gang la ston pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ston pa dang / ston pa gang yin pa dang / gang ston pa dang / ci ltar ston pa dang / gang la ston pa ste /
translated: The teacher, the one who teaches, what is taught, how it is taught, and to whom it is taught.

original: de'i phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir ston pa phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir ston pa phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The teacher is to be understood as excellent because of these excellences.

original: de gang gi phyir ston ce na /
analyzed: de gang gi phyir ston ce na /
translated: For what purpose does the teacher teach?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir ston pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir ston pa ste /
translated: He teaches in order to realize nirvana.

analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa gnyis kyis chos la bdag med par rab tu rtogs pa las brtsams te de skad smras so //

original: nang gi dgra las rnam par rgyal ba ni /
analyzed: nang gi dgra las rnam par rgyal ba ni /

analyzed: smras ba / khyed kyis nyon mongs pa zad dam /

original: smras pa / chos thams cad shin tu zad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / chos thams cad shin tu zad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa ste /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams ni nang gi yin pas chos @273b la bdag med par rab tu rtogs na shin tu zad pa las bsams te de skad smras so //
translated: The afflictions are inner enemies. He said this in terms of the utter exhaustion of the afflictions that comes from the complete understanding of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: phyi rol gyi dgra las rnam par rgyal ba ni /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dgra las rnam par rgyal ba ni /
translated: Victory over the outer enemy

original: smras pa / khyed kyis bdud btul lam /
analyzed: smras pa / khyed kyis bdud btul lam /
translated: He said, “Have you subdued the demons?”

original: smras pa / phung po'i bdud mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / phung po'i bdud mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: He said, “Because the demon of the aggregates is unobservable.”

original: phung po'i bdud mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang dag gis phyi rol gyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phung po de dag gis ni phyi rol gyi dgra'i sgrar rig par bya ste //
analyzed: phung po'i bdud mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang dag gis phyi rol gyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phung po de dag gis ni phyi rol gyi dgra'i sgrar rig par bya ste //
translated: The aggregates that are included in the external sense bases should be known as the external enemy.

original: de las rnam par rgyal ba ni kun du brtags pa'i phung po'i ngo bo nyid mi dmigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las rnam par rgyal ba ni kun du brtags pa'i phung po'i ngo bo nyid mi dmigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Victory over them is the non-perception of the imagined nature of the aggregates.

analyzed: de la 'bras bu'i legs pa phun sum tshogs pa ston pa la bsnyen bkur byed pa ni /
translated: There, the perfection of the excellence of the result is the service to the teacher who reveals it.

analyzed: smras pa / khyod kyis ston pa'i g-yog byas sam /

original: ngag gis kyang ma byas /
analyzed: ngag gis kyang ma byas /

original: sems kyis kyang ma byas zhes bya ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyis kyang ma byas zhes bya ba gang yin pa ste /

original: lus la sogs pas ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: lus la sogs pas ni ma yin gyi /

original: chos nyid kyis g-yog byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis g-yog byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but with the Dharma nature.

original: dad pas byin pa yongs su sbyangs par gyur ba ni smras pa /
analyzed: dad pas byin pa yongs su sbyangs par gyur ba ni smras pa /
translated: The purification of what is given with faith is said:

original: khyed kyis sbyin pa'i gnas kyis sbyangs sam /
analyzed: khyed kyis sbyin pa'i gnas kyis sbyangs sam /
translated: Have you purified the field of giving?

original: smras pa / 'dzin pa med cing sdud pa med pas so zhes bya ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dzin pa med cing sdud pa med pas so zhes bya ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: He said, “Because there is no grasping and no collecting.”

original: sbyin pa'i gnas kyis sbyangs pa ni chos thams cad mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gnas kyis sbyangs pa ni chos thams cad mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who is purified by being a recipient of gifts does not grasp any phenomena.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las rgal bar gyur pa ni smras pa /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las rgal bar gyur pa ni smras pa /
translated: The one who has crossed over the suffering of cyclic existence said,

original: khyed 'khor ba las brgal tam /
analyzed: khyed 'khor ba las brgal tam /
translated: “Have you crossed over cyclic existence?”

original: smras pa / chad pa med cing rtag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / chad pa med cing rtag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: He said, “Because there is no annihilation and no permanence.”

original: 'khor ba las rgal ba ni chos la bdag med pa la /
analyzed: 'khor ba las rgal ba ni chos la bdag med pa la /
translated: The one who has crossed over cyclic existence does not grasp at the selflessness of phenomena.

original: chad pa med cing rtag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chad pa med cing rtag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no annihilation and no permanence.

original: sbyin pa'i gnas kyi dngos po las yongs su mi nyams pa ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gnas kyi dngos po las yongs su mi nyams pa ni /
translated: The one who does not fall from the state of being a recipient of gifts

original: smras pa / khyed sbyin pa'i sar zhugs sam /
analyzed: smras pa / khyed sbyin pa'i sar zhugs sam /
translated: said, “Have you entered the ground of a recipient of gifts?”

original: smras pa / 'dzin pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dzin pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: He said, “Because of being liberated from all grasping.”

original: sbyin pa'i gnas kyi sar zhugs pa ni chos su 'dzin pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gnas kyi sar zhugs pa ni chos su 'dzin pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who has entered the ground of a recipient of gifts is liberated from grasping at phenomena.

original: chos kyis sprul pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sras yin no zhes de bzhin gshegs pa la brten pa ni /
analyzed: chos kyis sprul pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sras yin no zhes de bzhin gshegs pa la brten pa ni /
translated: The one who is based on the Tathagata

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa dag gar dong /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa dag gar dong /
translated: said, “Venerable ones, where are you going?”

original: smras pa / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa gang bzhud par ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa gang bzhud par ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: They said, “We are going where the emanation of the Tathagata is going.”

original: gang du yang mi 'gro ba'i phyir de bzhin @274a * //
analyzed: gang du yang mi 'gro ba'i phyir de bzhin @274a * //
translated: Because he does not go anywhere,

original: gshegs pa'i sbrul pa byon pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gshegs pa'i sbrul pa byon pa lta bu'o //
translated: he is like the emanation of the Tathagata.

original: de ltar tshe dang ldan par ba 'byor gyis kun dris te /
analyzed: de ltar tshe dang ldan par ba 'byor gyis kun dris te /
translated: In this way, the Venerable Subhuti asked questions,

analyzed: dge slong de dag gis lan btab nas 'khor de'i dge slong brgyad brgya ni len pa med par zag pa rnams las rnam par grol lo //
translated: and after the monks gave their answers, the eighty monks in that assembly were liberated from the defilements without further appropriation.🔽And thirty-two thousand living beings purified the stainless and immaculate Dharma-eye regarding phenomena.

original: srogs chags sum khri nyis stong gis ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul dang bral zhing dri ma med par rnam par dag go zhas bya ba ni bka' lung brda sprod par 'di'i don chen po ste /
analyzed: srogs chags sum khri nyis stong gis ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul dang bral zhing dri ma med par rnam par dag go zhas bya ba ni bka' lung brda sprod par 'di'i don chen po ste /
translated: This is the great meaning of the transmission of the Buddha’s words.

original: 'di ni slob pa dang mi slob pa thob par byed pa so so'i skye bo yongs su ma smin pa rnams slob par 'dod pa dang / yongs su smin pa rnams mi slob pa thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni slob pa dang mi slob pa thob par byed pa so so'i skye bo yongs su ma smin pa rnams slob par 'dod pa dang / yongs su smin pa rnams mi slob pa thob par byed pa'o //
translated: This is the ripening of the individual who has not yet fully matured, who is a learner, who wishes to learn, and who is a learner who has fully matured, who is a non-learner, and who is one who causes the attainment of the non-learner.

translated: Then the venerable Mahākāśyapa said this to the Lord:🔽“To the extent that this Dharma discourse of the Great Heap of Jewels is helpful to sons of good family or daughters of good family who have entered the Great Vehicle,

analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la phan 'dogs par gyur pa ni bcom ldan 'das ngo mtshar to //

original: bde bar gshegs pa ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba 'di man chad kyis ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa'i don chen po ste /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba 'di man chad kyis ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa'i don chen po ste /
translated: From here onward, the great purpose of explaining this Dharma discourse is

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos dang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba sgrub pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phan 'dogs par gyur pa ste /
