original: dbu ma'i lam dang gdams ngag go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam dang gdams ngag go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The middle way and the precepts are to be applied in order.

original: bcom ldan 'das dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di las tshigs su bcad pa gcig tsam bstan na rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo de la bsod nams ji tsam skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi🔽gdams ngag la mos pa'i legs pa dri ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di las tshigs su bcad pa gcig tsam bstan na rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo de la bsod nams ji tsam skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi gdams ngag la mos pa'i legs pa dri ba'o //
translated: The question, Blessed One, if a single verse from this Dharma discourse of the Great Heap of Jewels were taught, how much merit would be produced for that son or daughter of family? is the question about the excellence of the aspiration for the bodhisattva canon.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'od srungs chen po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'od srungs chen po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said to the venerable Mahākāśyapa, Kāśyapa, if a son or daughter of family were to fill this entire billion-world cosmic system with the seven precious substances and offer it as a gift to the Tathāgata, would that son or daughter of family generate much merit?

original: 'od srungs rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo la las 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rin po che sna bdun gyis rab tu gang bar byas te /
analyzed: 'od srungs rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo la las 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rin po che sna bdun gyis rab tu gang bar byas te /
translated: Kāśyapa, if a son or daughter of good lineage were to fill with the seven kinds of jewels as many world-realms as there are sand particles in the Gaṅga river, and were to give them as a gift to the Buddhas, the Lords and their retinues, and if another🔽were to take up this perfection of wisdom, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig 'di dag ni rnam pa lngas mos pa'i legs pa yongs su ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig 'di dag ni rnam pa lngas mos pa'i legs pa yongs su ston to //
translated: These words show the excellence of devotion in five aspects:

original: zhing dang / rten dang / dus chen po dang / phyug po'i bdag por 'gyur ba'i @274b rgyu zil gyis gnon pa dang / lus 'gyur ba dang / de la gnas pa'i yul snod du bya ba dang / chad pa snod du bya ba dang /
analyzed: zhing dang / rten dang / dus chen po dang / phyug po'i bdag por 'gyur ba'i @274b rgyu zil gyis gnon pa dang / lus 'gyur ba dang / de la gnas pa'i yul snod du bya ba dang / chad pa snod du bya ba dang /
translated: the excellence of the field, the excellence of the basis, the excellence of the time, the excellence of the cause, which is the mastery of great wealth, the excellence of the transformation of the body, the excellence of the place where one dwells, the excellence of the vessel for punishment,

original: lus 'dor ba'i dus na mthong ba dang / las rnam par dag pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: lus 'dor ba'i dus na mthong ba dang / las rnam par dag pa mthong ba'o //
translated: the excellence of the vision at the time of casting off the body, and the excellence of the purification of karma.

original: de la zhing chen po ni sangs rgyas rnams dang / de'i nyan thos rnams dang / mchod rten rnams so //
analyzed: de la zhing chen po ni sangs rgyas rnams dang / de'i nyan thos rnams dang / mchod rten rnams so //
translated: The great field is the Buddhas, their disciples, and the stupas.

original: rten pa ni rin po ches gang ba'i khams dang / chos gos la sogs pa'o /
analyzed: rten pa ni rin po ches gang ba'i khams dang / chos gos la sogs pa'o /
translated: The basis is the realm filled with jewels, the robes, etc.

original: dus ni bskal pa grangs med pa'o //
analyzed: dus ni bskal pa grangs med pa'o //
translated: Time is countless eons.

original: de rnam pa la phyug pa'i bdag por 'gyur ba'i rgyu zil gyis gnon par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnam pa la phyug pa'i bdag por 'gyur ba'i rgyu zil gyis gnon par rig par bya'o //
translated: The cause of becoming a lord of generosity should be understood as being the surpassing of others.🔽The cause of becoming a lord of generosity should be understood as being the surpassing of others in five ways:

original: dpag tu yod pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i 'bras bu la ltos pa dang / zad pa dang / mi zad pa'i chos nyid dang / bde ba rgya chen por ma yin pa dang / rgya chen por sgrub par byed pa dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dang /🔽de'i ngo bo nyid dang / des de sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpag tu yod pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i 'bras bu la ltos pa dang / zad pa dang / mi zad pa'i chos nyid dang / bde ba rgya chen por ma yin pa dang / rgya chen por sgrub par byed pa dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dang / de'i ngo bo nyid dang / des de sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in having a great result, in having a result that is both measurable and immeasurable, in having a result that is both perishable and imperishable, in establishing both a great happiness and a happiness that is not great, and in having a result that is both timely and untimely.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa lngas phyug pa'i bdag por gyur pa'i rgyu zil gyis gnon par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa lngas phyug pa'i bdag por gyur pa'i rgyu zil gyis gnon par rig par bya ste /
translated: The cause of becoming a lord of generosity should be understood as being the surpassing of others in five ways:🔽in having a great result, in having a result that is both measurable and immeasurable, in having a result that is both perishable and imperishable, in establishing both a great happiness and a happiness that is not great, and in having a result that is both timely and untimely.

original: bde ba chung ba'i rgyu dang / bde bar gcig tu nges pa med pa'i rgyu dang / shin tu bde ba ma yin pa'i rgyu dang / phyin ci log tu spyod pa bde ba'i rgyu dang / sdug bsngal pa'i lus kyi yongs su spyod pa bde ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //🔽de ni 'od srungs rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la las 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rin po che sna bdun gyis rab tu gang bar byas te /
analyzed: bde ba chung ba'i rgyu dang / bde bar gcig tu nges pa med pa'i rgyu dang / shin tu bde ba ma yin pa'i rgyu dang / phyin ci log tu spyod pa bde ba'i rgyu dang / sdug bsngal pa'i lus kyi yongs su spyod pa bde ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro // de ni 'od srungs rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la las 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rin po che sna bdun gyis rab tu gang bar byas te /
translated: because it is the cause of little happiness, the cause of the absence of certainty in happiness, the cause of great unhappiness, the cause of the enjoyment of the opposite of happiness, and the cause of the enjoyment of a suffering body.🔽“Kāśyapa, suppose a son or daughter of good family were to fill with the seven precious substances as many world-realms as there are sand-grains in the Ganges River, and give them as a gift to the Tathāgatas, the Saints, the genuinely and fully awake Buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la sbyin pa byin pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa re re'i gtsug lag khang gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed brtsigs pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la sbyin pa byin pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa re re'i gtsug lag khang gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed brtsigs pa dang /
translated: And suppose he were to build for each of those Tathāgatas as many monasteries as there are sand-grains in the Ganges River,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa re re'i nyan thos rnams kyi dge 'dun dpag tu med pa dag la bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis rim gror🔽byas pa dang / de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de dag gi mchod rten rin po che sna bdun las byas ba bas ni rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang gis dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di las tshigs @275a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa re re'i nyan thos rnams kyi dge 'dun dpag tu med pa dag la bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis rim gror byas pa dang / de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de dag gi mchod rten rin po che sna bdun las byas ba bas ni rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang gis dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di las tshigs @275a * //
translated: It is better to teach a single verse from this Dharma discourse of the Heap of Jewels than to serve with all necessities of happiness for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges River the saṅgha of countless śrāvakas of each of the tathāgatas, the blessed buddhas equal to the sands of the Ganges River, and to make stūpas of the seven precious substances for them after they have passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: su bcad pa gcig tsam bstan te /
analyzed: su bcad pa gcig tsam bstan te /
translated: If a son or daughter of good family teaches just a single verse from this Dharma discourse of the Heap of Jewels,

original: bstan nas mi sbong na de ni de bas bsod nams ches mang du bskyed do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan nas mi sbong na de ni de bas bsod nams ches mang du bskyed do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and having taught it does not abandon it, they will create even more merit than that.”

original: bud med gang la la zhig la bstan na de nam du yang log par ltung bar mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: bud med gang la la zhig la bstan na de nam du yang log par ltung bar mi 'gro ste /
translated: If it is taught to any woman, she will never fall into a negative existence.

original: de nyid de'i bud med kyi lus kyi tha ma'o zhes bya ba ni lus 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid de'i bud med kyi lus kyi tha ma'o zhes bya ba ni lus 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is the end of her female body.

original: sa phyogs gang du chos kyi rnams grangs 'di bshad pa 'am /
analyzed: sa phyogs gang du chos kyi rnams grangs 'di bshad pa 'am /
translated: The place where this Dharma discourse is explained,

original: bstan pa 'am /🔽yi ger 'dri ba 'am /
analyzed: bstan pa 'am / yi ger 'dri ba 'am /
translated: taught,🔽written down,

original: glegs bam du byas te /
analyzed: glegs bam du byas te /
translated: or made into a book🔽and placed, that place becomes a shrine for the world with its gods.

original: gzhag pa'i sa phyogs de lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi mchod rten du gyur ba yin no zhes gang gsungs pa de ni de gnas pa'i yul snod du bya'o //🔽smras pa / gang las thob pa dang / yi ger 'dri ba de las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhag pa'i sa phyogs de lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi mchod rten du gyur ba yin no zhes gang gsungs pa de ni de gnas pa'i yul snod du bya'o // smras pa / gang las thob pa dang / yi ger 'dri ba de las 'di lta ste /
translated: It is said that the place where it is should be made into a vessel.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la gus par bya ba bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la gus par bya ba bzhin du bya'o //
translated: It is said: “One should act in this way toward the one from whom it is obtained and who writes it down, as if it were the Tathāgata himself.

original: 'od srungs rigs kyi bu 'am /
analyzed: 'od srungs rigs kyi bu 'am /
translated: Kāśyapa, a son or daughter of good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos smra ba la bkur sti byed pa dang / btsun par byed pa dang ; rim gror byed pa dang / mchod par byed pa de la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos smra ba la bkur sti byed pa dang / btsun par byed pa dang ; rim gror byed pa dang / mchod par byed pa de la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
translated: The one who honors, venerates, respects, and worships the Dharma teacher of the Tathāgatas will be predicted to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa ni 'chad pa snod du bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa ni 'chad pa snod du bya ba'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the vessel.

original: 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe na yang /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe na yang /
translated: At the time of death,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: one will see the Tathāgatas,

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las yangs su dag pa thab par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lus 'dor ba'i dus na mthong ba rnam par dag pa dang / las rnam par dag pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las yangs su dag pa thab par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lus 'dor ba'i dus na mthong ba rnam par dag pa dang / las rnam par dag pa thob pa'o //
translated: and the karma of body, speech, and mind will be purified. This is the attainment of pure vision and pure karma at the time of leaving the body.

original: lus kyi las yongs su dag pa bcu 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus kyi las yongs su dag pa bcu 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: One will attain ten kinds of pure bodily karma.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: zhes gang gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa ni /
translated: As stated,

original: lus 'dor ba'i dus nyid na /
analyzed: lus 'dor ba'i dus nyid na /
translated: at the time of leaving the body,

original: rnam par dag pa 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa 'thob pa'o //
translated: one attains purity.

original: tshor bas sems kun du ma zin par 'chi ba'i dus byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshor bas sems kun du ma zin par 'chi ba'i dus byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Death without the mind being overwhelmed by feelings.🔽

original: tshor ba mya ngan gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir mya ngan gyis zil gyis ma non pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba mya ngan gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir mya ngan gyis zil gyis ma non pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Death without the mind being overwhelmed by feelings” means that there is no sorrow because there is no cause for sorrow.

original: de'i mig 'khrul par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dris pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mig 'khrul par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dris pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “His eyes do not become confused” means that he is fully aware of what is familiar.

original: lag pa g-yob par mi byed pa dang / rkang pa phra bar mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lag pa g-yob par mi byed pa dang / rkang pa phra bar mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “He does not wave his arms or drag his feet” means that his deportment is perfect.

original: ngan skyugs mi 'byung ba dang / gcin mi stor ba dang / da'i snying khar rdul mi 'byung zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan skyugs mi 'byung ba dang / gcin mi stor ba dang / da'i snying khar rdul mi 'byung zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “He does not defecate, urinate, or drool” means that he is fearless.

original: khu tshur ma 'chang ba dang / @275b nam mkha' la mi bsnyegs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khu tshur ma 'chang ba dang / @275b nam mkha' la mi bsnyegs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “He does not clench his fists or reach up to the sky” means that

original: 'chi ba'i ltas kyi nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i ltas kyi nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: he has no bad omens of death.

original: ji ltar 'dug pa de bzhin du tshe'i 'du byed 'dor bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lus las su rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dug pa de bzhin du tshe'i 'du byed 'dor bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lus las su rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase just as they are, they will cast off the composition of life means that the body becomes fit for action.

original: lus kyi las yongs su dag pa bcu po de dag 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyi las yongs su dag pa bcu po de dag 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One attains these ten forms of pure physical action.

original: de la lus kyi tshul nyes pa drug spangs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la lus kyi tshul nyes pa drug spangs par rig par bya ste /
translated: Here, it should be understood that one abandons six kinds of physical misconduct.

original: nyes pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six kinds of misconduct?

original: dang pos ni mya ngan gyi nyes pa'o //
analyzed: dang pos ni mya ngan gyi nyes pa'o //
translated: The first is the misconduct of sorrow.

original: gnyis pas ni 'dris pa yongs su mi shes pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni 'dris pa yongs su mi shes pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The second is the misconduct of not knowing intimacy.

original: gsum pa dang / bzhi pas ni spyod yul gyi nyes pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa dang / bzhi pas ni spyod yul gyi nyes pa'o //
translated: The third and fourth are the misconduct of the range of activity.

original: lnga pa dang / drug pa dang / bdun pa dag gis ni 'jigs pa'i mtshan ma'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pa dang / drug pa dang / bdun pa dag gis ni 'jigs pa'i mtshan ma'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The fifth, sixth, and seventh are the misconduct of the signs of fear.

original: brgyad pa dang / dgu pas ni 'chi ba'i ltas kyi nyes pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa dang / dgu pas ni 'chi ba'i ltas kyi nyes pa'o //
translated: The eighth and ninth are the misconduct of the signs of death.

original: bcu pas ni lus las su mi rung ba'i nyes pa ste /
analyzed: bcu pas ni lus las su mi rung ba'i nyes pa ste /
translated: The tenth is the misconduct of the unfitness of the body.

original: de dag ni nyes pa drug go //
analyzed: de dag ni nyes pa drug go //
translated: These are the six kinds of misconduct.

original: ngag gi las yongs su dag pa bcu thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngag gi las yongs su dag pa bcu thob par 'gyur te /
translated: One attains ten forms of pure verbal action.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gdangs snyan pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gdangs snyan pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni /
translated: Speech of sweet sound means

original: 'jigs pas brtags pa'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pas brtags pa'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that it is free from the fault of being unintelligible due to fear.

original: mnyen pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: mnyen pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni /
translated: Speech of gentleness means

original: rtsub pa'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsub pa'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that it is free from the fault of being harsh.

original: 'jam pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni tshig 'jam pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi bka' brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jam pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni tshig 'jam pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi bka' brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Speech of softness means that the speech of the Blessed Buddhas is soft, because it expresses the Buddha's teachings.

original: dga' ba'i tshig ces bya ba ni stong pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba'i tshig ces bya ba ni stong pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Speech of delight means that it expresses emptiness.

original: snum pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni chos dang mthun pa'i brjod pa 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snum pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni chos dang mthun pa'i brjod pa 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Speech of oiliness means that it expresses what is in accord with the Dharma.

original: ma 'chal pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni dran pa nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzung bar 'os pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni tshig snga phyi mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'chal pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni dran pa nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro // gzung bar 'os pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni tshig snga phyi mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Speech of non-defilement means that it is free from the fault of forgetfulness.🔽Speech worthy of being grasped means that it is free from the fault of contradiction between earlier and later statements.

original: mnyan par 'os pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni rigs pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyan par 'os pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni rigs pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Speech worthy of being listened to means that it is free from the fault of being unreasonable.

original: lhas yongs su gzung ba'i tshig ces bya ba ni bstan pa la dang pa'i lhas yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhas yongs su gzung ba'i tshig ces bya ba ni bstan pa la dang pa'i lhas yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase protected by the gods means that they are protected by the gods who have faith in the teaching.

original: sangs rgyas kyis yongs su gzung zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su gzung ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis yongs su gzung zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su gzung ba ste /
translated: The phrase protected by the Buddha means that they are protected by the Tathagata.

original: ngag gi las yongs su dag pa bcu po de dag rab tu 'thob po //
analyzed: ngag gi las yongs su dag pa bcu po de dag rab tu 'thob po //
translated: They attain ten kinds of purity of speech.

original: rab tu dga' ba byed pa'i dus na ngag gi tshul nyes pa lnga rnam par spangs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba byed pa'i dus na ngag gi tshul nyes pa lnga rnam par spangs par rig par bya ste /
translated: The phrase they cause great joy means that they abandon the five faults of speech.

original: nyes pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five faults?

original: dang pos ni 'jigs pas brtabs pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: dang pos ni 'jigs pas brtabs pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The first is the fault of fear.

original: gnyis pas ni rtsub pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni rtsub pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The second is the fault of harshness.

original: gsum pas ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' bor te rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin pa'i brjod pa'i nyes @276a * //
analyzed: gsum pas ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' bor te rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin pa'i brjod pa'i nyes @276a * //
translated: The third is the fault of abandoning the Buddha's word and using the expressions of those who are not fully enlightened.

original: pa'o ; / bzhi pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa la bstod pa mi byed pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / bzhi pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa la bstod pa mi byed pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the fault of not praising the Tathagata.

original: lnga pas ni chos dang mthun pas mi bsgo ba'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pas ni chos dang mthun pas mi bsgo ba'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The fifth is the fault of not giving advice in accord with the Dharma.

original: bka' lung brda sprod pa'i dus na ngag gi tshul nyes ba rnam pa lnga spangs te /
analyzed: bka' lung brda sprod pa'i dus na ngag gi tshul nyes ba rnam pa lnga spangs te /
translated: When the transmission of the scriptures is being explained, one should avoid five faults of speech.

original: nyes pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five faults?

original: drug pas ni rtogs par bya ba la dran pa nyams pa'i nyes pa'o ;
analyzed: drug pas ni rtogs par bya ba la dran pa nyams pa'i nyes pa'o ;
translated: The sixth is the fault of forgetting what is to be understood.

original: / bdun pas ni tshig snga phyi 'gal ba'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: / bdun pas ni tshig snga phyi 'gal ba'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The seventh is the fault of contradiction between earlier and later words.

original: brgyad pas ni rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad pas ni rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The eighth is the fault of contradiction with reason.

original: dgu pas ni bstan pa la dga' ba'i lha mi dga' ba'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: dgu pas ni bstan pa la dga' ba'i lha mi dga' ba'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The ninth is the fault of dismaying the gods and humans who delight in the teaching.

original: bcu pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa mi mnyes pa'i nyes pa ste /
analyzed: bcu pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa mi mnyes pa'i nyes pa ste /
translated: The tenth is the fault of dismaying the Tathagatas.

original: de dag ni dus gnyis kyi ngag gi nyes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni dus gnyis kyi ngag gi nyes pa'o //
translated: These are the faults of speech in the two times.

original: yid kyi las yongs su dag pa bcu thob ste /
analyzed: yid kyi las yongs su dag pa bcu thob ste /
translated: One obtains ten purities of mental activity.

original: bcu gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the ten? They are as follows:

original: khro bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i gnod pa byed pa la ci mi snyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khro bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i gnod pa byed pa la ci mi snyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “One does not become angry” because one is indifferent to present harm.

original: khon du 'dzin pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa na gnod pa byas pa la ci mi snyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khon du 'dzin pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa na gnod pa byas pa la ci mi snyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “He does not hold grudges” means that he does not brood over past wrongs.

original: 'chab par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi 'chab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chab par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi 'chab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “He does not conceal his faults” means that he does not hide his sins.

original: 'tshig par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /🔽'gyod pas yongs su gdung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'tshig par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni / 'gyod pas yongs su gdung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “He does not get angry” means that he does not get upset.

original: nyes pa la mi dga' ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i longs spyod 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa la mi dga' ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i longs spyod 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “He does not delight in wrongdoing” means that he does not want to enjoy sensual pleasures.

original: 'khon par mi dga' zhes bya ba ni dgrar 'gyur ba la mi dga' ba'i phyir ro //🔽'du shes phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'khon par mi dga' zhes bya ba ni dgrar 'gyur ba la mi dga' ba'i phyir ro // 'du shes phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “He does not delight in hostility” means that he does not want to be hostile.

original: bslab pa'i gnas rnams la lta ba ngan pas yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //🔽spong ba la bag yod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gnas rnams la lta ba ngan pas yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro // spong ba la bag yod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “He does not have distorted perceptions” means that he does not grasp at bad views about the precepts.

original: spong ba sems ma 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spong ba sems ma 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “He is heedful in abandoning” means that he does not confuse the mental states of abandonment.

original: ma zhum pa'i sems kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa 'dzin par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bdag yi ma bsad par sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rgya chen po yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma zhum pa'i sems kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa 'dzin par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bdag yi ma bsad par sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rgya chen po yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: With an undaunted mind, they will take up the purification of the buddhaverse.🔽They will attain the concentration that accomplishes all the qualities of the buddhas, without pride or the conceit of thinking they are great.🔽They will attain the concentration that accomplishes all the qualities of the buddhas, without pride or the conceit of thinking they are great.

original: nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal med par sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon par sgrub pa'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu 'thob ces bya ba la nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal med ces bya ba ni /🔽'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa bsam pa phra mos kyang khyad par du 'phags so snyam pa'i rlom sems med de /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal med par sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon par sgrub pa'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu 'thob ces bya ba la nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal med ces bya ba ni /🔽'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa bsam pa phra mos kyang khyad par du 'phags so snyam pa'i rlom sems med de /
translated: They will attain the concentration that accomplishes all the qualities of the buddhas, without pride or the conceit of thinking they are great.

original: de 'dod pa med pas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon par sgrub pa'i rgyu chos thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu 'thob @276b pa'o ;
analyzed: de 'dod pa med pas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon par sgrub pa'i rgyu chos thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu 'thob @276b pa'o ;
translated: Since they do not desire those, they attain the concentration that is superior to all phenomena, the cause for accomplishing all the qualities of a buddha.

original: / de la yid kyi tshul nyes pa lnga spangs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: / de la yid kyi tshul nyes pa lnga spangs par rig par bya ste /
translated: The five faults of the mind should be understood as follows.

original: 'di ltar bzhi po dag ni tshe 'di'i don las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bzhi po dag ni tshe 'di'i don las brtsams pa'o //
translated: The first four are in terms of the aims of this life.

original: lnga pas ni tshe rabs gzhan las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pas ni tshe rabs gzhan las brtsams pa'o //
translated: The fifth is in terms of other lives.

original: nyes pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five faults?

original: dang po dang gnyis pas ni mi bzod pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: dang po dang gnyis pas ni mi bzod pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The first and second are the fault of impatience.

original: gsum pa dang bzhi pas ni sdig pa 'chab pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa dang bzhi pas ni sdig pa 'chab pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The third and fourth are the fault of concealing evil.

original: lnga pa dang drug pas ni 'dod pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pa dang drug pas ni 'dod pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The fifth and sixth are the fault of desire.

original: bdun pa dang / brgyad pas ni dran pa nyams pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: bdun pa dang / brgyad pas ni dran pa nyams pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The seventh and eighth are the fault of impaired mindfulness.

original: dgu pa dang bcu pas ni smon lam gyi nyes pa ste /
analyzed: dgu pa dang bcu pas ni smon lam gyi nyes pa ste /
translated: The ninth and tenth are the fault of aspiration.

original: de dag ni nyes pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de dag ni nyes pa lnga'o //
translated: Those are the five faults.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sde snod kyi gdams ngag la mos pa'i legs pa dpag tu med /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sde snod kyi gdams ngag la mos pa'i legs pa dpag tu med /
translated: The bodhisattva's interest in the instructions of the scriptural collections is immeasurable and infinite.

original: grangs med pa bas de'i rnam par 'byed pa'i bstan pa rnam par 'byed pa la mos pa'i legs pa ches dpag tu med cing grangs med par reg par bya'o //
analyzed: grangs med pa bas de'i rnam par 'byed pa'i bstan pa rnam par 'byed pa la mos pa'i legs pa ches dpag tu med cing grangs med par reg par bya'o //
translated: His interest in the teaching that analyzes the differentiation of those is immeasurable and infinite.

original: 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe sgrub pa don chen por ston pa /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe sgrub pa don chen por ston pa /
translated: At the time of death, the practice is of great benefit.

original: slob dpon gyi chos kyi bdag pos rnam pa gzhan gyis brjod do //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi chos kyi bdag pos rnam pa gzhan gyis brjod do //
translated: The master Dharmapala explains it in another way.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bas dge bar 'chi ba dang / bde bar 'chi ba dang bde 'gro'i 'chi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bas dge bar 'chi ba dang / bde bar 'chi ba dang bde 'gro'i 'chi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the virtuous death of seeing the Tathagata, the happy death, and the death in a good realm.

original: las gsum rnam par dag pa la /
analyzed: las gsum rnam par dag pa la /
translated: In the purification of the three actions,

original: lus kyi las yongs su dag pa las gcig gis ni mya ngan gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa ston to //
analyzed: lus kyi las yongs su dag pa las gcig gis ni mya ngan gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa ston to //
translated: by the purification of the bodily action, he shows the joyfulness of the stage of joy, because there is no cause for sorrow.

original: gnyis pas ni so sor mngon par shes pa'i phyir dran pa nyams pa med par ston to //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni so sor mngon par shes pa'i phyir dran pa nyams pa med par ston to //
translated: By the second, he shows the absence of loss of mindfulness, because of the direct perception of each.

original: gsum pa dang bzhi pas ni rkang lag mi g-yo ba'i phyir gnad du gnod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa dang bzhi pas ni rkang lag mi g-yo ba'i phyir gnad du gnod pa med pa'o //
translated: The third and fourth are not harmful to the vital parts, because the hands and feet do not move.

original: lnga pa dang drug pa dang bdun pa rnams kyis ni ngan skyugs la sogs pa med pas 'jigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pa dang drug pa dang bdun pa rnams kyis ni ngan skyugs la sogs pa med pas 'jigs pa med pa'o //
translated: The fifth, sixth, and seventh are fearless, because there is no vomit, etc.

original: brgyad pa dang dgu pas ni khu tshur 'chad pa la sogs pa med pas 'chi ba'i ltas med pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa dang dgu pas ni khu tshur 'chad pa la sogs pa med pas 'chi ba'i ltas med pa'o //
translated: The eighth and ninth are not signs of death, because there is no breaking of the fists, etc.

original: bcu pas ni nyam chung ba med pas 'dug bzhin du tsho'i 'du byed dag 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: bcu pas ni nyam chung ba med pas 'dug bzhin du tsho'i 'du byed dag 'dor ba'o //
translated: The tenth is the casting off of the life force while sitting, because there is no weakness.

original: ngag gi las yongs su dag pa brgyad po dag gis ni tshig gcom chung ba ma yin pa dang / tshig rgyun chad pa ma yin pa dang / tshig skad zhom pa ma yin pa dang / tshig rtsub pa ma yin pa dang / tshig 'khrug pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: ngag gi las yongs su dag pa brgyad po dag gis ni tshig gcom chung ba ma yin pa dang / tshig rgyun chad pa ma yin pa dang / tshig skad zhom pa ma yin pa dang / tshig rtsub pa ma yin pa dang / tshig 'khrug pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: By the eight purities of speech, one teaches with words that are not weak, not interrupted, not slurred, not harsh, not agitated,

original: tshig 'khrul pa ma yin pa dang / chos dang ldan pa'i tshig tu ston to //
analyzed: tshig 'khrul pa ma yin pa dang / chos dang ldan pa'i tshig tu ston to //
translated: not confused, and endowed with the Dharma.

original: dgu pa dang bcu pas ni tshul 'chos pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: dgu pa dang bcu pas ni tshul 'chos pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The ninth and tenth are words that are not hypocritical and not boastful.

original: bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang phrad pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //🔽yid kyi las yongs su dag pa rnams las bskyod pa dang / gleng ba dang / smon pa'i dbang @277a * //
analyzed: bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang phrad pa'i dbang du byas pa'o // yid kyi las yongs su dag pa rnams las bskyod pa dang / gleng ba dang / smon pa'i dbang @277a * //
translated: and the power of going to good destinies and of encountering the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: du byas te gnyis gnyis su rig par bya'o //🔽de la nyes pa la mi dga' ba ni 'dod pa la mi smod pa'i phyir ro //🔽'khon la mi dga' ba ni phyir rgol ba'i dngos po mi tshol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du byas te gnyis gnyis su rig par bya'o // de la nyes pa la mi dga' ba ni 'dod pa la mi smod pa'i phyir ro // 'khon la mi dga' ba ni phyir rgol ba'i dngos po mi tshol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The power of the pure mental actions is to be known as twofold, in terms of the power of the will and of the power of the vow.🔽The power of the pure moral rules is one.🔽The power of the pure patience is one.🔽The power of the pure vigor is one.

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas nas gcig go //🔽rnam par g-yeng ba'i dbang du byas nas spong ba la bag yod pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas nas gcig go // rnam par g-yeng ba'i dbang du byas nas spong ba la bag yod pa'o //
translated: The power of the pure meditation is one.🔽The power of the pure wisdom is one.🔽The power of the pure means is one.🔽The power of the pure thought is one.🔽The power of the pure field is one.🔽The power of the pure prayer is one.

original: zhing yongs su dag par skyes te bag tshab med pa'i dbang du byas nas gcig go //
analyzed: zhing yongs su dag par skyes te bag tshab med pa'i dbang du byas nas gcig go //
translated: The power of the pure performance is one.🔽The power of the pure great mercy is one.🔽The power of the pure great compassion is one.🔽The power of the pure great joy is one.🔽The power of the pure great equanimity is one.🔽The power of the pure knowledge of the past is one.🔽The power of the pure knowledge of the future is one.🔽The power of the pure knowledge of the present is one.🔽The power of the pure knowledge of the Dharma is one.🔽The power of the pure knowledge of reasoning is one.🔽The power of the pure knowledge of language is one.🔽The power of the pure knowledge of the various kinds of eloquence is one.🔽The power of the pure knowledge of the various kinds of confidence is one.🔽The power of the pure knowledge of the various kinds of miracles is one.🔽The power of the pure knowledge of the various kinds of supernormal faculties is one.🔽The power of the pure knowledge of the various kinds of liberations is one.🔽The power of the pure knowledge of the various kinds of concentrations is one.🔽The power of the pure knowledge of the various kinds of meditative absorptions is one.🔽The power of the pure knowledge of the various kinds of meditative stabilizations is one.🔽The power of the pure knowledge of the various kinds of retentions is one.🔽The power of the pure knowledge of the various kinds of vehicles is one.🔽The power of the pure knowledge of the various kinds of faculties is one.🔽The power of the pure knowledge of the various kinds of aspirations is one.🔽The power of the pure knowledge of the various kinds of characters is one.🔽The power of the pure knowledge of the various kinds of dispositions is one.🔽The power of the pure

original: nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal gyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / bdag yongs su 'jal ba dang / de dang der sbyor ba mthun pa'i dbang du byas nas gcig go //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal gyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / bdag yongs su 'jal ba dang / de dang der sbyor ba mthun pa'i dbang du byas nas gcig go //
translated: The first two verses show the worship of the bodhisattvas by means of the worship of the Dharma, and the last two verses show the worship of the bodhisattvas by means of material worship.🔽The first verse shows the worship of the Dharma by means of the worship of the scriptures, and the second shows the worship of the Dharma by means of the worship of the teaching.🔽The first verse shows the worship of the scriptures by means of the worship of the words, and the second shows the worship of the scriptures by means of the worship of the meaning.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis ni zang zing gi mchod pa bya bas chog par 'dzin pa rnams yongs su gzung ba'i mchod pa bya ba la gzung ba ste /🔽'od srungs gang la la zhig bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis dal bkur sti byed par 'dod pa dang / mchod pa thams cad kyis mchod par 'dod pa des /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis ni zang zing gi mchod pa bya bas chog par 'dzin pa rnams yongs su gzung ba'i mchod pa bya ba la gzung ba ste / 'od srungs gang la la zhig bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis dal bkur sti byed par 'dod pa dang / mchod pa thams cad kyis mchod par 'dod pa des /
translated: The first verse shows the worship of the words by means of the worship of the collections, and the second shows the worship of the words by means of the worship of the letters.🔽The first verse shows the worship of the collections by means of the worship of the three vehicles, and the second shows the worship of the collections by means of the worship of the twelve branches of the scriptures.🔽 The first verse shows the worship of the meaning by means of the worship of the truth, and the second shows the worship of the meaning by means of the worship of the stages.🔽The first verse shows the worship of the truth by means of the worship of the two truths, and the second shows the worship of the truth by means of the worship of the four noble truths.🔽 The first verse shows the worship of the stages by means of the worship of the ten stages, and the second shows the worship of the stages by means of the worship of the perfections.

original: dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di kun chub par gyis shig / yi ger bris shig / lhogs shig / long shig /'od srungs de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la bla na med pa'i mchod pa
analyzed: dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di kun chub par gyis shig / yi ger bris shig / lhogs shig / long shig /'od srungs de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la bla na med pa'i mchod pa
translated: The first verse shows the worship of the ten stages by means of the worship of the perfections, and the second shows the worship of the ten stages by means of the worship of the transcendences.🔽 The first verse shows the worship of the perfections by means of the worship of the transcendences, and the second shows the worship of the perfections by means of the worship of the means of attainment.🔽The first verse shows the worship of the transcendences by means of the worship of the six transcendences, and the second shows the worship of the transcendences by means of the worship of the four social practices.🔽 The first verse shows the worship of the means of attainment by means of the worship of the four means of unification, and the second shows the worship of the means of attainment by means of the worship of the four social practices.🔽The first verse shows the worship of the four means of unification by means of the worship

original: byas par 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: byas par 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is what is meant by will be done.

original: bcom ldan 'das dgyes shing de skad ces bka' stsal te /🔽tshe dang ldan pa 'od srungs chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do zhes bya ba ni yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gnas brtan 'od srungs chen po la sogs pa'i dga' bar bstan pas don ji lta
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dgyes shing de skad ces bka' stsal te / tshe dang ldan pa 'od srungs chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do zhes bya ba ni yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gnas brtan 'od srungs chen po la sogs pa'i dga' bar bstan pas don ji lta
translated: The Blessed One was delighted and spoke thus.

original: ba bzhin du mid btags pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs chen po 'di yongs su rdzogs par ston to //
analyzed: ba bzhin du mid btags pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs chen po 'di yongs su rdzogs par ston to //
translated: The Venerable Mahākāśyapa, those bodhisattvas, and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas rejoiced and praised the Blessed One's words. This is the teaching on the joy of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Mahākāśyapa, the elder, and others, who compiled the Dharma. It shows how this great Dharma discourse, which has the meaning of the true nature, is completely taught.

original: rgyal ba'i blo gros kyis ni byed ba cug ste //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i blo gros kyis ni byed ba cug ste //
translated: Jayamati composed it.

original: dkon mchog brtsegs pa bshad pa byas pa yis //
analyzed: dkon mchog brtsegs pa bshad pa byas pa yis //
translated: By explaining the Ratnakuṭa,

original: bsod nams bdag gis thob pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: bsod nams bdag gis thob pa gang yin pa /
translated: whatever merit I have obtained,

original: des ni 'gro ba rgyal ba thob gyur cig /'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las /
analyzed: des ni 'gro ba rgyal ba thob gyur cig /'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las /
translated: May all beings attain the state of the Victorious Ones.🔽This completes the commentary on the chapter of Kāśyapa from the Great Heap of Jewels, a Dharma discourse in one hundred thousand sections.

original: 'od srungs kyi le'u rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon blo brtan gyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'od srungs kyi le'u rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon blo brtan gyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary by the master Sthiramati is complete.
